Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: BSXpress
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was great. Made the horrible transit system in Paris a little easier. The rooms are a bit small and the elevator is tiny. But the staff is great and made our stay very nice. AC worked great for the unseasonably warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MelTrems
Reviews.Content: You're across the street from an RER and a subway, next door to a subway sandwich shop, 2 cafes, and a crepe stand, 4 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Could not be a better location. We had room 304 which is pretty tiny but since all we did was sleep here it wasn't really an issue. The street was pretty loud but turning on the a/c or the tv pretty much drowns it out. The desk staff all spoke fantastic English and were very helpful. The breakfast was very expensive (9-16 euros) for a mediocre plate of eggs and a croissant. I recommend skipping it and heading for the crepe stand next door :) Overall it was a great experience and I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I'd be back in an instant”
Reviews.Author: Weilersa
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of this hotel. And I can honestly say I have never been a fan of any hotel before. Literally right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. 750 meters. All a beautiful walk along the Seine. I won't mislead, it is a small, cozy little room. Which is par for most hotels in Paris, as I understand. But for the price, I thought I got a great deal. The staff is beyond measure. They speak English very well. They went above and beyond getting us everything we needed and offered the best in advice. It is off the beaten path, but amazingly accessible by 2 metro stations. One was outside my window, but I never heard it once during my stay. For a busling neighborhood, it was quite quiet. The decor was modern. It was a nice difference from much of Paris. It is surrounded by resturants and cafes. The corner take out place has amazing crepes. I never ate there (breakfast served only). When I emailed them about details, most came back within a day. They were so incredably helpful. If I had to go back ever again, I wouldn't hesitate to go back there. In fact, I probably insist on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing experience, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie7949
Reviews.Content: I couldnt be more pleased with this hotel! Originally, i booked a triple room but a few days before we arrived, they gave us the same room with a baby bed and saved us over $100 per night! I was surprised they wanted to help save money. And our room, was just off the courtyard! Very private. I left my new sweater in the room by mistake and before our 9 hour flight landed, they had already sent an email asking if they could mail it to us. Hands down, an amazing experience. We will be staying here again when we return. Thank you Eiffel Seine Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Was worried after some reviews - small rooms but FAB location!”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading some reviews - I swear some people complain about every tiny detail!!! We were greeted by a friendly - very good English speaking lady at the desk. The reception area was modern and chic. We had booked 4 rooms but we arrived in Paris early so check in wasn't for another 3 hours - we were planning on dumping our bags - going sight seeing and checking in later. We were delighted to be told 2 of our rooms were ready if we needed to freshen up and put our bags in. The halls are quite narrow - again - this isn't a spacious hotel but get over it. Rooms were small. What else is there to say. For 2 people the rooms are small but we didn't care - we weren't in Paris to sit in our hotel room! They were clean, with a mini bar / fridge which was surprisingly reasonably priced - coffee and tea facilities & a TV - which needed some English channels. We were on the 1st floor right opposite the Metro - this sounds like a bad thing but despite being light sleepers there was hardly any noise. Room was nice and warm - the shower was small but nice and hot and powerful. If you want a hotel with bigger rooms either pay more money or spend the same on a hotel without the great location of this one. If you want a nice, clean hotel just a 3 minute walk from the Eiffel tower - surrounded by lovely patisserie's, shops and cafe's and a metro - then you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: btj123
Reviews.Content: This was a nice small hotel about 15 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. We had a club room, which seemed to be recently renovated. The bathroom was very nice. The room was normal by Parisian standards, maybe a bit small by American standards. The Staff was nice and courteous. There are a few tourist restaurants downstairs, which were great from my 5 year old because they served dinner early. There is also a small breakfast take away a few steps from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “100% great all around!”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect just a couple feet across the street to the metro and a very short walk from the Eiffel tower. Very clean hotel and rooms Rooms are small but that should be expected For a hotel in Paris Staff was always really nice and helpful BEWARE restaurants around the hotel are not recommended all the food was precooked and very very pricy let's just say a still water was 8€ alone

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Monrob24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Eiffel Seine hotel and were very pleased with the stay! We wanted something near the Eiffel Tower and this is very close and plus near a metro. The only thing about the room is that you can't change from heat to AC without them changing all the rooms. So our room was a bit stuffy, but we opened the window and enjoyed the nice Paris evenings. There are great restaurants nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautifully formed!”
Reviews.Author: TWU1
Reviews.Content: Small room but bed very comfortable, lovely little hotel, decor based on Klimt - very stylish. 'Honesty bar' a nice touch. Staff helpful with locations, etc.. Small points - didn't like having to hand in/ask for key when coming in & out - a bit 1970s. Glasses in room not replaced with clean ones after the second night - but no big deal. Please put some hooks on the backs of the doors! Would have been helpful in such a small room. Overall though, would recommend. Fabulous location, enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: drKyriakos
Reviews.Content: Small but clean room,good breakfast,helpful staff,excellent location next to metro station and very close to Eiffel Tower.Very good overall and anyway Paris will make you feel it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: mpfox09
Reviews.Content: This was a great location and a price for a three star hotel. I would definitely recommend this place to friends. It sits right outside the Champs de Mars and the Metro for easy walking. Cafes and Bistros are within a five minute walk and there are some right downstairs. The staff was very helpful and courteous and I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LPZ7777777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing time at Paris and this hotel was part of it. The staff was courteous, helpful, and respectful. The hotel is walking distance to the Sienne River and the Eiffel Tower. The Metro (subway) is right across the hotel, and it has little cafes in the vecinity. One of the staff members recommended great restaurants...we couldnt be happier. I would highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: celiaonthefly
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - we enjoyed it very much. The only issue we had was the shower. The shower head was just a hand held for the bath, so we would have like to have an actual shower to stand under. Other than that, the hotel was very nicely decorated and the staff very friendly. Would highly recommend and we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: markstravels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night weekend stay at Eiffel Seine - Overall we were happy with our stay. Located conveniently for tourists just a 5 minute stroll from the Eiffel tower and across the road from Metro station. batobus and bateaux parisiens platforms just under the tower too. Room clean, modern and very clean. Only let down was the poor replenishment of used toiletries each day. Front desk very helpful and pleasant. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Met and exceeded our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Crock_Croll
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an Orrbitz vacation package for my girlfriend and I, and I wasn't sure what to expect. We were pleseantly surprised. The room was spacious (for Parisian Standards) clean and modern. Our trip was so perfect, I proposed to my girlfriend on a whim with the hotel's staff support. From the moment we arrrived the Eiffel Seine staff went above and beyond to make our trip memorable. Thank you so much for helping us make life long memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: davrule4
Reviews.Content: Great location, Nice staff and clean comfortable hotel. Nothing bad to say for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.....Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: AngeleD14
Reviews.Content: I spent only 2 short days in Paris, but had a fabulous stay at this hotel. Arrived by Eurostar at Gard Du Nord and took the metro (2 lines) right to the hotel...the Bir Hakeim station is literally across the street. A 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The room was small but very comfortable. All staff members that I dealt with were very enjoyable to deal with. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glyn J
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel (two adults) and could not fault it. The rooms are small but we expected that being in Paris. The bathroom had a bath which my wife loved after long walks around Paris and it came with a shower albeit inside the bath, still a bonus. Plenty of hot water and the linen was always fresh and bed was very comfortable. Even though the front of the hotel is opposite the railway and we had a street facing window on the fourth floor we did not notice the trains at any time during the stay. We could even open the window for fresh air, not something you normally get in hotels. The location was what caught our eye when looking for somewhere to base ourselves in Paris. It is only an easy ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and fifteen to the Trocadaro area. There is a cafe and restaurant next door, both serve good food with many other food places down Grenelle Bld. There is an ATM on the next corner and grocery shop too. The free wifi worked perfectly from our room and was even strong enough to hold Skype calls home to the kids. The people on the desk spoke very good English and helped any way they could. Only things to fault were the very small elevator, but it is Paris as I said, and small dark corridors between the rooms, but it added to the boutique feel of the place. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Lumley
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine was a very nice hotel. Rooms were clean and well equipped, the staff were very helpful and friendly, and the location was great, within a 5 minute wall of the Eiffel Tower! I would highly recommend the Eiffel Seine and will definately re-visit on future trips to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: As in the title, the main perk to this hotel is the location; a maximum 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, Bir Hakeim metro station right opposite the hotel and the RER station only a couple of minutes walk away. We stayed in a club room and after reading reviews on here, I emailed the hotel to find out if we would be at the front of the hotel and if we were then could we be as high up as possible. The main reason for this was because of how noisy the street is as well as the metro trains. All club rooms are based at the front of the hotel but they did ensure that we had a room on the 4th floor. Breakfast prices are a bit steep at 16 euros each, so we purchased food from elsewhere, there's plenty of places to purchase fresh food at much cheaper prices...we both wish we could have a croissant right now! Just one more thing, Anne-Cecile is a real credit to the hotel, extremely helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “STILL BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAussie
Reviews.Content: I once again stayed at Hotel Eiffel Seine Paris this time in winter. Warm, welcoming and helpful staff every day of my stay. Reception is Open 24/7. This visit I was on the 5 th floor - there is a lift! My room was large by European standards with a small sofa and King-size comfortable bed. Air conditioning. Tea & coffee making facilities in my room. The bathroom was roomy with large soft, thick towels and quality toiletries. The breakfast room is downstairs and whilst there isn't a huge variety, it provides quite adequate and quality commodities - including local Dammann teas. The Metro and RER (taking you to Versailles) is conveniently just across the road from the hotel connecting you to the whole city and beyond. There is a bridge cross the Seine to the right from which you can view the Eiffel Tower (which is just 2 blocks away). There are numerous good restaurants at the doorstep of the hotel - and even a crepery and t/a Pizza place. Two blocks to the left (or two metro stops to the left and across the road) from the Hotel is a Department store selling clothes & upstairs groceries. Also wander those streets for a variety of take-away delicacies. There are pharmacies nearby and a brilliant bakery. There is a laundrette on the same side of the street as the hotel (to the left) two blocks down where you can do your laundry cheaply if necessary. Everything you need is there or nearby and I would not think of staying anywhere else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but thats all”
Reviews.Author: emol83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Nov 2011 with my husband & 2 children. We were alloctaed a superior room in the courtyard which on first impressions was really lovely but as the evening wore on it got so hot & stuffy in the room we asked could we have the air conditioning on but were told at this time of year it was not needed in Paris! The thermostat in the room read 26hydegrees!! It was so uncomfortable my baby daughter hardly slept & was sweating so much i ended up letting her sleep in just her nappy. Very unfortunate as it ruined our stay there as we hardly slept. They also had a hotel cat which maybe wouldnt bother some people but i am not a cat lover and it was always lying around the chairs in reception dont think it looked very good for the prices this hotel charges. Our bath was in need of replacement too black marks all over it that did not come off. It was however very convenient location wise and this is obviously reflected in the price. I dont think i would stay again quite disappointed. Also another reviewer mentioned about the airport transfer being very long we too had this problem stuck in a taxi for almost 2 hours with 2 small children as they decided to do 4 other pick ups after us. I would just book your own its the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cb2012_12
Reviews.Content: The location is great, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower! Staff were always very helpful. I would definitely stay there again if I ever go back to Paris. New Year's Eve was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great times!”
Reviews.Author: Jp2211
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my girlfriend! It was a great location, right outside is the metro station, it was really quite, and just round the corner from Eiffel tower! The rooms were a bit small, but cosy and clean! The staff were friendly and helpful, I would definitely come back, and definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, next to Eiffel Tower, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Mj2511
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, was only few minutes walk to Eiffel Tower. Clean rooms with nice balcony and style. Nice reasturant next door and many places to eat and get food near by. Would definitely stay again and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming ethos in a great location”
Reviews.Author: smt1810
Reviews.Content: Great location, almost next to the Eiffel Tower and with a Metro / RER station across the road making it easy to get around the city. All the staff were friendly and very helpful, speak excellent English and were very patient with our hesitant school days French. The room was comfortable and, while not big, far more spacious than some city centre hotels. There is a pleasant lounge area and free wi-fi. Being able to leave our cases after we'd checked out until it was time to leave for the airport was a plus. We found a reasonable internet deal for four nights but this is an expensive part of the city so expect to pay more than in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranÃ§ois R
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel on a business trip. It's right next to the RER C so I could get to my workplace easily while still staying in an awesome location. The room was nice, small but practical enough. I've seen smaller in Paris. The bathroom was large enough, though I would have preferred a shower unit to a bath. Everything was working fine, everything was clean, no bad point there. As usual, the breakfast for 16 euros is super expensive. All I need is a croissant and an espresso, so I went to the cafe just next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Superb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Trave1Bug88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a friend and the location is very convenient. The staff is very helpful and provided excellent service. It is right next to the Metro and also a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The room was very clean and nice. We arrived in Paris before the indicated check in time and were afraid we would not be able to check in early but it was fine. The staff is fluent in english and very accommodating! Thank you for making my first trip to France very pleasant! I will be recommending this hotel to all my contacts and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine for our overnight stay in Paris. The location is fantastic, very close to the RER C and Metro. No problem getting around. Left our bags with the conceriege which was a big plus. They speak English well and have a very clean hotel. Beds were a hard, but I think that is common in all Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: marcie5785
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location. Rooms were small, but who goes to Paris to stay in their room?! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Stallion32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day "birthday surprise" break in Paris, which was amazing. The Hotel Eiffel Seine is a lovely 3-star boutique hotel situated on the Blvd de Grennelle, directly opposite the Bir Hakeim metro station (Line 6), and a stone's throw from the Champs Mars Tour Eiffel RER station (yellow line C). We travelled by Eurostar from St Pancras to Gare du Nord, where we found it incredibly easy to get to our hotel - take the RER B line (dark blue) south 2 stops to St Michel Notre Dame, then change and get the RER C line (yellow) west for 4 stops and alight at the aforementioned Champs Mars Tours Eiffel. Follow the directions for the exit Blvd de Grennelle. We were met by a very lovely english speaking lady (in fact, all the staff were fabulous, and very friendly and helpful). Check-in was quick and easy, and our room was on the 1st floor (so not far to take our luggage!). We had booked a Club room which was nice and spacious, with a very comfortable King sized bed, and a very clean and well-stocked bath/shower room. The shower was very nice, constant hot water! The only gripe/complaint we would have was about the location of the room - we were facing the main road, and the metro station, which proved to be a problem at night due to the noisy traffic and building work taking place just below us. We could also here the toilet flushing and the shower in neighbouring rooms which meant disrupted sleeps unfortunately. For the price of a Club room, I would've expected a room at the back of the hotel. I would also say the price of breakfast , at 16 euros each, is too much. There are a couple of cafes just down from the hotel which do breakfast for chepaer, or, if you want a lite breakfast, you can get a croissant or pain au chocolat and an orange juice for 4 euros in the restaurant on the corner of the same road. The location of the hotel is perfect - a stone's throw from the Eiffel Tower (would recommend going on a weekday, early in the morning about 09.00 as the queue is small), and a particular treat at night is that on the hour, when the tower is lit up, the whole tower sparkles for 5 mins - truly amazing and romantic. You can do a vareity of open top bus tours - we took the green open top bus tour, which is a hop on hop off service consisting of 4 lines which take you round various parts of Paris - cost is 29 euros for 1 day which is a definitely worth it! We would recommend taking a stroll along the Seine to the Place de la Concorde and a walk through the gardens to the Louvre is not to be missed! A would also say that the hotel is an excellent base for a day out at eurodisney - you can take the metro from Bir Hakeim (Line 6) north to Charles de Gaulle Etoile (you can visit the Arc de Triomphe from this station too), and then change onto the RER line A (red line) towards Marne - La - Vallee (a 30-45mins trip). Trains are very regular! All in all, our trip was amazing and the hotel very clean and comfortable. Our one recommendation would be to check if your room is facing the road or is at the rear of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nothing to criticize”
Reviews.Author: kdfbug70
Reviews.Content: We were warmly received by English-speaking staff and were made to feel welcome. We chose the "superior" double room, and found it delightful. It was large by Paris standards, well apppointed, comfortable and decorated with taste and charm. Impeccably clean, the room, situated at the rear, was exceptionally quiet, - (although perhaps any rooms to the front of the hotel and facing the very busy road may not perhaps be so lucky). The hotel is really well located, being literally round the corner from the Eiffel Tower, and a few steps across the road from the Bateau Mouches and other river cruise boats. Thoroughly to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rose M
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine Hotel was fantastic. We had a lovely room, and the decor of the place was really cool. The staff were super friendly and had a 24 hour reception and didn't mind us coming in at 5am! The shower was really good. The location was great - right next to two tube stations and only a 5-10 min walk from the Eiffel tower itself. It was also just across the road from the bank of the Seine. Our room faced the courtyard and was very quiet, although the other two in our group faced the road so they couldn't open the window as it was a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel with a 4 star service and attire! Love it :)”
Reviews.Author: indjana01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Impeccable position door to door to the station. Extremely clean and the staff is mega friendly. Our room was a littlw bit small but it was well kept and very sweet :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: rmcwi
Reviews.Content: On a short 3 night break this hotel suited us perfect. For your sightseeing needs there's no better place, directly opposite a metro station and literally around the corner from the Eiffel Tower you really couldn't go wrong if you want to see the sights!! The staff were very friendly and courteous. The room although quite small, which I believe most are around Paris city hotels, was spotlessly clean and came with tv, phone and WiFi (which I feel is a must nowadays) If there was anything negative to say it would be the distance from some of the shopping areas and nightspots but sure you can't have everything, besides one of the most reasonably priced things we found in Paris were the taxis!!! I would defiantly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to see the sights around Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Robin G
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Hotel Eiffel and thought the accommodations were perfect for my needs. The room was compact but nicely decorated and clean, equipped with everything one would need for a comfortable stay. I selected this hotel based on previous reviews and was not disappointed. The location was close to the underground, walk able to the Eiffel tower and the tourist bus as well as eateries and an ATM. The staff was friendly and they were comfortable speaking English. I would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but not good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jenny814109
Reviews.Content: This hotel got perfect location near Eiffel Tower and the tube statation is opposite the hotel. And it also near the RER station. very convenience. The environment and conditions of hotel is very good, clear but litte small. For me, i feel very snug but not suit for family. The problem is the breakfast got very xepensive price but with a few choices. The dining room is very very small. Sleep quality is bad because it is just on the street.

Reviews.Title: “A very good option to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: ybik
Reviews.Content: HÃ´tel Eiffel Seine 3 bd Grenelle 75015 Paris - we stayed for 3 nights, 29th Dec2011-1 Jan 2012.The room and bathroom were not spacious but very cosy, functioning and clean.The room was on the first floor and facing the street and the underground station so it was noisy but not bad /we are normally very fussy about noise-this didn't disturb us!/. Very convenient location, Eiffel Tower 5 min walk. We didn't book a restaurant for New Year's Eve in advance as the cheapest offers were 250 Euro. We went along with advise from other reviews to deal with it on the spot as normally a lot of places are open-and it's true. Tired and on the way back to the hotel at 5pm on 31st Dec we spotted a restaurant that looked nice, booked a table for 10pm /without really looking into it or menu and prices/. It was a huge gamble but it was a fantastic venue, very cosy and elegant;food very nice and 98 Euro per person, drinks not included. We met a lovely couple at the table next to ours and had a fantastic evening. Here's the address: La Gauloise 59 Avenue La Motte Picquet, 75015 Paris, France If you arrive by Eurostar you can go to the hotel very easily and cheaply by underground. If you opt for a cab-find the taxi stand on the side of Gere de Nord. There's a queue but probably cheaper than the unmarked cab driver that approached us at the front, drove as mad, took us ages to get to the place with all the traffic in Paris and costed us dearly without the upfront negotiation /no idea of prices as first trip to Paris/. We didn't find the French people rude or disregarding you as an English speaker-on the contrary-the hotel staff and everywhere we needed service people were very attentive and polite. The hotel offers breakfast, normally 16E but at the time 12E. Next door brasserie offers brunch 10.5 E /coffee, orange juice, croassoint and crepe/. You are better off in the hotel as the food variety is way bigger, you can have as much coffee as you like /paying extra at the brasserie/ and downstairs room very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Winter”
Reviews.Author: mcelfresh28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Eiffel Seine in December and were very happy with the hotel. We read many of the reviews before booking, and it was exactly what we expected and were looking for. The hotel was very nicely decorated and clean, both the common areas and our room. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, even with some guests that we witnessed that demanded a little "extra attention". We did breakfast once, but unless you plan on eating a lot to get your money's worth, either one of the cafes next door or the grocery store down the block is a better, less expensive alternative. Compared to the standard European hotel beds (which tend to be smaller than that in the US), our bed was more like a queen size than a double, which was great. The location is great, a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and across the street or around the corner from both a metro stop and a train stop. All in all, great hotel and would most certainly stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Christopher W
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending five nights at the Hotel Eiffel Seine during Christmas week. The hotel is a lovely 3 star boutique hotel whose staff is very helpful. The location was great, across the street from the Seine and a metro staion. It was a five-ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Everyday you would be greeted by the spectaular sight of the Eiffel Tower as you left the hotel. The rooms were clean with private bath, TV, mini-bar but very small. We thought the petit dejeuner at the hotel was overpriced and instead went next door or down the street to cafes for breakfast. Nevertheless, we would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KellyJS
Reviews.Content: I am a 28 yr old female beauty therapist, and took my mother to Paris for her 60th birthday. This hotel couldn't have been more perfect! As 2 females who had never been to Paris, safety is high priority. This hotel was in a fantastic location, we felt very safe when leaving and returning to the hotel. The staff we're very friendly and helpful and provided any information required. The rooms are very clean and of good condition, and size was plenty good enough for 2 women to get ready in and to get a good nights sleep. The metro is practically opposite which allows direct travel to all tourist attractions. December in Paris is cold but a beautiful time to go with Christmas markets and fantastic illuminations. Notre dame and sacre coure are a must! The river seine and moulin rouge trip was a great night which the hotel staff arranged for us, small group of 6 which was just nice. Spent approx Â£600 over 3 days including food and trips. This was ample unless you are planning some serious shopping! I cannot wait to return to Paris to the hotel Eiffel seine with my boyfriend ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: Evan R
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel couldn't be better. You're an easy walk from the Eiffel Tower, and the two Metro lines you'll be needing the most, including the one to Versailles, are situated across the street and around the corner. You're on the edge of the tourist area, so there are supermarkets, banks, ATMs, a pharmacy, a bakery and a post office, all very close by. Also, may brasseries and cafes. The staff were all VERY pleasant and courteous, and they were all helpful with advice on what to visit, shopping and how to get around, and helped arrange reservations for restaurants, tours, and our cab ride to the airport. The hotel is a small boutique. The rooms are small, but you'll be spending most of your time out and about, anyway. They have a very nice breakfast buffet. We plan on staying at this hotel again the next time we come to Paris. Thank you Hotel Eiffel Seine for a great stay! Evan and Yee Wah

Reviews.Title: “Very memorable and enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are still in Europe celebrating our 2 yr anniversary. We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Dec. 23-28 2011. It was very consistent with the reviews we read. The hotel room was very small, but they mostly are in Europe. The hotel receptionist, a lady, was exceedingly helpful to us. We were in walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and literally right next to the mtero. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Everything is just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ChienHan
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful stay in Eiffel Seine during this Christmas. Everything was just excellent. Great customer service, clean room, good quality bed, superb location (4-5 min walk to Eiffel Tower and 1-2 min walk to Bir-Hakeim Metro) and surrounded by lot of restaurants and cafes. However, the street was quiet at night. Advices from the English speaking staff at the lobby was so helpful, one of them help us to make arrangement for the shuttle to CDG airport with 18 euro per person (taxi would probably cost us around 50 euro) and another one help us to mail our postcards without any charges. Wifi was free, you may acquire as many password combination as you like if you carry more than 1 device per person such as smartphone and laptop. If you are going to bring any laptop, there's a laptop and a printer in the lobby, which guests can use for free. I will definitely stay at Eiffel Seine again if I am going to visit Paris in the future and I will recommend this hotel to my friends. Fabulous stay! Thanks for making our Christmas trip unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Neri23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris for 4 days in early September and was very happy staying at the Eiffel Seine. A lovely boutique hotel in an excellent location - close to the Seine, a 5 min walk from the Eiffel Tower, a metro across the road and plenty of cafes & restaurants close by. Room lovely & clean, free Wifi and helpful reception staff. Would have no hesitation staying here again, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieAB
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel! A gorgeous boutique hotel with so much charm, that is perfectly located for a stay in Paris- across the street from the station and only 5-10 min walk from the Eiffel Tower. Such a central location that it was so easy to get to any of the tourist attractions, but despite all of this the street was surprisingly quiet. The rooms were extremely clean, the hotel had a great buffet breakfast available and free wifi. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: Graham C
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be located in a very good position. The staff were helpul and friendly. We stayed three days and had breakfast at the hotel each day. It was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jagdevg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 14th December 2011 for two nights for my 40th birthday. We are soooo glad we picked this hotel as opposed to a higher star rated big chain hotel! It is a great little hotel in a fantastic location with very helpful English speaking staff who are always willing to help and provide advice about the sites and places to eat. It is really nicely decorated and very very clean, no nasty smells or dirty linen or towels! It is 2 mins from the Champ de Mars Eiffel tour RER station and only a couple of steps from the Bir Hakeim metro station. We paid 18 euros for both of us one way from Gharles de Gaulle on the RER B, changed at Notre Damme for Line C to Champ de Mars - it only took 50 mins from the airport to our room! There is an abundance of restaurants, bistros, bakeries, pharmacies and supermarkets all on the same street and the Eiffel Tower is a 2 or 3 minute walk away!! Yes the rooms are a little small but everything else more than makes up for this! We would definitely come back and stay in the summer with the kids and use it as a base for Paris and Euro Disney as the RER trains and Metro are so easy to use. Don't waste your time looking any where else...stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Dri89
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights , haven't got anything to complain about. Staff were friendly Location was great Room was clean ..... Will definitely be stay here next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Near to Effil and Clean room”
Reviews.Author: 25Amit25
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 2 days and I must say everything was perfect except the size of rooms which I think is common in paris, the best thing was 'subway' just next to the hotel and a supermarket two minutes walk from ther hotel, this is good place to stay for family and couple who are looking for hotel near the tower and some eating place. I would highly recommend. Plus free WIFI in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Clean, nice, affordable, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: MrHolland73
Reviews.Content: We rolled into Paris 4hrs (!) before official check-in and the multi-lingual gentleman at reception was more than happy to give us the keys to our room. The room was small, but for the price we paid it was excellent and all we needed to make love (25x in 2 days), sleep and have a shower (hey, thats what Paris is for!). Without kidding, its a tiny walk to the Eiffel Tower and even shorter if you cut through the street along front of the Pullman Hotel. There are a whole bunch of cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel and there is a Subway right beside the hotel if in fact you dont fancy baguette & brie for lunch.. I totally recommend Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris. I give this place 5-Stars!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location and helpful staff, couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, next to metro:)”
Reviews.Author: Tessan82
Reviews.Content: Great hotel next to The metro!! Close to walking areas like Eiffel tower and siene.. And just a couple of stops from the Champs Elysse;) The staff speak good english. Nice area around The hotel with Ã  couple of restaurants. The room was clean and The size was good. Our wiew was The Metro and at The water(siene) I recommend you to stay Here!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: xqs368
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel via Booking.com, and got the formal hotel booking confirmation from booking.com. When I got the hotel at 10.30 pm, the hotel even told me there was no room for me. I contacted the Booking.com immedietly via a long distance call, and was told the hotel was overbooked, I have to wait 2 hours to change to another hotel. It was raining heavily outside and I got a cold. After that, I complained for compensation, the hotel even refused to compensate! How worse it is. Luckly, booking.com has made up some.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay (again and again and again)”
Reviews.Author: Nomisiacat
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we stayed at this hotel. We love it here. It's so convenient and easy to get to. About 45 min ride on the RER from the airport and it's right on line 6 Metro. I would stay here again and again. Yes, the rooms are small but clean. Yes, the bathrooms are small but clean AND you really don't spend much time in the hotel so it doesn't matter. You are there to sleep, that's it. We left the room at about 10am each day and returned at night. This is the first time we tried the breakfast in the hotel, as it is now only 8 euros, compared to the in-season 16 euros and it was definitely well worth it. For 8 euros a person you get a small breakfast buffet. Everything is fresh and delicious! If you want to eat outside, there a plenty of options but I recommend a small bakery called Legros just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. YUM.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Art Deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodriq
Reviews.Content: A simple hotel with nice decoration. Although the room was a bit small, it was clean and well kept. Most employees at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Great location in front of a Metro station, less than 100 m from a RER-system station and rather close to Eiffel Tower. Several places around for a good breakfast (cheaper than the hotel buffet, which we did not try). Totally recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: LondonDarjeeling
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights, on business, by myself. I want my hotel room to be silent and pitch black, with a comfortable bed and a good shower. Room 11 met these criteria. It was on the ground floor, across a tiny internal courtyard from the hotel foyer, with the door opening onto the courtyard. Two other rooms are like this. That will not suit everyone - and you would get wet getting to breakfast if it was raining, and there is no view at all, and the room was modern and not particularly atmospheric. But it suited me, as it meant no corridor noise, and no central heating gurgles, no-one above or below me (and the room adjoining was empty). It had no view - and the glass was frosted - but that did not bother me, as I was only there after dark, and was either working or asleep. Views always mean noise, and that is a trade-off I don't want to make. The heating/aircon was very quiet - the quietest I have ever encountered. The bed was comfortable, the shower worked, and there was a small desk with a comfortable stool. It was Parisian sized, but as a Londoner I know that rooms are small. It wasn't too small for two, by any means. I did not eat breakfast there, or use the "honour system" hotel bar. The staff was courteous and unobtrusive. Check in was swift, and I was taken to my room and shown how to work the lights. (one was broken, but there were so many I did not bother to report it - the lighting was good). It is opposite a metro stop, although perhaps not the best one to be opposite. It is near the Eiffel Tower, but not central per se. It is a pleasant walk to the OECD (20-25 mins). The street it is on is ok, but nothing special. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Eiffel Tower and easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: jc2516
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris yesterday and stayed at Eiffel Seine. I'm absolutely glad I booked this hotel because it's close to everything. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower, has restaurants beside it which are very good and reasonable price. There is also a grocery store on the same block if you are on a tight budget and would like to buy bottled water, soda etc. (They can be really pricey if you get them somewhere else). The metro is across the hotel and could take you pretty much all over Paris. I like the fact that after walking all day, I had to literally cross the street from the Metro to our hotel and don't have to walk too far. The staff are very nice as well. Mostly everybody speaks fluent English. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody that wishes to visit Paris. The only negative thing I could think of is that the elevator is really small. It only fits 2 people with their hand carry luggage at a time. The rooms are small, but it was not a problem for us. The beds are comfortable which is important. Although we could hear the people on the other room talking and giggling, I was hoping it was more sound proof :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - very Malmaison esc - couldn't be closer to a Metro stop and literally round the corner from Eiffel Tower. Very friendly staff - take the oportunity to drink at the honesty bar - half the cost of prices in the cafes. Spotlessly clean - rooms are small but Paris is too good a city to spend any time in a hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CathV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, it is close to everything you need to see for a short stay in Paris. The hotel is very clean and the staff are very helpful. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the tourist district.”
Reviews.Author: Ylorac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while in Paris. The hotel is very clean with windows that open to the courtyard. It is surprisingly quiet since it is in the center of "tourist alley", a few blocks from the Tour Eiffel and the Seine. The staff was very helpful. When 2 persons in our party didn't like their room, they graciously exchanged it for another. The rooms are small, as are most European rooms, but the service was good and the desk managers were very helpful -- a plus since this was our first time in Paris. A breakfast was included in our plan and it was delicious. My only complaint is the coffee -- too weak!!! If you are looking for a hotel that is removed from the tourist area, I wouldn't recommend it as it reminds me of International Drive in Orlando, only on a smaller scale. A plus --- is that the Eiffel Seine is right across froom the Bir-Hakim Metro station which makes it very easy to get around Paris. There is also a very sweet cat that lives there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crawfurd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is in an ideal situation for exploring central Paris. Our room was very clean and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow- great boutique hotel with Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: flacachula
Reviews.Content: Location, location- across the street from the Metro stop-Bir Hakiem walking distance to the Eiffel tower- Rooms are small but its Europe- The lift is very small but again its Europe- They have luggage room for your stuff after you check out- they also have a honesty bar- how cool it that and its located at the lobby- Housekeeping very nice- Beds SUPER SUPER comfy

Reviews.Title: “Distinctively three-star experience”
Reviews.Author: kylelsim
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Opposite the Bir-Hakim Metro and a block away from the champ de mars. Stayed at three hotels during the course of my French sojourn and the staff here are well, not the friendliest lets just say. Other than that, the rooms are decent, slightly cramped but clean and neat. Toilet is clean and bright as well. Again, stay here for the location, but don't expect too much from the eateries around the area. all just out to trap unsuspecting tourists. do some research online. a quick google of best paris food will lead you on a culinary adventure that you won't regret.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room I've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Jrscgsr
Reviews.Content: First night in Paris and we checked in late at 10pm to the smallest rm I've ever stepped in. Rm 606 was so small we couldn't lay out suitcases down to get clothes out! I've heard that Paris hotel rooms were small but it was ridiculous. The beds were soft and mostly comfortable. Rooms were overall clean and in decent shape. The elevator could be heard from our room every time it turned on all night, thank god we were deep sleepers and exhausted from traveling. We left the next day for the Ramada down the street and couldnt be happier with the decision

Reviews.Title: “Made for a Perfect French Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: AndraMaryland
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine Hotel was absolutely beautiful! The staff was super friendly and extremely helpful. They were happy to point us to their favorite authentic French restaurants, which was a huge help in such a touristy area. The Eiffel Tower is literally a walk around the corner, which allowed for multiple trips and picnics in the gardens. The Metro is right outside the hotel, but wasn't loud at all! There is a convenient market on the same block if you're looking for picnic food and wine at a great price! The rooms are small, but that is to be expected in Europe. They were clean, beautifully decorated, and quiet. The only weird thing was you had to turn in your key as you left the hotel. My fiance and I were in and out of the room so often, I felt I was becoming a bother to the front desk asking for my key every hour. Also worth pointing out is the hotel's breakfast. Priced at 16 Euro a piece, it was not worth it!! There are plenty of spots surrounding the hotel to grab a delicious coffee and pastry for very reasonable prices. All in all, The Eiffel Seine offered a perfect stay in the perfect city! We will stay here again in future travels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Wonderful Staff !!”
Reviews.Author: mdkuschel
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. We were directly across the street from the RER train and Bir Hakeim metro station making transportation a breeze to all of the local attractions. Plus the Eiffel Tower was a short 2 blocks around the corner -- which is also one of the stops for the definite must-do L'Open Bus Tour if spending a few days in Paris !! We stayed in Room 403 directly overlooking the metro stop and the River Seine ... while it can get a little noisy on the weekends, it wasn't anything more than we expected given the location. If you are a light sleeper, though, I would ask for an interior room. The size of the room was perfect for what we needed. It was one double bed (quite comfortable), a small fridge, a coffee/tea pot and a bathroom with a shower. Some peope have commented that the rooms felt small, but even with 2 decent size pieces of luggage, we were able to navigate around them just fine. For the amount of time spent in the room, it was just fine. Very quaint. and very clean ! I cannot say enough about the hotel staff. Everyone was EXTREMELY nice to us from the moment we arrived. We ran into a little "issue" at the train station at Notre Dame RER B to RER C (our wallet with our passports and money and credit cards were stolen as soon as we arrived in Paris !!!) All of our hotel staff was so accomodating and did everything they could to help facilitate the process of getting us to our US Embassy, to the french police station (even making phone calls for us as our french was very limited) -- we never could have done it without their help !! I cannot say enough about how wonderful we were treated by the staff -- they were truly amazing to us in such a difficult time. Words cannot express how greatful we are to the help they provided us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Melody D
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eiffel was a perfect location directly across from the Metro and our room had a small view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. The elevator and accomodations were much smaller than those here in the States but it just goes to prove that bigger is not necessarily better. I enjoyed the quaintness of the hotel. The staff were helpful and courteous and had no problems communicating in English. I would have no qualms about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EU2011
Reviews.Content: We took RER from the airport. The train station does not have elevator. Do not take the RER if you have large heavy bags. We were tired by the time we arrived at the hotel. The receptionist is very kind and speak English well. The decor is modern and cozy. The entire building is carperted. The elevator & room are very tiny if you compare with North America standard. The room is similar to NY Hotel - Compact. Our air conditioning is not working, it is quite noisy when the window is opened. (our room is facing the metro station). Both of us are up at 6am everyday. 2 English TV channel, Safe, Coffee / Tea maker, Towel, mini bar, are provided.

Reviews.Title: “Beauitful”
Reviews.Author: Pocanat
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful view of the tower. Only ten minutes walk from the hotel to the tower. Staff were was polite and helpful :-)

Reviews.Title: “1st Wedding Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Cmyappletart
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. I had emailed in advance of our stay to request a quiet room and to ask the hotel to make restaurant reservations on our behalf. Both requests were taken care of promptly. The hotel is located across the road from a Metro Station and a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. The room was clean but there was some staining on the carpet and the bathroom could do with a good scrub as the grouting on the tiling looked a bit grubby but I am a clean freak and always notice these things. Other negatives would be that the air conditioning was turned off for the Winter and the room did get very warm. Also, the shower was very slow in draining. All in all, I would stay here again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoseandPeterontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel and I would recommend it. Our room, 605 ,was clean and although it had a balcony that overlooked a Metro line, there was little to no noise. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. The location is great and the hotel is a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Metro. The line outside only runs to The Arc de Triomphe. We had a few WiFi issues at the hotel but theses may have been iPhone related. To get to the hotel, take the Metro to Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel then walk with the River Seine to the right. When you come to the point where a metal Metro bridge crosses the river, turn left ,and the hotel is on your left. I only add this because there are numerous exits from the Metro station and it is easy to get disorientated!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandreax
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on a stopover for one night. We had actually misplaced the directions to the hotel, but were able to find it without a map based on its proximity to landmarks! Our room was tidy, romantic and stylish. The staff were very hospitable, and also arranged our transfers to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: We found nothing to dislike about this very friendly hotel; excellent location with the proximity of Metro, buses and restaurants; and of course the Eiffel Tower! The staff were unfailingly courteous and all spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: OnATour
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was nothing short of impressed. Friendly staff who spoke excellent English, comfortable room and in an excellent location with a metro station opposite. Was travelling with my sister and needed a twin room, when we got to our room the bed bed was made as a double so spoke to the reception lady who rectified this without any problems. Zero complaints and would definately stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueFever
Reviews.Content: first time visit Paris in the end of August and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It's 5 minutes walk to Eiffel tower and next to Metro and train across from the street. The staff was friendly and can speak English. The room is clean and quiet while closing the window even though it's on a busy street. There are bakery and restaurant next door, so easy to get breakfast. You can find grocery store nearby in 2 minutes walk. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pastriesanyone
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently took a Day trip to Paris, with an overnight stay. We looked at hotels online and wanted to be next to the Eiffel Tower. We finally decided on the Eiffel Seine Hotel. It was a good choice, why? well for starters it was reasonably priced, and although it didn't have a view of the Eiffel tower, when you stepped out the front door of the hotel and walked to the corner (17 steps, I counted), there was the Eiffel Tower. We were pleasantly surprised at our room too. Though small by some standards, it had a full bath and nice view, and a safe. What made them extra ordinary was the staff... They were courteous, provided information, and were willing to help you. We wanted a nice place to enjoy a French dinner, and they came through with flying colors... Made a reservation for us and the food was awesome, and reasonably price. On the day we left, we weren't going to leave until 9:00 pm in the evening. They held our bags in a concealed location, and even let us freshen up before our trip home. It was a great experience, and a great hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: symr00
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week stay at Hotel Eiffel Seine. We booked through Orbitz after reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor. No disappointments whatsoever. The front desk staff were all very polite, professional and friendly. This hotel is a perfect location for a Paris vacation. The Eiffel tower is a realistic 10 minute walk up the street, the Metro is directly across the street. Our window actual faced the metro and street which was a bit noisy with the window open, but completely quiet when the window was closed. There's no A/C in the room so we had the windows open whenever we were in the room. Our room was tastefully decorated and although small for American standards, it was the largest I had seen out of other hotel options in Paris, the bathtub is HUGE, but the shower head is placed in an awkward spot which gets water all over the floor. We were on the first floor and did not hear any other guests through the walls or others' televisions. The door is a solid 200lb door and blocked out any hallway noise if there was any. There is a 24 hour honor bar in the lobby which is nice, and they serve breakfast downstairs but we never ate breakfast there. There is a great Italian restaurant next door with fantastic pizza and pasta, friendly waters and great service, a Subway sandwich shop which we tried to eat at once, but was out of almost every meat ingredient. There's a french cafe on the other side of the hotel which serves decent food and a small "take away" stand connected to that that serves one euro espressos and the best chocolate crepes and croissants we had in Paris. With the Metro across the street, we were able travel to all the attractions we had on our itinerary right from that stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mrs58
Reviews.Content: We returned from staying at this hotel yesterday and it definitely is in a fantastic location with the Eiffel Tower a stones throw away. We booked through Eurostar and reviewed the hotel before we made our choice. Yes the room was small and I did ask to be moved because it was extremely hot in the room and the air-con didn't seem to be working. Also we were at the front of the hotel and could not sleep with the window open as it was so noisy outside. It was no problem and we were given a room facing the courtyard. The staff were very helpful and gave info and directions. The room was lovely and clean as was the rest of the hotel.Nice to have the honesty bar and access to Internet . We went to the Lido (show with dinner) which wasn't value for money. Take loads of money because its 4 euros for a CUP of coffee (I thought the French were a coffee nation and would at least offer mugs).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pity about the guests!”
Reviews.Author: Natdavebem
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was relaxing and great fun. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location - 5 minutes away from the Eiffel tower and right across the road from the metro which ia a cheap and effective way to get to major sites. The rooms are beautifully presented - decor very stylish. They are on the small side - and if in a double you will just need to find a way around each other! But let's face it who is going to spend a lot of time in their hotel room when in Paris? Rooms are also impressively clean! Staff were very friendly and helpful. They organized tours for us to Versailles and recommended some fantastic places to eat. The only let down with our stay were the other guests. As this is a small hotel, and the walls are paper thin you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on outside your room. Some guests have little awareness of this fact and we were woken continually by our neighbors who insisted on having all their conversations in the hallway at all hours. If you are a light sleeper it may be worth considering before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Kiwis on Holiday”
Reviews.Author: bellhousenz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris and had an awesome experience The hotel was situated just a short walk from the Eiffel Tower, which was very close also to the l'open bus tour hop on hop off bus stop. Situated across the road from the metro which we didn't use, as the hop on hop off provided us with all our transport needs. We felt the room was a great size very well appointed clean, air conditioned and quiet, we didn't hear anything with the windows closed. Staff and services in the hotel were great, we had our transfer to the airport booked for us, and that went without a hitch. We were given advice on where to eat and the restaurants were in very easy walking distance from the hotel. We can recomend the hotel and would stay there again in a heart beat. Thank you to all who made us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: glennmichael
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with Paris and the location of this hotel definitely helped. The location was great! We were walking distance to shopping, all public transportation, crepe stands and more. The rooms are small but you're in Paris so you do not need large rooms. When we arrived the lady at the desk was very helpful and kind. The hotel was immaculate and enjoyed grabbing a quick breakfast on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not without a couple of negatives”
Reviews.Author: mattymjp
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Eiffel Seine Hotel in Paris, the price was decent and the hotel, room and bathroom extremely clean. The hotel is located a 10 - 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower with a Metro station across the street which we used to visit most of the other sites. The hotel staff are friendly and quick to offer advice should you require it. Unfortunately we did experience some negatives. We were expecting the hotel room to be small and it certainly was, our room had the smallest wardrobe I have ever seen (less than the width of a clothes hanger). The air conditioning was not working so even though it was October the room got very hot during the night. It also seemed to be quite noisy at night, there was little or no sound from outside but a fair amount of banging in the hotel, probably from people returning home late. We were also woken on our first night by a loud buzzing which went on for about 20 minutes, we eventually concluded this was someone buzzing to be let in the hotel. We didn't try the breakfast due to the high price, instead we used the Grocery store down the street to purchase Croissants, Pain Au Chocolate's and orange juice for a quarter of the price. Overall I would recommend this hotel however, it is clean, reasonably priced (we booked via the Eurostar website), and is in a good location for sightseeing. PS My wife and I used the location of the hotel to beat the worst of the queues to go up the Eiffel Tower by joining them at about 9.15, 15 minutes before it opened. That way, come 9.30 we only had a 20 minute wait to reach the front (I suspect it would heve been at least an hour during the day), also it almost ensures you can travel all the way to the top should you wish (sometimes they temporarily stop this due to congestion)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline A
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for the Eiffel Tower and close to a number of restaurants. The hotel was clean and we were given all of the support that we needed. The lift is small but this is to be expected in an old Parisian building. The hotel is conveniently located almost in front of Bir Hakeim metro station and Champs de Mars RER station, but we experienced no noise or inconvenience from either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mattscarbro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our honeymoon for 6 days, and I have to say that I will definitely plan to stay here again! The location was perfect! Walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and the metro station is literally right across the street which really allowed us to explore the city. There are 3 restaurants in the same strip as the hotel so finding a place to eat is not a problem. Our room was average size considering the size of most rooms in Paris and it faced the street with the metro station. I was concerned about the noise but to my surprise, you could hardly hear anything with the windows closed. The staff was very helpful in making suggestions, providing directions and arranging for airport shuttles and restaurant reservations. The breakfast in the morning is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “art deco/boutique = small”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location but many other thing about it just grate like rip-off. the claim is that it;s been redecorated to an art deco style . What they mean is small. The room room didn't even have an airline aisle around the bed -- and thus nowhere to put my suitcase down. the bed is a double, but i can't imagine two people having to share this room. the bathroom is clean, and a little small. But shower is such that water gets all over the floor when one uses Lastly two complaints on policy: the hotel seems to have a policy that they just will not check people in, even when the room is available, before 2pm. Why is this? I was there around noon, and saw room keys galore -- each sorted in the proper place, and they still wouldn't release the room until "after 2pm." Secondly, when one checks out, the hotel keeps your credit card number. they refuse to destroy it, even after they have had suficient time to check the room for damages. this goes against international practice where hotels will tear up the credit card guarantee authorizations when you check out. The guy at the reception acted as if i was out of order for asking this. In all fairness, he did reply NO (or a very begrudging yes) to most requests so i was never sure whether they held the credit card number out of policy or just because the receptionist was obstinate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first Paris experience!”
Reviews.Author: mcadams76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris October 11-13, as a side trip during a vacation to visit family in Germany. It was helpful to do some research in advance, since we took the train from Germany to the Paris Gare de lâ€™Est station. Hotel Eiffel Seine was very easy to access via the metro, since it is right across from the Bir-Hakeim (Tour Eiffel) stop. Our room was ready when we checked in around 2:00, and the hotel staff was pleasant and welcoming. The staff was extremely helpful in recommending nearby restaurants for lunch. Our French language skills were limited, but the staff were accommodating in speaking English, as well as recommending high quality restaurants that were patient with customers with limited French proficiency. Hotel staff also helped us to discover restaurants that were not so â€œtouristyâ€� but had excellent food for a reasonable price. Our room was on the second floor, in a nice quiet corner away from the elevator. Although the elevator was small, we rarely had to wait and easily took the stairs at times. We found that the room and bathroom were just right, comparable to some boutique hotels in New York City. The room overlooked a quiet courtyard, and it was refreshing to open the windows in the morning. We did not mind leaving the key with the front desk each time we left the hotel; in fact, each time we returned to pick up the key, we enjoyed nice conversation with the hotel staff and learned something new or interesting about the area. On our second night, there were delicious croissants and coffee available in the lobby. We had late evening tickets for the Eiffel Tower on our second night also, so we especially appreciated the close walk from the hotel. There were a few restaurants around the corner from the hotel that remained open late, which was also convenient. Overall, we had no complaints during our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we are able to make another trip to Paris in the future. Thank you Eiffel Seine for a memorable stay, and for contributing to an enjoyable trip!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, stylish room”
Reviews.Author: LBinCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few blocks from the Eiffel tower and also the double decker bus station which is a good way to get an overview of the city and have on and off transportation at all the major sites. Subway right out front also. The room was small as most rooms in city centers are, but had recently been renovated and was very comfortable boutique style to it. Bed was comfortable, tea in room, bathroom decent size with bath and top shower head. Front desk staff welcoming and helpful. Had to leave the room key each time we left, not sure why, but not a problem as someone was at front 24 hours. Would stay here again. I highly recommend the ham/egg/cheese crepes at the "takeaway" stand just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: N0rway39
Reviews.Content: We visited hotel Eiffel Seine in October. This is a small hotel and you get value for the money. Rooms er small, but confortable og clean. Free internet is working well. The staff is very friendly, especially Mrs. Frederique ( nor shure spelling). Subway and local train station is just outside the hotel. Eiffel tower is about 5 min to walk. We enjoyd our stay. There is a cat living in the hotel and she is calm and a nice attraction for the kids. We will be back for shure! We recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: SteveB15
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, super location and plenty of hot water. Ten minute walk along the Seine to the Eiffel tower and just a quick step across the road is a Metro entrance. Hotel Staff is very helpful and the hotel 'guard-cat' is adorable. Good access to WiFi in the rooms plus they offer free use of a laptop and printer in the lobby which comes in handy when buying tickets online or confirmation/printing of airline tickets. Restaurants and grocery stores nearby add to the convenience. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the view - our room overlooked the Elevated Metro across the road - and the breakfast was a little pricey at 16 Euros but I seldom eat in a hotel when there is a whole city to discover. I will most definitely stay here my next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a boutique Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: ker93
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Literally across the street from both the RER C and Metro 6 lines. Restaurants 10 steps from the front door (including a great spot for take away fresh made crepes). A 10 minute stroll along the Seine to the Eiffel Tower. Small rooms, but clean rooms and comfortable beds. We were in Room 501, with a view of a courtyard. Not a great view, but very quiet. Great to have free Wifi and access to a printer to print out last minute ticket purchases! Hotel staff super friendly and helpful, with great English skills. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia L
Reviews.Content: We are accustomed to standing at the desk to check in at hotels that we have stayed in throughout our travels. When you check in at the Eiffel Seine you are greeted with a smile and invited to sit at the desk. The service is so personal, friendly, and very helpful. This hotel was our last stop in Europe before returning home to Canada and it was our best exprience. The hotel is very small, beautifully decorated, and offers many complimentary services (internet, breakfast, refreshment bar). It is across from the Metro station and the hotel reception was extremely helpful in mapping out all of our journeys in Paris. The other wonderful part was the family room that we recieved. The door in the corridor locked providing additional privacy between the two hotel rooms that we booked for the 4 of us. Our daughters had one hotel room and we had another. The rooms were small but the beds were comfortable, extremely clean, and the rooms were decorated beautifully. Did I mention the 2 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the lovely cafes steps away? I would absolutely recommend this hotel. Thank you to the Eiffel Seine Hotel for making our final stop in our Europe journey an exceptional one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location!”
Reviews.Author: paw0105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night at the end of our four day and trip and we wish that we had stayed here the entire time. We were at a cheaper hotel outside of the city for the first three nights and by the time that you added the Metro fares, coffee bills and mostly our valuable time on the subway you can quickly justify the small additional amount to stay here. For the price and the location I'm not sure how you can beat this place in Paris. The rooms were large for Paris standards, clean, bright and very quiet. The coffee/tea makers in the room was a big plus and the walking distance to the Eiffel tower and the Metro stop made this hotel perfect for us. If/when we are ever back in Paris we will be staying at the Eiffel Seine!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Eileen M
Reviews.Content: My husband travels for business and we have stayed at many of the "grand" hotels and many of the "boutique" hotels in Paris. This one is a gem. Very charming and clean with a friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely recommend. The area is close to restaurants, metro, and of course the Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, great value...”
Reviews.Author: KDel73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a sister trip for 4 nights at end of September. Great location. Across the street from metro and up block from RER train and Eiffel Tower. We used trains entire time.. Much cheaper than a taxi. Room was small compared to American standards but clean. We weren't in room much at all. Its Paris! Bed was comfortable, bathroom modern and clean. Few things: Elevator was so small!!!! And no irons in room. You have to conference room to iron your clothes . Interesting but was fine. You have to also leave your key at desk when leaving hotel. If you come back after a certain time, you have to ring bell to let you. Not a big deal but something all should be aware of. Staff was nice, some more helpful then others. They speak English which was comforting. Do not eat breakfast in hotel. So many places around hotel to eat and cheaper. Great crepe place up block. ;) all in all great hotel and so affordable compared to other Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber I
Reviews.Content: And you can't ask for a better location. So close to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine River with immediate accessibility to metro, tour buses, restaurants and shopping. It made our holiday so easy and enjoyable, plus the hotel staff are extremely helpful. The rooms are simple but stylish, clean and comfortable. They are a teeny bit on the small side, but barely a sacrifice considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “5 Minute Walk to Eiffel Tower and 1 Minute walk to Seine River”
Reviews.Author: tambyistherajah
Reviews.Content: Great Location and therefore good value for money. So close to eiffel tower and seine river, opposite tube so easy access to anywhere in Paris. Staff were helpful. Rooms were small but adequate and most importantly they were clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Larry T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine for four wonderful nights in an early autumn Paris. The weather was fantastic and so was our stay. The ES was a very well-kept boutique hotel a half block from the Seine, across the street from the metro, and a few blocks walk from the Eiffel Tower. It straddles the 7th, 15th, and 16th arrondissements, where the 7th's is a lively section with the Eiffel Tower, the 16th, across the river is home to the Trocadero district and the 15th is a very nice and more residential neighborhood. It is quiet enough to sleep, and close enough to get anywhere quickly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They on an number of occasions helped us find restaurants, shopping, sites, and directions. While the room was small by American standards, it was nice sized by European boutique hotel standards, and was clean, well appointed, and quiet. All and all, we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and lovely”
Reviews.Author: junemagpie
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail at this hotel is what makes it nice. Although our room was very small, it was well laid out. The bed was very comfortable and the entire room clean. The tea/coffee service is a nice plus. Also appreciated the in-room safe. The staff for the most part was very helpful - Samuel was exceptional. One of the big negatives is the noise factor. Our room (506) was right by the elevator and it was quite noisy - the first night I thought I heard thunder and then realized it was the elevator, as people were coming and going for a good part of the night it was a bother.You could also hear activity in the other rooms. Another issue for me was the fact that the hallway lights are motion activated. The black lacquer doors and overall dark decor made it nearly impossible to see until the lights came on which was NOT instantaneous but, took several seconds. Someone could hide in the hallway or stairwell and you would not see them. The location was very good - just a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine where you could catch the BatoBoat which was excellent. Good cafes and markets close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good - Book Here!”
Reviews.Author: BDHughes
Reviews.Content: Looking for a great location, good clean rooms, value for money, great service? Don't want to pay 4 or 5 star prices? Stop looking - Book Here! The rooms aren't large by US or Australian standard, but they're not cramped like some European places, because the furniture is built to suit. Don't expect a lounge suite or large desk for instance. However there was a desk, chair, cupboard, side tables, tea/coffee, flat TV etc. Just a few tiny chips and cracks in places.The bathroom was really quite nice, clean with good appointments. The bed was quite firm and perfect for me. Great location at the western end of Paris attractions, Metro is across the road, 5 min walk to Eiffel Tower, Statue of Liberty or RER train. The foyer and breakfast room were both tastefully and delightfully decorated. Breakfast had a good range (ie cooked, continental, cereal, etc), although not a great number of each type (the cooked option was only scrambled egg, sausage and bacon). The foyer had an 'honour' bar for drinks plus tea and coffee, very nice. There's no restaurant for evening meals, but there must be at least 6 on the street either side. All quite reasonable value.
