There's a good sized supermarket a few minutes walk on the same street. Staff were all very friendly; thanks Ann, Frederique and others. Just start with Bonjour (day), Bonsoir (evening) and end with Merci (thanks), smile/laugh and it never goes wrong. Given the range and number of hotels in Paris I consider myself completely blessed to have stumbled across this gem. Merci Beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: franklyn and lo... m
Reviews.Content: We checked out of our hotel 9/26/2011, and are very happy to give this lovely hotel our satisified review. We feel it met our expectations. Our choice was made by reading reviews from past patrons, and it served us well. Staff was most helpful and friendly. The bed was so comfortable and the bath was just as nice. Very quite and so nicely located right across from the Metro and near so many places to eat. The cleanliness of the rooms and hotel in general makes a really great impression and experience. A great place to enjoy all that Paris has to offer! Will stay again if we make a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Girlgolfpro
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine Hotel is a nice hotel. The room was very clean. The bathroom had a modern raised bowl sink and a bathtub/shower combination. I find that European beds are often more firm than in the US but ours was quite comfortable and the pillows good. The folks at the reception desk were quite nice and very helpful. The location is less than a block from the Seine River and an easy 10-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. We prefer this side of Paris and having the subway right across the street is ideal. My only minor negatives would be the elevator is quite tiny and a bit bumpy and for some reason they do not supply wash clothes in the bathroom. To be fair we did not inquire if any were available. Since Paris hotels tend to be quite pricey we thought this was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “If you only go to Paris once...”
Reviews.Author: NOTurTYPE
Reviews.Content: This would be the place to stay! The hotel was cozy and the staff were all more than helpful. The rooms were a bit small however, realize you're in Paris and they're at or above the standard here. The bed was comfortable, plenty of hot water in the shower and the room was very quiet. We were located in the back of the hotel and did not have a street view - However, from what friends told us who were up front, the windows were sound proof. The location of the Eiffel Seine Hotel is what pulls it all together. When you walk out the front door, the Metro (Bir Hakeim) stop is directly across the street. This train will take you to the Arc de Triumph, and with one connection, to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Don't feel like the Metro? It's a 25 minute walk to the Louvre! Or simply walk right around the corner and observe that the Eiffel Tower is two blocks away! The RER trains to the airport can be is located right before you hit the Tower. You're surrounded by dining options and nightlight.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, very clean, no-frills, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: brinabean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on our Sep 2011 trip to Paris. Metro/RER (6, C) was right across the street and the bus lines along the Seine are minutes away. The Eiffel Tower is about a 5 min walk and the Trocadero is like 10 to 15. The room was small, but more than sufficient (hopefully you won't be spending a lot of time in your hotel room). The elevator is tiny - only 3 people max at a time. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, the room itself, and the comfort of the beds. Also, free coffee and tea in the room everyday (via electric kettle) and also downstairs in the lobby in the afternoon. Free wi-fi or complementary laptop in the lobby. The professional photos here on tripadvisor accurately depict the hotel. The staff was very helpful. We were very satisfied with our stay in the Hotel Eiffel Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueTwo
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Metro and RER. Good pan aux raisin at the cafe shop next door. Room was clean and modern but ours was VERY small (others looked larger). Nice shower and bed. Very friendly staff (one minor exception not worth going into).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carin14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine 13 - 16 May 2011, the location is the best only 5 minutes from the Eiffel Tower and across the road from the metro. The hotel is lovely and is very clean although the rooms are very small but as you only sleep there it is OK. We took the hop-on-hop-off boat along the river Seine as our main mode of transport and went on an evening boat ride to see the Paris lights which was amazing. There are also plenty of places to eat and the sandwich bar next to the hotel does lovely fresh sandwhiches if you need a snack. The only problem we had was with the reception staff I wrote them an email before hand asking them what is the best mode of transport and was given a taxi link and was not told about the airport shuttle this resulted in us having to pay much more for a taxi. I recommend that you book the airport shuttle which stops at the hotel if you need transport from the airport to the hotel and back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris :)”
Reviews.Author: Femaletraveler067
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Siene in August 2011, and had a club room which was amazing! Great sized room with a lovely modern bathroom, free toiletries, coffee facilities and a huge comfy bed!! We also had windows which opened and we could look down on the street. Whilst we could not see the Eiffel Tower from our room, we could see the reflection which was really pretty when it sparkled at night! The hotel is in the best location!! Just a few blocks away from the Eiffel Tower, it has 3 fantastic Pizza restaurants either side of the hotel and a fast food subway too! There is also a supermarket just down the road where we bought freshly baked croissants each morning before we headed out sightseeing. There are some lovely areas to walk to such as over the bridge where we found some nice restaurants or a bit further and you reach the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es (half hour walk) or you can easily get around using the metro station (Bir Hakeim) which is right next to the hotel and is really cheap. You can also get to Disneyland from there for 7 euros. Paris is now my favourite city and I would recommend staying in this hotel to anyone! Couples, families and friends itâ€™s very safe and kept very clean. Tips: *Paris is expensive if you like a pint 8-12 euros in most places so take plenty of spending money! Cocktails are also quite expensive however wine is standard, and very cheap if you buy it in the supermarkets. *If you plan on visiting the Eiffel tower go early evening (around 4ish) on a weekday we found it had less queues around that time, as some days it can reach up to 4+ hours. Make sure you buy a glass of champagne at the top it will be the best 10 euros you ever spend! Also the Eiffel Tower sparkles on the hour for 5 minutes after dark make sure you see it! *Beware of people wanting you to sign death petitions they donâ€™t just want a signature they ask for a minimum of 10 euros! * Travel there by Eurostar itâ€™s really quick! Best way to get there Enjoy Paris! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: andreaadams
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel minutes away from the Eiffel Tower. Helpful and friendly staff that let us check in around noon after an exhausting over night trip. Close to a grocery store, subway restaurant and many cafes. Even though it was a busy area, sound proofing kept noise down.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and rude !”
Reviews.Author: Small_BuG_123
Reviews.Content: 1. location - great 2. service - plenty of service, but inaccurate info offered by front desk 3. room- good 4. bathroom- good 6. courtesy - its hardly find any of them smile,looks like they get pay less for their work 7. room lock- the entrance room lock very bad and unsafe (looks like they always use screwdriver to open the guest room) We stay in this hotel for 4 nights in sept 2011, in fact, we doesnt want to go for this hotel but our preferable hotel has fully booked, so we hv no choice to select any hotel which near to the train. The lady front desk is very rude and the info given is suck! and the guy front desk insist us for paying the hotel for extra breakfast charges even though we doesnt take any their breakfast( we booked with non breakfast room) (the session stop until i insist to write in for the french embassy about this and i will surely dispute any credit card transaction for this euro 32) conclusion: this hotel should be in place out of 500 in tripadvisor, maybe they have so many insider to write the review themselve.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: KeirW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in April whilst I did the marathon. Lovely, quirky little hotel that was centrally located. Friendly staff & the room was clean & decorated in an art deco style. The guys on check were very helpful & even allowed me to extend our stay by a couiple of hours to have a quick shower after the marathon. Would happily come back here again & would definitely recommend it for some-one looking for a clean & friendly budget hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of number of people permitted in room”
Reviews.Author: QuinnsTurtleBay
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for three adults through Orbitz and paid the equivalent of $220 US Dollars. Our 16 son was traveling with us and by hotel standards worldwide kids under 18 stay for free. When we checked in front desk staff kept asking about who was staying in our room. I told them I was staying in the room with my boys (Husband and two sons). They seemed to be overly concerned and monitored us coming in and out of our room. Later in the evening when we came in from dinner we were told that they would be sending police up to our room to be sure that we did not have more than 3 people in the room. We went down to the desk and explained our accomodations and thought process when booking the room. They were hearing nothing of it and demanded that we purchase an additional room. They wanted to charge 240 Euros for a single room. We checked the availability from the lobby on the wi-fi and rooms were showing for 170 Euros, we challenged the pricing but felt as if we had no choice. The clerk agreed to honor the 170 Euros. The staff at the desk basically embarrased us in front of other guests and made us feel like criminals. We ended up getting billed for an additional $260 US Dollars so we paid $480, so absolutely not worth it. We are travel agency owners in the US and have never had an experience like this before in our lives. Truthfully we wish we would have left Paris off itinerary all together. When we went to leave the hotel, the desk staff was unable to obtain a taxi or car service for us and told us that taking the metro would be risky since service would be unreliable. We walked to two different metro stations with all of our luggage before we were finally able to figure out the train to get us back to the airport (the stations near the hotel do not provide connecting information and no one available at window). Honestly we have never paid so much for one night in a hotel or been treated as poorly as we were at the Hotel Eiffle Seine, they should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: atshannon1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent this past weekend in Paris. We did some research on hotels in Paris for less than $300 and decided on the Eiffel Seine Hotel. The reviews were all correct in that this boutique hotel is perfect for travelers who want to stay in downtown Paris but still have a moderate budget. The rooms are slightly larger than typical European size and seemed clean. The lobby is nice, and when you check in they have tea/coffee/biscuits for you. The hotel is located in a decent area (felt safe and clean) right next to two subway lines, which is convenient, and about 3 blocks from the Eiffel tower. A taxi to almost all downtown locations is less than 15 euros. Best best thing about this hotel was the staff. Especially the woman who works during the day was incredibly nice and helpful with suggestions. She has worked at the hotel for 5 years, and seems to really like her job. She alone raised my rating from 4 to 5 stars :) If you're looking to spend less than $300 and stay in downtown Paris, I'd most definitely recommend the Eiffel Seine Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh I
Reviews.Content: Narrow, dark corridoors with plush wallpapered walls, Alice in Wonderland style lifts and rooms with at least one non-French television channel. We only had breakfast in the hotel once, lovely pastries as expected. The front desk staff were very helpful with a good command of English; although one Monsieur seemed keen to correlate English guests with McDonalds, directing us to the nearest branch without us needing to ask! Free internet access in the lobby, train-line in close proximity. Very close to the Eiffel tower, but as a consequence, quite far away from everything else you might like to see. Also about a 30-40 minute taxi journey from CDG airport- but a good opportunity to see some of the city life. An excellent crepe stand about 2 minutes away serving delights right into the night. A nice Italian restaurant nearby also in case you fancy a change from french cuisine. Very very very far away from Disneyland (the last stop on the train). All in all, a relatively quiet area and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Just M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days and it was great!!! From check in to check out...flawless! Jean Francois in the front desk and the other guy in the morning ( sorry, I forgot your name) were AWESOME! They treat you like a real guest. The room and elevator were very small ( but this is something to expect in Paris) The room was clean and the bathroom as well.The tub was not draining well though. It is basically 2 blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. One thing very convenient about this hotel is, it is in front of the train station. We were lost at the Main station (Paris Nord?) and did not know our way to this hotel ( no one spoke English), but we figured it out. As we were approaching our stop, I could see this hotel already... that was a big relief! It's almost 10 min cab ride to everything, ( St Michelle, St Germaine, Champs du Ellyse, Notre Dame, Museums, etc) and its about 10-12 euros! Buffet Breakfast in the hotel was good, they had a special for 16 euros for 2 people at that time, and the croissant was excellent! One more thing, they do not have an iron in the room, you have to go downstairs to iron your clothes..

Reviews.Title: “2nd time”
Reviews.Author: washmjd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights recently, and the nothing has changed since I had stayed here last year. The service was great. The room were still a bit small, but does that really matter? The location is perfect. Close to the tower, metro, and many fine restaurants down Grenalle......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! We will stay here next time. Clean, convenient location, easy access to trains, comfy bed & pillows.”
Reviews.Author: JulietteMarie
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris & staying at the Eiffel Seine Hotel. What a great choice! This hotel is a gem! The rooms and hotel is very clean, excellent staff & service, comfortable bed & pillows & the A/C works perfectly. The lobby, rooms, elevator & hallways are small compared to hotels of the same price is USA, but quite standard compared to Europe. The hotel is also across the street from a train station (Bir-Hakeim, Metro Line 6) & around the corner (90m) from Champ de Mars - Tour Eiffel one (train RER C). The Eiffel Tower is 2 blocks away! All Paris attractions can be easily reached by either of these two train stations. There is also a supermarket within 50m from the hotel. We bought water, juice & fruits there every day. We plan to go back to Paris & stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for short trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: TomD1966
Reviews.Content: We booked the Eiffel Seine due to the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. We had booked a Eurostar two night break to treat our 11 year old niece before she starts school. Excellent location for the Eiffel tower, metro right across the road and several good options for breakfast and evening meal nearby. The hotel is charming, clean and we felt safe and secure at all times. Our room was fairly small as you would expect in Paris and this was not an issue as we only slept and showered in there (nice size double bed and a rollaway). Our room overlooked the internal courtyard and was blissfully quiet at night for such a central location. The housekeeping and front desk staff we encountered were all friendly and courteous. We would fully recommend staying at this hotel for a visit to Paris and its high Tripadvisor ranking is fully justified.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: faye100
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a 4 day trip to Paris for his 30th birthday. I picked the Eiffel Seine for our stay and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, 2 mins from the underground and a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are relatively small (though typical for Paris), are clean and have everything you need. We had a small incident with the hotel staff binning a souvenir that we had taken from the Buddah Bar on my boyfriendâ€™s birthday, but we were more than adequately compensated for this when we raised it with them. We found the blonde haired lady on reception extremely pleasant and helpful and we thank her for our late check out â€“ this saved us carrying our bags around Paris all day in the 30 degree heat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: hbechirian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a blast in Paris!! Stayed in Room 305 - typical small room in Paris nothing too extravagant, the location is PERFECT. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. A little odd that you had to leave your room key at the front desk but i guess it's for safety measure. About the location: again it's PERFECT .. small cafe's outside the hotel, RER right across the street, very close to the Eiffel Tower you'll be able to see it once you turn the corner, less than 8 min walk, 15 min walk to Arc de Triomphe - the only downside of the area were the gypsies around the corner of the hotel. If you choose to stay here be cautious of the area ...

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to friends and family”
Reviews.Author: elisa34_11
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we have stayed in in Paris - the hotel staff were more than happy to recommend good brasseries and restaraunts in the area which we enjoyed very much. We enjoyed the internet access and location of the hotel, it was really great to walk out the door and be able to sit in the sunshine on the banks of the Seine. Great access to metro and very nice accomodation, including comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with a nice atmosphere and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Alf KÃ¥re F
Reviews.Content: We where 6 couples that stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from 25 - 29.Aug.2011, and for all of us this was our first trip to Paris. Entering the Eiffel Seine Hotel we where met by a very service minded reception clerk that gave us the information we where seeking, and continued in the same manner throughout our stay. The standard of the hotels rooms where very nice and clean. As a good start of the day you should treat yourself with the hotels breakfast buffet. The location of the hotel was a perfect starting point for exploring Paris and its sights, and we will definitely use this hotel on our next trip to Paris and recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jyll C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from August 19 - August 25th, 2011 and loved it! All of the staff was very pleasant, understood English well, and was always willing to help with any and all requests. The location could not have been better! There is a Metro station across the street, a market and ATM down the street to the left and the Eiffel tower around the corner to the right. When you have walked all day and just want to sit or lay down having the Metro across the street was priceless. If you want a budget hotel, STAY HERE! You won't be unhappy! Be sure to also try the Crepe stand to the right of the hotel! Perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. They are VERY tasty!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern, nice & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jone81
Reviews.Content: Super cute boutique hotel steps from the Eiffel Tower. As I spoke very little French, I greeted and stated I had a reservation in French then staff was more than happy to speak English. They provided maps and suggested a wonderful French restaurant nearby. They helped me with train station locations and time planning. Room was super clean with comfortable bed and great bathroom facilities. Wifi free of cost. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: marylinsh
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews and finally picked this hotel because it was highly recommended! It turned out to be the right choice for my trip to Paris. It is located very close to a metro station, and with a 5 minutes' walk distance to the Effel Tower. There are a coulple of good resturants around. The bonus of booking this hotel is that it is very close to some of the best zones in Paris. Thus, walking around the hotel in the morning or after dinner (because it gets dark very late in July) is something very pleasant to do. You may get a taste of real Paris, not touristic Paris. :P Will stay there again!:)

Reviews.Title: “Parisian chic, in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: kelvin d
Reviews.Content: friendly staff. great location. definitely going back

Reviews.Title: “Great! Hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: slash182
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice, quiet, tradionally european hotel, this is the place. What the hotel lacks in size, it makes up for in service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is always someone at the desk willing to help out with any concerns. The day before we left, they made sure we had a ride to airport. The room was always very clean and organized and although a little snug, was good for two people to stay in. It is also perfectly located, barely a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Overall, a fantastic experience :)

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA T
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 2 nights at the Eiffel Seine and found it a lovely hotel we asked for 2 rooms together and we got rooms at the end of a corridor and we could close and lock a door on the corridor which made our to rooms safe and very private. Our rooms were very clean and modern and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a laptop in the hotel reception which our children found very useful overall a fabulous stay as it was very close to the Eiffel Tower, restaurants on same street around 10 pounds for a nice pizza (not bad for Paris) a subway sandwich shop very near and a supermarket further down the street, very close to the metro across the road. We would be very happy to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Charming! Totally Parisian!”
Reviews.Author: vangie1
Reviews.Content: The decor is trendy and totally Parisian. The elevator only holds 1 person plus luggage, but take the stairs down so you can look out the back windows. The hallways are like a rabbit warren, full of twists and turns. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The hotel is directly across from the subway and the Paris subway is a great way to get around - get a pass. You will enjoy the musicians on the trains and in the tunnels! There is a grocery down the street and little resturants where you can get a pastry for breakfast, although the hotel does provide breakfast but they are a little costly. The front desk staff are very helpful and speak english (always a worry for us). Over all this would be my first choice when staying in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue832
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely long weekend, myself and my daughter, hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel very clean and comfortable. We would recommend the breakfast. Few minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Tip tip follow the River Seine xx

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: RalphManning
Reviews.Content: Veyr clean, simple, boutique hotel. The standard rooms are small but when you are out all day that's not a problem. The front desk staff member is always helpful. The hotel doesn't have a restuarant, but there are plentyy of places to eat in Paris! Breakfast in the hotel is expensive, so much better value to walk out and find a small patissierie/boulangerie for coffee and pastries (on Champs Elysee - look for Brioche-Doree - it's a chain, but good value). There is a small supermarket about 100m down the Bd de Grenelle from the hotel where you can buy water and other essentials. There is a minibar in the room - which you can use as a fridge for a few small items. Very close to Eiffel Tower and Seine - so the name is accurate! Great to be able to wander out to the Trocadero Jardins at night to see the tower lit up thorugh the fountains. Be there on the hour to catch the spakrling lights. Metro station right outside, so useful to get around (1.70E any journey). Also Batobus (river bus) is just by the tower and that is a good way to travel around for a day too (though more expensive - 14E). Many cafe/brasseries are quite expensive to eat in daily. In the Rue de la Huchette (Latin Quarter), there are a number of small restuarants doing fixed menus - avoid the 10E, but the next up 14-15E is better, but check the wine/beer prices first (that can be where they make their money!). Le Auberge has agood 15E menu and Ok housewine at 9E for 50cl pichet. I you are interest in thedevelopment of art in the late 19th C, then really recommend visiting the Mussees Rodin & D'Orsay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: pepperoni55
Reviews.Content: What I like most about this hotel is the proximity to the Eiffel Tower. The room is cozy and comfy. Breakfast selection is fair for an Asian palate. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel in Paris for 3 nights in August 2011. I booked this on-line as a package with a Eurostar and chose the hotel because of the good Tripadvisor ratings. The reception we got from the staff at the hotel was excellent (as was the knowledge of the local area etc) and the two rooms we had were very comfortable and spotlessly clean although, as is common on the continent, they were a little small in size. All in all, the hotel offered excellent value for money and was only 500 yards from the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: beachbunny15
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eiffel Seine was fabulous. It is conveniently located across the street from the metro station. The hotel staff was far beyond accommodating, they were absolutely lovely to be around and very very helpful. The hotel rooms were small (typical European) but were very clean. There is only one elevator, if you have issues with a stair case and are not inclined to wait for the elevator this may cause a problem. This is a great place within walking distance of The Eiffel Tower and many fine dining establishments. I give this gem my highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: jsb2908
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights recently with my wife and very pleased to report that this is indeed a very good hotel, Very close to the Tower and Bir Hakiem Metro right on the hotel doorstep for getting around Paris. Staff are very approachable and friendly, found the rule about handing in your key to reception every time you go out a bit strange but it's their rules and it wasn't a big deal to be honest. We had a rear facing room on the 4th floor and it was a very nice clean but smallish room with a nice bathroom facility. Didn't take up the breakfast option and there are cafes and supermarkets nearby and found them very reasonable. I will gladly stay here if I am ever in Paris again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: franktastik
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here and the reception staff where very friendly. The hotel has very moden decor and felt and looked very clean and well maintained. We had a family room (Two separate rooms at the end of a corridor, with a door that could be locked or left open) Location was really good with Metro right outside the front door and the RER just round the corner. Small supermarket just down the road for any odd purchases. We thought that overall, Paris was really expensive though, so plan this part well would be my suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service!!”
Reviews.Author: Floskimon
Reviews.Content: We loved the little open-air courtyard outside our room and thankfully very few smokers wanted to use it so we were able to have a 'happy hour' at the table with chairs before heading out for the night with our family (who had another room in the hotel). This wasn't really offerred by the hotel but they didn't hassle us and it became one of the highlights of our paris trip. We especially appreciated the concierge who was extremely helpful and patient! The breakfast seemed a little pricey for what it was but we appreciated that we could get the full breakfast before heading out to the masses of tourist crowds. Great location and walking distance to sights plus the subway!! It was like an oasis amid the very busy streetscape!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MARYWORN
Reviews.Content: Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris is one of those rare gems one finds over the years and I will be recommending it to my friends and family. My teenage daughter and I found it to be perfectly located, I couldn't believe how close we were to the Eiffel Tower and many other landmarks. After a very busy days shopping, sightseeing etc it was a joy to collapse into our extremely comfortable beds. The rooms were spotless and the staff were extremely helpful and polite. I found the decor to be very interesting, particularly the ceiling lighting in the corridors!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: duclosmi
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine in July. The location was perfect - across the street from the metro, walking distance to Eiffel Tower, etc. Anne, who works the front desk, is wonderful, helpful, and friendly. The hotel is spotless and well appointed. A gem in Paris! Will stay here again and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: VandaVanda
Reviews.Content: After a long search through many, many hotels in Paris with terrible reviews I finally found the Hotel Eiffel Seine. After arriving on a VERY early train from London the hotel was easy to find and the staff welcoming and extremely helpful. The room was very modern and the whole feel of the hotel was delightful. The Eiffel tower is 3 blocks from the hotel and the nearest metro station is literally on the other side of the road from the hotel's main entrance. Added bonus is that as the metro station is also the main one for tourists to get off at to visit the Eiffel tower there is a full information point with English speaking people to help you buy your travel passes- especially helpful if your French is a bit rusty! I can't praise the hotel enough and if you are going away for a quick break to Paris this is certainly the place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kelly_marie07
Reviews.Content: After a struggle to find this hotel we were very happy to find that it lived up to all the good reviews we had read about it. For us the size wasn't an issue as so often commented on in other reviews! it is on the small side but not a major issue if only used for sleeping. We asked for a courtyard facing room as we are both light sleepers and the staff met this request and we had very good nights sleep throughout our stay. Most of the staff were very helpful and polite throughout our stay and this made our trip much more enjoyable. The rooms were very clean and house keep tidied them up everyday. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable but small”
Reviews.Author: TheHipPanda
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Hotel Eiffel Seine. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms, however, were very cramped. The superior room for three people was so small that you could barely fit the people and the luggage in the room at the same time. For the price they are charging, they should at least give you breakfast. Other than that, the location is great and the experience was a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: chairs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from the 20 -23 July. The hotel was perfectly positioned and easy to find - you will never get lost. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and the room was very clean and spacious as was the bathroom, I know you do not always get this in Paris. I would also recommend the buffet breakfast. While it seems expensive it well worth the money. It is fresh and just what you need to start off your busy day. We had a breakfakt of egg omlette and tea in a nearby restaurant which was more expensive and less satisfying. The breakfast room itself is very nice. Although you are beside a train station which can also be very handy you can here nothing once the windows are closed. I would highly recommend this hotel and would most certainly stay here again. Louise Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rhodabump
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week with my niece at the Hotel Eiffel Seine and I could not have been more pleased. The location is great. It is right across the street from a Metro station, around the corner from an RER station, a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and there are several good little cafes on the block. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in, although small, was cute, clean and comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lorraine1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel was attractive, modern and very clean. Front desk staff was helpful and unusually pleasant. Fabulous location, very near the Eiffel Tower. Take the Metro to the Bir-Hakeim stop as the hotel is right across the street from the station. If you use the Champs de Mars/Tour Eiffel stop, ask for directions to the hotel and plan to walk several blocks. Be sure to visit the Eiffel Tower after dark when the lights sparkle for 5 minutes every hour on the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Location was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: honeymoontrvlrs
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Eiffel Seine and can't wait to return on our next trip to Paris! It is a great place to stay for so many reasons...friendly staff, small but clean and cute art deco inspired rooms with balconies, not to mention the perfect location. The hotel is steps away from both the metro and train stations, making it so easy to go anywhere your heart desires in this beautiful city. It's also a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood is very safe, filled with restaurants and shops all around, and even a grocery store close by (which turned out to be a wonderful place to buy bottled water, goodies for picnics/snacks and also a great place to buy non-perishable food items to bring back home as gifts. If you haven't tried them yet, be sure to buy a box or two of the Bueno candy bars (and bring home a few extra boxes as gifts) your family and friends will love you for it! Out of all the things we brought back, the Bueno bars were by far everyone's favorite! One thing to note that may be odd to some is that each time you leave the hotel, you must leave your room key with the front desk (for security reasons?). Not to worry though, they are staffed 24 hrs a day, and give you your key back as soon as you return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal destination for sight seeing in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: sarahstorey
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for a sight seeing weekend and stayed at the Eiffel Seine which was an ideal base for our trip. The hotel itself was stunning, the rooms were beautifully and alternatively decorated and the bed the comfiest we had slept in!!!! The bathroom was clean and modern. Our room was on the front of the hotel and despite being above a busy main road the noise from traffic was minimal. The hotel was situated a two minute walk from the metro station, which we found to be the easiest and most cost efrfective way to see all of Paris especially as it was discounted for young people. The Eiffle Tower was only a ten minute walk away and absolutely amazing to see at night time all lit up. We would highly recommend a restaurant called RIBE which we stumbled across on a side street on the way to the Eiffle Tower and was a charming classically French bistro. The food was first rate and at a relatively affordable cost given the location, we could have travelled much further and not found as lovely a restaurant. Just a tip, a lot of museums are free on the first Sunday of the month, including the Louvre. We would highly recommend this hotel, for its friendly staff, beautiful decor. intamacy and privacy and its in an ideal location for getting about the city.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chackos
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a very good location, as the metro line was just across the road from the hotel,! how ever trying to get to the hotel from the airport was a little tricky,, we ended up getting a taxi which was around 40 euros!! never the less when we arrived at the hotel it was clean, very modern and staff were helpful ( all though there english wasnt great) and the breakfast was awful :-(((,, the lift to the bedroom was very small therefor i had to walk 7 flights of stairs each time!! the rooms were comfortable and clean and had facilites to make drinks,, however there was no view ofthe eiffel tower as promised! all i could see was people pants hanging off there washing lines!! the eiffel tower was only a10 minute walk, and lots of places to stop for a drink, but they were very expensive!! we ended up going to disney land for the day which was about 1 hour on the metro and was well worth it!! overall i would recommend this hotel and its good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: keisuke_z
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic - it's just steps away from 2 of the main metro lines, with just a 10 minute walk to the EIffel Tower! The room was great, bed was fantastic, staff was super friendly and helpful. Only thing to be aware of is that the elevator is a little small - max 3 people, or 2 people + small luggage, so pack light =) Adds great character to the hotel! All in all, had a fantastic stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Theworldtoseein123
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located close to the Eiffel Tower. A hotel where you get great value for money, although it is quite a small room, but who spend a good holiday in a hotel room?The staff was helpful with the most and tried to help if it was something.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people.”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: Everybody stay away from this hotel,,,,,,,,We want it to ourselves!! Can't fault it. Clean, airy, helpful staff and a superb location for a reasonable price. Breakfast is plentiful, if a little limited. Front desk service can be a bit patchy, especially at night or when the girl is extremely busy. However, that's just being picky, as I'd stay there again in an instant. Good restaurants within walking distance. For an authentic south west France menu try the Dernier Metro just up the road at Dupleix Metro station, or for a swankier experience ask the girl in reception for a recommendation. She has excellent taste!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: peternottingham
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms for five people. We arrived a few hours too early but our rooms were ready so they let us check in early at no extra cost. We were impressed by the friendly and helpful nature of the very nice lady in reception. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The owners have tried to create something a bit more special than the norm and I think they succeeded. We will be going back there within a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Island of calm in the midst of the Tour Eiffel chaos.”
Reviews.Author: dweeb123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eiffel Seine proved to be the best stay of the vacation of 4 hotels and a rental. In the midst of the â€˜Tour Eiffelâ€™ chaos this is an island of calm tucked in between a pitiful brasserie and a Subway, on one of the busiest corners. Met by very pleasant, smiling (and English speaking for the non-fluent) staff who didnâ€™t require any documentation because of the Internet booking. Up quickly to a clean, tidy room, well equipped and, by Paris standards, ample space. WiFi , small stocked fridge (remove items temporarily for cold storage of own items!) and spotless bathroom. Very modern and well maintained. Large basement breakfast area with more than adequate buffet offerings for reasonable price. (Compare searching locally for cheaper breakfast and all the tourist hassle, then go back and start the day properly!) Can certainly recommend this hotel â€“ and advise Internet booking for lower price. Looking forward to a return stay next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel for a "lovers-weekend" ....”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Balling_DK
Reviews.Content: You feel welcome, the second you step into the hotel, meeting english speaking personel with both smile and happy atmosphere. Its a small hotel, with small rooms - but you donÂ´t come any closer to the Eiffel tower. Step out, pass the Cafe on the corner (with nice italian food/pizza) and walk 3 minutes east direction, - and you are in the middle of the Paris BUZZ...... Look north at La Saine (river), or walk 2 more minutes, and you are stepping into the water or as we did .. one of the river-boats sailing you to Notre Dame.... NICE ! Order a bottle of Champagne when you leave in the morning, and its prepared cold and nice, after a long walk in Paris. I can 100% recommend this hotel for couples wanting to have a "Paris Weekend"

Reviews.Title: “sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: happykevin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels, some poor some good and some fantastic. This one is in the fantastic bracket. Location, staff, cleanliness are all about as good as you can get for the price and we we are already looking forward to returning. Thankyou Eiffel Seine for making our stay in paris even better than we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jharks1979
Reviews.Content: Pros: Walk outside of this hotel, turn right, and about 4-5 blocks down the street you will arrive at the Eiffel Tower. So great location in my book. The staff was very nice. I upgraded to a larger bed and room and appreciated the upgrade. Cons: The elevator (like in many European hotels is very small and only large enough for 2 average sized people to fit into (with luggage). I rode up with another couple and we were a little too close for comfort though. Like many other European hotels, the AC unit was not very powerful with made for a stuffy room until late at night. Last complaint: The tub drained very slowly, thus I had my wifes shave stuble all over my legs! (Yuk). Overall nice place to stay though due to service, location, and overall renovation of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel! Our second time to stay.”
Reviews.Author: djbarlow
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel with limited services, but the location makes up for any lacking services. The staff was very helpful and met our needs. The rooms are on the small side BUT you are across the street from the metro and 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower, so who cares! The bathrooms were modern and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been more impressed!”
Reviews.Author: TimmyAndSusie
Reviews.Content: We would thouroughly recommend this hotel. It's in a fantastic location 5 minutes from the eiffel tower and right opposite a metro station. There are numerous inexpensive places to eat within 5 minutes walk of the hotel (in fact we ate twice in the cafe next to the hotel and it was excellent). The hotel is in excellent order and spotlessly clean and despite being on a busy road our room was very quiet with a huge and very comfortable bed. We really would recommend this hotel, it was excellent value for money and better than many 4* hotels in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the sights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: freeqwent_tvlr_0505
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and daughter. Though the rooms are not huge, the hotel is clean, comfortable, very trendy, and superbly located for a holiday in Paris. Great bistro's, and eateries, handy for the Metro and train station, as well as river bus. Not to mention the Eiffel tower is a short walk away. We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay in Paris and it had a lot to do with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the perfect Parisian experience!”
Reviews.Author: SteffieJean
Reviews.Content: Very kind attentive staff. We were two families with a total of 6 adults and 3 teenagers. The staff were happy to assist us with room changes as needed for our family. Lovely rooms with comfortable beds and modern bathrooms. Great airconditioning and free internet were appreciated... Great location...0.3 mile from the Eiffel Tower. The metro in just across the street... Our teenagers loved the very friendly hotel cat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay - very clean!”
Reviews.Author: travellingmummy88
Reviews.Content: Fab location. Very nice clean hotel, beautifully decorated. Comfortable beds. Very accommodating to our children. Very friendly hotel cat! Everyone friendly and helpful. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly and helpful staff, very small room.”
Reviews.Author: Vegas06
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just across the street from the Bir Hakeem Metro station and only a 5-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. If coming from CDG airport. Take the B train to the C train. The location is also just across the street from the C Train's Champ de Mars Eiffel Tower stop. Exit the C Train, walk across the street (away from the river), take a right (walk away from the Eiffel Tower), and turn left on the first street, Boulevard de Grenelle. The staff spoke excellent English, and were very helpful in aiding with directions. I give them my highest rating. Rooms were the smallest of all of our rooms in Europe. However, this was my first time in Paris, so I don't have any direct comparisons in Paris. Free internet (multiple devices allowed) was a plus. The shower was a miserable experience and the only negative. Similar to all hotel rooms in multiple countries I visited in Europe, there were no shower curtains--only a partial glass partition. However, this partition was extremely short and covered only 1/3 - 1/2 of the length of the tub. The shower sprayer was also like a live snake spaying all over the ceiling and entire bathroom when not carefully wedged near controls on the wall. The attachment that was supposed to keep the sprayer at a fixed angle on the wall must have been loose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KoloLej
Reviews.Content: Really good value... clean hotel and really enjoyed our stay. Only negatives are that the room we stayed in was quite small (not too small) and there was a shower but no bath. Also, there was a cat that is owned by the hotel roaming around the lobby... I'm alergic to cats so didn't particularly enjoy that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: ed905
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for three nights in late May and enjoyed our stay thoroughly. Our reasons for selecting this hotel was initially the proximity to the Eiffel Tower. It was exactly as advertised. The decor was inviting and encouraged us to meet up with new friends in the lobby for a quick drink after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was very helpful and assisted us in booking our transport to the airport. We would highly recommend this hotel, particularly for couples.

Reviews.Title: “An extra plus for service”
Reviews.Author: mercerdkny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made reservations in the standard room for three nights in May. When we arrived the hotel apologized for overbooking and sent us to a sister hotel for one night and then upgraded our room to a club for the last two evenings. Although it was a hassle to move we were pleased with the way the hotel dealt with the problem. Our room was nice, small but clean and quiet. The room needed more lights, it was a bit dark. Breakfast was free with the room however we would not recommend it as there are many great resturants to try. Internet access was free and fast. The hotel was across the street from the subway (C) so it was very easy to get around. It was very busy and quite touristy around the hotel. This is a great hotel for the price and works well for those who spend all day outside enjoying Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jcarne
Reviews.Content: Great location with friendly, helpful staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleChristy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found the Eiffel Seine after trying many other properties for reservations, which were all full. The hotel is right across the street from the Bir Hakeem metro stop, very convenient. There are several restaurants within just a few feet of the front entrance. The Eiffel tower is about 3 blocks away. The Seine is basically across the street and one of the river boat cruises is a short walk also, just across from the Eiffel tower. Be aware that the regular rooms are extremely small. We asked to move to a bigger room and they were able to accommodate us. We could not open our suitcases any place but on top of the bed, in the first room, but we had large suitcases. If you travel lighter than we did, this may not be a problem for you. The rooms have TV's, wi-fi, a small closet and a safe. The bathrooms are modern and you can get a good shower. The hotel has a comfortable lobby with a small bar that offers liquor, wine, beer and espresso. The breakfast room is downstairs. The full breakfast option is no more expensive that going outside the hotel to eat. If you want this location in Paris, I would recommend it without hesitation. Christy T.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, clean and safe !!”
Reviews.Author: Bagettefortwo
Reviews.Content: Walk out the front door and turn right ... 20 steps to the corner and look right and see the Eiffel Tower. Across from the transit system and very close to the River Seine. The rooms are small but cosy but very clean and comfortable. The reception desk was very helpful as long as Frederic was there.... she was very helpful and enjoyable to be around. Three very nice restaurants on each side of the Hotel made choosing lunch or dinner very easy and the breakfast in the hotel was also very good. The Madame that put out the food was also very pleasant and we enjoyed the chat even though we do not speak much French. It was a fun and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lucky but excellent choice - will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: gritch44
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel purely because of it's location near to the Eiffel Tower. Not knowing Paris at all I had no idea it was so close and also only a two minute walk to the river. Location was perfect for walking to most of the sites and the Metro station opposite was ideal for return journeys when the legs were weary! Rooms a little on small side but very well appointed and bed very comfortable. We were on road side of hotel so Metro and road noise very present - not a problem to me but my wife did insist I close the window late at night. With this the noise disappeared. All staff very friendly and reception very willing and helpful with directions etc. Breakfast not included but reasonably priced and choices more than adequate. A very comfortable stay and the hotel will be our first choice for future stays in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Tower on your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Boarder_Couple
Reviews.Content: I'd go along with the majority of the reviews that say that this is a well located hotel albeit rather small when it comes to room size. Firstly the hotel, this is not part of a large chain of hotels so don't be expecting grand facilities, just a base to lay your head down for a few hours before heading out to explore Paris. There is a bar in the hotel which is located next to the reception and it appeared as though the same person was doing both jobs(bar tender and receptionist), not a big deal really as it wasn't really busy. I was thankful for the comlimentary Wifi access provded by the hotel, but you'll have to go down to the reception and get a code, so do it once you're satisfied with your room (we did ask for a change as we had single beds in our room despite asking for a double). Some people have mentioned the noise from the Metro but as our room was courtyard facing we did not experience such pleasure!! Now the rooms, they are reasonably furnished, but in our room (standard) we could touch three of the four walls from sitting on the double bed provided!! However here are the real selling points, the metro station is literally outside of the hotel so easy to jump on and get to places, but the real biggie is you turn two corners (a 1 minute walk) and you get a great view of the Eiffel Tower, and it's a 5 minute walk to the base of the tower, amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: driver1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice modern hotel very close to the Eiffel Tower. I have stayed here several times due to its convenient location, nice rooms and 24 hour helpful staff. We booked a club room with was just a bit more than the regular, but well worth it. The bathrooms were all recently refurbished and very nice. The beds were comfortable and we had plenty of room, especially for such a desirable location in Paris. The front desk staff were professional and able to help us with our many questions. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are many bakeries and creperies nearby. My favorite was the crepe stand located just behind troccadero. Four euros for the best chocolate and bananna crepe ever.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: css850
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my son. Loved the hotel location, being right across the street from a metro stop [Bir Hakeim]. Our room faced the courtyard so it was really quiet, I did not hear the metro trains at all. The room was a tad small but nicely furnished. The bathroom was very new and clean. In-room coffee and tea amenities added to the appeal. Pastry shops, a supermarket and restaurants all can be found on Grenelle. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower. We arrived from Florence on an overnight train a bit earlier than check-in time. A nice monsieur who spoke excellent English found us a room to check in right away. That was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: LoriB42
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris in May 2011 as my husband had a conference and we decided to add a few days and make a vacation out of it. We chose the Hotel Eiffel Seine on Blvd Grenelle due to it's handy location to the conference centre and the Metro - the Bir Hakeim/Champ due Mars stop is right across the street. We booked through the conference and received a rate that included the full continental breakfast at 11 euros (vs 16 euros at the hotel). The hotel manager graciously extended the conference rate to us for our extra 4 nights when we asked. The hotel has been renovated and all the common areas and rooms are decorated in an Art Deco style which is quite modern and pleasing. The rooms are small by North American standards but very clean and well appointed. The only things we missed were a clock radio and a facecloth. The staff was courteous and helpful and most spoke English quite well. The manager in particular made some recommendations for meals and even did internet searches for us. There is a computer for your use in the lobby as well and the staff will print your boarding passes for you if you email them to the hotel address. The lobby doubles as a bar and there is a nice seating area as well as an outdoor courtyard. There are lots of touristy restaurants in the area but they serve pretty standard fare. They were fine for a quick bite or a snack, but I would recommend going a bit further a field if you want more traditional food. We had great success in the Latin Quarter - Le Petit Zinc for a true Parisien experience - live jazz, great food, good but slow service. It's a little pricier but won't break the bank. There are also tons of bars and small cafes that have a set menu at a reasonable price. We also loved the Hollywood Savoy in the Bourse region. They have a French/Hollywood decor with a typical French menu - lots of pate, fish and more. The fun part is that they have a live house band that is very interactive with the wait staff and clients. By the end of the night everyone is singing a mixture of English and French songs. The restaurant opens at 7:30 and a few locals will stop by for a glass of wine. Nothing gets going until 9:30 or so, but what a fun night! We also made it to L'As Un Falafel and it was worth the trip. And it was the only place in town where we found soft drinks at a reasonable price - 3 Euros for a 250 ml can vs 7-8. We found it quite easy to get around Paris once we figured out how to read the metro map. The hotel location was great as it is near a main line and close to many connections. We enjoyed the proximity to the Eiffel Tower and our night time pictures are spectacular. We enjoyed walking along the river. Also Rue Cler, a short street of food merchants and cafes, was close by and made for a nice evening. We ate at the Cafe due Marche which was quite good and was a great spot to people watch. Finally, we had the famous Glace Berthillion (ice cream on Ile St Louis) and don't know what the big deal was. It was good but I have had better. Maybe it was my flavour selection, but I was not blown away by my expensive and very small ice cream. However the tiny island and it's shops were delightful and charming. P.S. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. Paris in the spring is definitely as romantic and beautiful as they say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and were very pleased with our stay. Upon arrival, they immediately gave us a free upgrade on our room which was totally unexpected but much appreciated. The woman working the desk was very friendly and very helpful to us. She helped us figure out where we wanted to go in the city and how to get there. The hotel was situated near metro stops and the Eiffel Tower which was very convenient. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, rooms, and staf, very nice”
Reviews.Author: carlo_smits
Reviews.Content: I can recommand the hotel to everybody. We had a nice room, very good welcome and really nice tips for visiting and restaurants. No bad comments, we had a perfect stay :) thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in paris”
Reviews.Author: mehtap3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time at the hotel. The room was big enough as for Paris standards. It was clean and the location right next to the RER C and Bir Hakiem makes it a gem of a place to live. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anniversarytrip10
Reviews.Content: It had been 9 years since our last visit to Paris and we wanted it to be as special as the first time. We were celebrating our 10 anniversary that week and our annual vacation. Reviews on this hotel were rated very high so I trusted the comments and booked our room for a week in May. Prior to our arrival, I called the hotel to make sure that the room would not be facing the street because I am a very light sleeper. I spoke with the hotel's manager and she was very nice and moved our room to the interior (garden view). We arrived late on Saturday after flying over 10 hours. We were very tired and were so glad to easily check into our room. We found the room to be very small (as previously rated), but clean and comfortable. There isn't any room for the suitecases, we had to line them up by the door leading to the garden view. By the way, there is not a garden to be seen, but it was very quiet. Constructions was being done on a large building complext two doors down and I did not hear anything at all during our stay. The walls are thin and if your neighbor is loud, you will hear what is being said. We had a problem one night around 10:30. The people in the room next to us loudly came in and were speaking in a tone that woke us up. I phoned the front desk to complain and within seconds we heard their phone ring. After that they toned down their voices and we were able to go back to sleep. We had to rise early the next day to catch a train to another city, so we really appreciated the staff's prompt help. We were very happy to have the room made up very well everyday with clean towels and supplies. The room has a little coffee maker and individual coffee supplies were given every day. All in all, I would recommend this hotel, but make sure you are aware of how small it is. We would have upgraded our room to a larger one, but were told they were sold out until the end of the month.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to love it...but I'm just not into this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellebud
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms based on our friends who stayed at the Eiffel Seine last year. (Yes, we still love them.) The booking was done through Orbitz who included our requirements for connecting rooms. I also contacted the Eiffel Seine with our request for connecting rooms and the possibility of an early check in for one of the rooms. Upon arrival there was no early check in available (I understand that this can be a problem), but no offer of a bathroom where we could freshen up. I reiterated our need for and request for connecting rooms which was summarily rejected despite correspondence to and from the hotel. Later that day, prior to check in we were moved by a manager to connecting rooms. This was a REALLY good thing because the rooms are so small as to be claustrophobic. The room was kept spotless by the housekeeper. Yes, the hotel is Metro close. In fact that is all you see when you look out the window. Twice, during the night, we heard a fight/screaming/police sirens outside in the Metro. Also LOVED the vomit in the Metro station in the morning. Obviously this is not the fault of the hotel, but it is the fault of the neighborhood. On the other side of the Eiffel Tower it is far nicer and quieter...and the restaurants far better. In general the people who worked at the desk were efficient and some were very helpful. However the running joke in our family became if certain people who worked the desk didn't know a restaurant, it was a good thing. With one exception we never had one staff member go out of their way for us, despite a long(er) stay, daughters who speak French, and except for the connecting rooms we made no requests. (A simple, how was your day? would have been nice. Although that could be a cultural thing.) We still love our friends but we wouldn't stay here again......ever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JustGo12
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff, ideal location, comfortable bed and spotlessly clean. Is the room small? Yes, but how much time do you plan on spending in your room? You're in Paris! The room is comfortable, clean, quiet and functional. The neighborhood is quite cute, felt a little like NY's Upper East side once you strolled further away from the Tower. And the convenience of the Metro station makes this hotel a great base to discover Paris. I would skip the breakfast not because of the price, but because there are plenty of places nearby that have better coffee. There is construction currently going on next door, but it never disturbed us as we were out and about during normal business hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , clean, but expensive and very loud.”
Reviews.Author: BrittneyW_88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. We walked in to our room and it smelled very fresh. Unfortunatly its right out front of the subway line that runs above ground making it very VERY loud. Convenient to have the metro right there, but it did cause some noise when you were in the room. Eiffel Seine hotel is a 5 min walk from the Eiffle tower, which i loved. There are many reallynice restraunts right inthe area for a quick breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The breakfast served at the hotel is very expensive, and you could get the exact same thing just next door for way cheaper. The rooms are small, but cozzy. Its exactly what i expect . The hotel will book you a shuttle going back to the airport. DO THIS FOR SURE, or the taxi on its own will cost you way more. it cost me 34 Euro going back to the airport, vs a 70 Euro cab ride going to the hotel from the airport. Thats a Major positive that the hotel can do for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and cute little boutique hotel! Would certainly stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Fredericksburggal
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice small European hotel. We would certainly stay here again. minutes to the Eiffel Tower and the metro is right across the street .

Reviews.Title: “So handy to everything!”
Reviews.Author: cammie686
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with an excellent location! Skip the 16 Euro breakfast per person in the morning and explore the cafe's just outside the hotel entrance. A 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and just across the street from the Metro, this hotel makes for a great spot to start your day of exploring. The rooms are clean and comfortable with daily maintenance. Kettle, mini bar, safe, hair drier, and flat screen hdtv provided. Cute and friendly cat greets you as you walk in the entrance of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Get the Paris Pass if you're super eager to see as much as possible while staying in Paris -- it will save you a lot of money! It includes a museum pass for free admission and skipping the queues, a free pass to all public transportation within central Paris (zones 1-3), wine tasting, boat cruise, 2 day hop-on/ hop-off bus tour, as well as discounts at select restaurants and Galleries Lafayette shopping mall! My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and were very sad to have to return home!

Reviews.Title: “'Paris in spring'...”
Reviews.Author: Christian_5668
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Hotel Eiffel 12-15 May, 2011. Great location, less than 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. A variety of good restaurants close to hotel. Nice, friendly and professional staff at hotel. Accomodation ok, the only thing is that in our opinion the rooms were a bit small and the storage facilities for clothes, shoes etc was somewhat limited - in terms of space - definitely only minor comment, no complaint as such. We purchased package via Internet with round trip from Sweden + room at Hotel Eiffel for 3 days - total sum less than 800 Euro. Value for money concerning travel package was considered to be good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Biffoban
Reviews.Content: We were truly delighted by this very comfortable, quiet yet friendly hotel. The helpful staff were all great and made us feel very welcome. Our room was off a small courtyard on the ground floor â€“ an unexpected but nice touch and the bathroom was very clean and contemporary. Typical really of the whole place. We were only able to stay for two nights but it proved a great base from which to visit all the different areas of Paris, being within very easy access of the Metro, the Seine and its Batobus, the always impressive Eiffel Tower and the usual efficient taxi service. Just outside the door are a few typical bars and cafes. This hotel is exactly as it appears on the web sites and, from our point of view, perfect for what we were looking for. We would have no hesitation in returning and no, we haven't been paid to write this!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, small rooms but otherwise clean, smart and near the tower”
Reviews.Author: neilramsden
Reviews.Content: Turned up at 11:30pm, the guy on the desk took over an hour to check me in, made me get my computer out to convert the amount I paid in Â£ to Euros and didnt even say sorry for the delay. Then I had booked a Club room but he put me in a standard room as he didnt trust me (I was smartly dressed and on business!). Got given a free breakfast the next day but didnt make up for it. Also asked for an iron and I had to do this in the main dining hall as wasnt allowed to take it to the room. Real shame as otherwise the hotel is really great, they just need to sort out the service I have had better experiences at hostels and wasnt paying Â£150 a night there!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: p00dlem0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights and in April. We booked on the many good recommendations from other Tripadvisor members and were definately not disappointed! We booked on the hotel's own website and got the best deal for a stay of three nights plus. The hotel is in such a super location - a Metro stop right across the street, the river right across the road and the Eiffel Tower a short walk away. It was really convenient. We booked a "classic" room, which was quite small, but adequate. The room had a large bed, crisp, clean and fluffy white linen and towels, enough cupboard room for two people. The tea and coffee facilities were quite good (nice teas and coffees being supplied) and the mini fridge worked well. There are a number of eating places on the same street. We ate one night at the restaurant on the left of the hotel (if you are facing the entrance to enter the hotel), which was adequate, and then later "discovered" a lovely restuarant further up the street on the right of the hotel (if you are facing the entrance to enter the hotel) called L'Atome. We had great service and lovely food there! There is also a supermarket (Franprix) quite close to this restaurant where we stocked up on cooldrinks and snacks. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and spoke good English. They assisted us with booking an airport shuttle on the day we left, and the price was 34 euro to Charles de Gaulle. The taxi ride from the airport for the same trip was around 53 euro. Would we stay here again? Definately!

Reviews.Title: “I have returned from my second stay at Eiffel Seine Hotel--service and staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Kristi2184
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eiffel Seine in 2010 and was very pleased to be able to do so again in 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location for both the Metro and the RER--and, of course, the Tour Eiffel. I would gladly make arrangement to stay there on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hospitality and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daphiness
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed warmly by FrÃ©dÃ©rique (you can feel instantly that she loves her job!) with a very nice welcome letter with map and brochures. She speaks good English and is good at giving directions. This mattered a lot because the airline left our luggages at our airport of origin and were feeling a bit down about it. Luckily the hotel had toothbrushes and toothpaste when we asked. Room was a bit small but cozy. We loved the free wi-fi (even in our room) and the laptop at the lobby that guests could use for free. Location is amazing - just across the Bir-Hakeim metro station, a short walk away from the Eiffel tower and River Seine. Decor is a bit edgy and corridors are dark with motion-sensitive lights to save electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!”
Reviews.Author: madaboutholidays_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in ideal location 5 minutes walk from the eiffel tour, the staff were extremely helpful and efficient. Metro across the road was ideal for getting to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A little Haven in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: Sidg1969
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Bullet the cat was also a great advocate for the hotel. He was a nice home from home touch. I have seen complaints on here that the rooms are small but what do you expect in a city location. We had a club room with a nice bathroom, ok the room were not big but they were clean and classy, what else can you expect from a city hotel. Would stay there again no question.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sclarke82
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms are small but in very good condition. Staff was very friendly, nice and helpful. Great location - lots of cafes, Eiffel Tower about a three minute walk, subway across the street. Would definately recommend this hotel. It is quaint, great location, staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel for a Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: ruralMissouriMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine 8 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful, most spoke excellent English. Most of our days were spent walking and touring, and we slept very well on the comfortable beds. Rooms were fairly quiet, we had no street noise and noise from other rooms did not interrupt sleep. Right across from a Metro station, about a block from the RER. Nice cafe a few steps away, as well as a Subway (as in, sandwiches), crepe stand, and pizzaria. We will plan to stay here again next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, easy to get to the whole of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jackie504032
Reviews.Content: Great room overlooking the patio area at the back of the hotel, clean and comfortable, very quiet. Didn't have breakfast in hotel as expensive - more fun going out to eat in different places every morning. Metro opposite hotel so very easy to get about. Also RER station round the corner so easy journey to and from Charles de Gaulle airport. Very close to Eiffel Tower and the restaurants of the Trocadero area. Would recommend a visit to La Defense area - modern skyscrapers and architecture so very different from centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Naija_Dude
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night in April. The man at reception seemed a little uptight at first but warmed up later. I've been to Paris a few times and stayed at nicer places - but for a lot more money. The hotel was spotlessly clean and I loved he design and the location opposite the metro. The lady at reception gave us excellent instructions on how to get to the airport for our very early flight, even though neither of us spoke a word of french! Great for a short stay with no more than 2 people in a room...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Perkins242
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine for 3 nights and it was utterly fantastic! Location couldnt be any better just round the corner from the tower and faces the Bir Hakeim metro station. Easy to find and styleof hotel is modern with art deco twist, couldn't ask for anything better!! Service and staff is excellent very friendly and is at ease with their visitors, they have excursions to purchase off them and is easy to ask any questions. Hotel is very posh rooms are sparkling clean with the access of a free saftey deposit box, a mini bar and complementary tea and coffee. Hairdryer is also included Beds very comfy easy to stay in the rooms when relaxing and are cleaned everyday by polite friendly staff. Would reccommend to stay here for any reason to visit paris!! How to get there - From CDG RER B to Saint Michele Notre Dame RER C to Champs de mars. Exit metro station for eiffel tower, turn left all way over 2 crossings with Bir hakeim metro station infront of you. take left and 3rd building down the road next to Subway

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient location, great staff and did I mention clean. . .”
Reviews.Author: MikeNPeggy
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Eiffel Seine and while the rooms are very compact there is a wonderful efficiency to them and we slept well. The place was immaculate, the staff very friendly and helpful and the location was ideal. We loved the neighborhood - a few minutes north to the Eiffel Tour, literally a two minute walk to the Seine or the metro - love, love love the metro service too! We have already recommended the hotel to several friends and family members

Reviews.Title: “Location, Quiet, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Hardright
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly cozy, recently updated and clean. Convenient location right on the Metro. A friendly staff that speaks English and is genuinely helpful on all kinds of things like directions, booking, restaurant recommendations and even the ATM with lowest fees. What more could you ask? Thanks JF!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Most of staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller089
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, convenient to metro station across the road. Eiffel Tower about 10-15 minutes walk. Rooms small but comfortable. Friendly helpful staff with one exception. We arrived back at the hotel at 10.15pm after eating out only to find the door locked. There was another couple waiting to get in. We rang the bell provided but no response! I looked through the window and saw an off duty receptionist talking on her mobile, I tapped on the window and indicated to her that we were locked out. She refused to help and seemed to be very annoyed that I had even asked. Eventually after about 10 mins locked out in the cold, the duty receptionist unlocked the door by pressing a button at the reception desk. All this was a shame as my wife and I had been very satisfied with our stay and would have recommended this hotel to anyone- I must point out that the rest of the staff were lovely, polite and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for us”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMomma
