Reviews.Content: I found this hotel at Hotels.com and took a chance. The price was right, the pictures certainly looked good, and the location was perfect. The reality of the situation was better than hoped for. The staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant. The room, albeit small, was very clean, very quiet, and suited our purposes to a T. I was a bit nervous when we pulled up in front of the hotel and saw the busy streets and the Metro, but our room was so quiet that a few mornings we actually slept in! I will recommend this hotel to friends and family going to Paris and will certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and beautiful with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nyxster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, the decoration is fun, it's very clean, and in a quiet location. The staff is great; very, very helpful, English-speaking, and knowledgeable about the city. The room was small but we didn't spend much time there, and it was manageable. The bathroom and majority of the room were spotless, and we had a great view. It was also quiet. The Metro is literally right outside the front door, if you plan to use it. It's right on the Seine River, and the Eiffel Tower is about a 10 minute walk. However, it's far from other locations, which means you need to take the Metro or get a cab. We used the Metro, but found it to be dirty and sketchy. We may have been spoiled after using the London tube (which was great), but if I went back, I'd stay in the center of the city so I didn't have to use the Metro. There also aren't any good places to eat close by, so keep that in mind. That being said, we very, very much enjoyed our stay here. It is a great hotel for the price and gives you that real "Parisian" feel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic and one of the best we have stayed at. The rooms are smaller than other hotels we have stayed in but by no means are they cramped, in fact we were quite surprised at the size based on others reviews we have read. The mini-bar in the room is quite cheap and we almost emptied it by the end of our stay, though it was disappointing that it was not refilled despite requesting it at reception. There was very little noise at night though there was construction work going on nearby and we had a room facing a busy street. The walls are thin though and we could hear the neighboring rooms during the day. The rooms were very clean and were made up every day, the maids weren't pushy either, we left the do not disturb sign out each night and were never disturbed. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were late for our return transfer and called the hotel and they kindly informed the driver we wouldn't be long. One disappointing thing is the hotel has a cat, it didn't bother us as we were rarely in the hotel but had we have had breakfast or spent more time in the hotel it could of been a concern as neither of us like cats, and it could be a problem for people with cat allergies. Location wise you couldn't get much better, just across the street is a metro station and a short walk away is the Eiffel tower. There are many cafes around and pricing is reasonable. Overall this is a great hotel in a perfect location, you couldn't ask for much better in Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay BUT”
Reviews.Author: BilkoUk
Reviews.Content: We picked this Hotel after reading the reviews from others. The Hotel is really well placed just opposite the Metro and 5 mins walk from the Eiffel tower. The rooms are small, really small, I could only stand on 6 8x8 floor tiles in our bathroom! The rooms are very clean and the beds comfortable, nice TV, coffee and tea making and fresh towels every day, and to be honest this was all we needed, but it was possibly the smallest double room we have ever stayed in. The staff were friendly, the breakfast adeqate and fresh, and the reception area clean and well fitted. with free cakes and coffee in the afternoon, a nice touch. Here is the BUT. There are building works going on next door, and the drilling starts at 07.56 on the dot!! It really spoilt the stay because we were on holiday and didn't appreciate the incredible noise caused and the early wake up. They were even hammering on the walls late into the night, but we were so tired by then it didn't matter. We also had a street light directly outside our window, and the curtains did'nt quite make it, add this to the noise from the road outside and the metro 40ft away and that all adds up to lack of sleep. I don't suppose the building work will go on for very long, but when booking I would check first and book a room that is as far away from the works as possible, oh, and the road. This is a really nice little Hotel only spoilt for us by the local works, but once this is over you should book with confidence, don't forget, traffic and car horns are everywhere in Paris so I guess the road noise goes with the territory. The friendly Hotel Cat helps to give a homely feel too. We would go there again but not in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: VicheartsJP
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel from 28th - 31st March and we were very happy with the choice of hotel. It is a small boutique hotel and yes the room wasn't very big but it had everything you need. It was a lovely clean hotel and the staff were very helpful. It was right across the road from the metro which was a great way to see the city and a 5-10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Would definately stay at this hotel again if we return to Paris. We didn't try the breakfast in the hotel as we thought this was pricey... But if you walk down the road (along the metro line) there is an amazing cafe/bistro called Secco which sell fantastic food ..... coissants...cakes....maceroons and you can sit and have a drink at about a 3rd of the price of the hotel. Couldn't recommend that cafe enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms with excellent service. Good value!”
Reviews.Author: revproj
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small as expected in Paris but very comfortable and perfect for 1 or 2 people. The decor of the room and quietness makes it very cozy as well. The only complex thing was the way the shower was designed but it is workable. I would recommend for the value of staying at the hotel and the incredible service/staff. Service at the hotel was excellent. I was pick pocketed at the Champ de Mars station before checking in and the hotel staff(particularly Anne who was at the front desk) did everything in their power to make sure I could alleviate the situation by letting me use the phones to call the credit card companies and put me at ease during my trip. As you walk out of the hotel and around the corner you can see the Eiffel Tower and it is only a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The Bir Hakeim(across the street) and Champ de Mars(RER) station(around the corner) are located in very close proximity to the hotel as well making it a great location for getting around Paris. Just keep an eye out as you are exiting the Champ de Mars metro with luggage. I would recommend the hotel to any solo travelers or couples wanting to stay in the Eiffel Tower or if you are planning on dining at Le Jules Verne, it is an easy 5 minute walk. The price you pay for a very good location and service is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bolly_becky
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really conveniently located for walking to main attractions - also very convenient for the metro as there is a station right outside - we used this alot and bought carnets to make it cheaper. Rooms are small but cosy and nicely decorated. Bathrooms are good and very clean too. Beds were very comfy - and we both had a great nights sleep - even with the metro right outside. Didn't sample the breakfast as it was a little pricey but there is a little supermarket a minute away with fresh breads etc. Overall a really good base if you're not going to spend huge amounts of your time in your room which afterall why would you - you're in Paris! There was also free wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to the river and the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: beachman77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upgraded room on the ground floor in the courtyard. Very peaceful and quite. The room was fairly small but cozy. The hotel staff, especially Frederique were very friendly and helpful. There is a charming little breakfast area downstairs that has a limited assortment of food. The Eiffel Seine is centrally located right next to the river Seine with the Eiffel Tower only a couple of blocks away. There is nice restaurant on the corner and the Metro is just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: daltonpaul101
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! I found this place based upon its consistent high ratings on Trip Advisor. I got a great deal on a three night mid week break for my partners birthday. Sometimes when you hear the phrase "Boutique Hotel" you think it may be a bit snooty. Definitely not the case!! The guy who greeted us was brilliant and helpful and even added a "Failte" for good measure. The room was small as others have said but I believe this is par for the course in Paris. We got a standard room for the three nights and it was well equipped - flatscreen TV, free safe, WiFi, mini bar, tea & coffee, good size ensuite and a VERY comfortable bed. The room was spotlessly clean and kept clean daily. We didn't take the option for breakfast so I can't comment on the food (although if the smell from the dining room was anything to go by you won't go too far wrong). The location is superb - there's a Metro across the road (our room was at the front, facing the station and it was pretty quiet too) and a RER from CDG airport around the corner. If I am lucky enough to go back to Paris in the future I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna1
Reviews.Content: Very nice, comfortable hotel. Rooms are quite small but there is enough space if you do not plan to stay in Hotel for a long time. Our room had a view on Seine, on the rush street side but windows disallow for noice. It is very close to the Eiffel tower and RER with easy access to Versaill and other attractions. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there is a lot of places to eat in the neighborhood. Closer to the Eiffel Tower there is a lot of nice brassieries with high quality for good price. In hotel you can eat your breakfast which is very fresh and tasty. Altough it is called hot and cold buffet it is still continental breakfast with cold hard bolied eggs and sausages. If you prefer English breakfast I suggest to look in braserries closer to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: vfitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely! small but you expect this in paris, found it strange that there is a cat in the hotel that is allowed to roam down into the room while you eat breakfast?? but it didnt bother us, might annoy some people that dont like cats maybe?? breakfast also costs 16euro per person per morning!! quite dear! other then that the hotel is great! great location, lovely staff, very clean!!! rooms cleaned every morning to a very high standard!lovely restaurant two doors down too :) loved it

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a great location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: fraser_todd
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Eiffel Seine Hotels for a weekend break in Paris. Chose this hotel following a recommendation from Friends. The hotel is in a superb location in central Paris. Just a few hundred meters from the Eiffel Tower and Parc du Champ de Mars. The hotel also benefits from being right opposite the Bir-Hakeim metro station (green line 6) and the Camp de Mars RER station (Yellow line) making getting around the city very east indeed. We booked the hotel via Booking.com and got a rate of 127â‚¬ per night room only. We never opted for the breakfast so cannot comment on it. We requested a room on a high floor with a view over the river seine. The hotel gave us this which we were really grateful for. Our only negative comment about the room was the size of it. Although we had a kingsize bed the actually room felt very small and cramped and was quite tricky when there are two of you trying to get ready. Also the bathroom door is sliding with no lock so you have to be really comfortable with each others toilet activties!! lol. There are lots of restaurants nearby but be sure to try the ones away from the main drag towards the Eiffel Tower as they offer better value and better qaulity food and better service. Would I stay in this hotel again? Yes! For its excellent location and transport links and value room rates. The staff at the hotel as also very friendly and helpful but beware there is a pet cat that hangs around the hotel which I think is totally inappropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel very near the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: mike1220
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and had wonderful experience on each stay. Excellent service and clean, comfortable room. Rooms are small but nice. Breakfast is not included and expensive in the hotel. Otherwise excellent hotel in terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: kevinfay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so near to being a very good choice, location was great and ideal for metros and the Eiffel Tower without feeling you were in a tourist trap. What let it down for me was the room, I was not expecting a huge room at all and fully accepted the small room we were given. The booking form stated we were to be given a Queen size bed, we were given a general double bed, when I queried this I was told this was a queen size bed in France, I would hate to sleep in a small double bed in France if that is the case. Also our room was very noisy, being in room 106 we were directly above the courtyard, the stairway and lift were on the other side of the wall directly behind our headboard and we could hear the people in the room above every time they went to the bathroom. Both mornings I was awoken by banging from 5am onwards. Maybe we were just unlucky with the position of the room and would hate to put people off if the other rooms do not experience these problems.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarlandPati
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly from the beginning to the end of our 4 night stay. We arrived very early in the morning and they stored our luggage and had our room ready for us well before the check-in time. We had booked a club room because we had been to Paris before and knew that hotel rooms are typically very small. The room was a comfortable size, very clean and very well maintained. The wi-fi at the hotel was great and very easy to log on. Our breakfast buffet was 16 euros per person, which may seem pricey if you have never been to Paris. The buffet had unlimited meat, cheese, fresh fruit, yogurt,and several kinds of breads/rolls. The coffee and juice were excellent. At a street cafe you can get 1 roll, 1 cup of coffee, and 1 small juice for 8 euros so the hotel breakfast was a good deal. The location of the hotel was absolutely the best in Paris. The metro and RER are right across the street and we were able to go anywhere in Paris in a short amount of time. We even took the metro to the Lido and were there in less than 10 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants (sit down or take away) and even a grocery store right down the street from the hotel. It was wonderful to walk out of the hotel and be 3 minutes from the Eiffel Tower--beautiful! When we return to Paris...this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidCarr404
Reviews.Content: I second all the great reviews on here... i couldn't fault the hotel at all, i also plan to stay here on my return to Paris.. the Olive oil soaps are just delightful.....boutique hotel with a real charm to it.. we walked everywhere in paris and it was the perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Old007
Reviews.Content: It's not a preposessing place but it was clean, well located, well soundproofed, staff were always available and absolutely fine if you don't want to spend lots of time in your rooms. Our room was pokey and dark but then we only slept there so that was OK. An inpenetrable lighting system turned the lights in common areas on just after you need them but this was really an attractive quirk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/quiet room, excellent location makes our vacation memorable”
Reviews.Author: NTUCE1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days during our first visit to Paris - the hotel staff is polite and more than willing to help. We are given a welcome envelope with lots of useful information and a map... very useful and organized. The room is a bit smaller than hotels in the US, but with all the convenience and more - unless you have a couple of big luggages, I personally do not think it is an issue to maneuver around the room. The location is very good - right across from Metro/RER station, and a couple of steps away from a super market, and restaurants. In general, it is pretty quiet - well, unless you have a noisy neighbor upstairs or in the next room...

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dung50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Eiffel Seine for 3 nights at the beginning of March. The hotel is directly opposite Bir Hakeim Metro station and a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower which means that it is very conveniently located but on the flip side meant that it was also very noisy at night. Our room faced the Metro at the front of the hotel and without earplugs we would have struggled to sleep - not the hotel's fault but if you're a light sleeper it might be a consideration. We stayed in one of the standard double rooms and it was clean and comfortable but very small - possibly one of the smallest rooms we've stayed in! It did mean that we were a bit cramped - be prepared to be very intimate with whoever you're staying with as the toilet door (sliding as there is no room for a 'proper' one) is literally a foot away from the bed! The hotel also provides breakfast but we cannot comment on how it was other to say than at 16 euro per person it seemed very expensive. Room service and other meals are not available but the hotel is next door to a Subway and about 3 other restaurants. The staff were always friendly and helpful and speak fluent English and were happy to give us advice/help whenever we asked. All in all the Hotel Eiffel Seine was a nice place to stay but it we came back we would be paying more for a bigger room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnetaBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Eiffel Seine has the necessary quality and charm to satisfy both business travelers and adventure seekers. The hotel is small but my room did not feel small at all (Supreme Room). The staff was kind and attentive. I could not say enough for cleanliness and comfort of the room. The titles and the bathtub were a little outdated; the showerhead was not the most comfortable equipment since if you wanted to shower you had to hold it. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel and I will stay there again on my next Parisian trip.

Reviews.Title: “Taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: sdluhos
Reviews.Content: For Sites: The Eiffel Seine Hotel is a great location to connect with the metro to get you where you are going. Or if you're ready to walk along the river, it is a great spot to start. With the Eiffel Tower four blocks away you can't help but to take an evening stroll after a long day of walking all around. Shopping and Eating: If you're around on a Sunday morning take advantage of the market underneath the metro at the next train stop, Dupliex. Be sure to go with an empty stomach, there is plenty for you to eat. If you can't there is a bakery and a food market very near. If you want to eat out there is a cafe on every corner. The Stay: During mid day you hear the construction going on next door, and people screaming on the street, by 4pm the construction comes to an end. By night nightfall its pretty quiet outside. The room is comfortable for two, but if you need a lot of open space or you can't deal with tight spaces this is not the hotel for you. They provide you with unlimited coffee and tea in your room. The front desk staff are super helpful and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jt3009
Reviews.Content: just had four nights at the eiffel seine....what a beautiful place. its in the perfect place in paris --- close to the eiffel tower and right next to a metro station . nothing was too much trouble for the staff--polite all the time. i will definitely stay in this hotel next time in paris and recommend you do too.....

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: RWH555
Reviews.Content: Hello...I always use TA when traveling with my wife on pleasure, so I figured I'd better write something this time....our stay was good but we did have a tough time communicating with the front desk. Hell, we had a hard time to even get some ice cubes to make drinks in our room. I know the Europeans do not like ice, but they should be use to catering to Americans....in any event, we found the location to be great. We would take evening strolls to the ET (5 min walk) if we didn't have anything else to do. Make sure to buy key chains from the street vendors...much cheaper....The RER C just down the street and the local tram is directly across from the hotel...all in all we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jussi321
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly staff. Hotel was elegant and very clean. Our room was big, there was enough room for three persons. Tour Eiffel just around the corner, metro across the street. Good value for money, easy to recommend and we will most certainly visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY Parisian hotel-large room friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: twerfe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 405. At night we had a view of the Eiffel tower in the reflection on the office bldg behind the subway rail. Also had a view of the Seine River. Room was large, it was the club double. Room was so clean and was cleaned perfect every day. Nice amenities-tea and coffee making with tea, coffee, cream, and sugar supplied each day. , great Olive Oil soap and shampoo, nice LCD TV, light darkening curtains. Had plenty of room. Shower was big. Towels were clean anf fluffy. Desk clerks-Janna was really nice and helpful. Enjoyed talking to August. Loved the hotel cat -Boulette. Liked the small elevator. Hotel has great charm and is truly Parisian. Was truly blessed to get to stay here and I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Eiffel Tower visit”
Reviews.Author: RTWmom
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on location close to Eiffel Tower and Metro. It was just right. I had reserved a triple room (one bed with fold-out chair for child). It was not ready when we arrived early, so they upgraded us to a floor/courtyard room with a small extra room including an extra chair/bed. The room was larger than we had reserved. The room I had booked would have been too small to fit the three of us with the chair open into a bed. This room - room 14 - Klimt - is located with two other rooms in the inner courtyard just on the other side of the lobby. It does open to the open air (but we didn't have rain so it was ok). The courtyard location made for a quiet peaceful location with no wait for the elevator and instant access to the front desk. The beds were comfortable and extra pillows were brought quickly when requested. The shower had power and hot water. Yes, it splashes out on the floor - oh well. The bathroom was huge with lots of shelf space for your toiletries. Bath towels are huge. The mini bar was well stocked with prices cheaper than the cafe next door. The cokes were 2.60 Euros, which was actually the best price I found anywhere in Paris! The staff at the front desk were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. The only comment I have is that they are not prepared to make recommendations about restaurants in the neighborhood. I used TA and found several good ones nearby. The Metro is literally directly across the narrow street for great convenience. As you leave the hotel and turn the corner, you can immediately see the Eiffel Tower. It was fun to duck out at night for a quick glance at the lit up tower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: ReimagineLC
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about my stay at Hotel Eiffel Seine. It's very clean, very comfortable, exceptionally well located, quiet, friendly and has a highly professional staff. Special thanks to Anne-cÃ©cile who placed valuable packages sent to the hotel in advance of my arrival in a secure location. Hotel Eiffel Seine will be my home base in Paris for future trips. I can highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: cash1981
Reviews.Content: Almost perfect. Only thing to remark was the shower. It was somewhat broken and didnt hang straight. But rooms are nice, clean, no noise and good service. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best in class!”
Reviews.Author: jude82
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Paris and have stayed at over 40 different hotels within the city. I have spend a great deal of time there but I am still a tourist and have seem most every attraction numberous times. I love both the left and right bank and seldmon spend much time in my hotel other than to sleep. That said, I have found that the best hotels for me are the quiet and clean ones located closest to a Metro line with a direct connection to the major underground Metro hubs. (located immediately across the street from the No. 6 line which connects to all other lines and the RER train with a direct 20 minute ride to Versaille). The Eiffel Seine is the best of class in this regard. Plus, all of their front desk and concierge staff are not only extremely knowlegable, they also take great pride in going the extra distance to help their guests find what ever it is you may be looking for. The rooms are very comfortable and extrfeemly clean. The neighborhood is very safe and just a short walk to both the river and the tower. While I normally stay in 4 or 5 star hotels, ES is any ranked a 3 which is hard to understand when you add up the sum of the parts. Nonetheless, is it priced accordingly and in my view is one of the best values to be found. I recommend the Eiffel Seine to those visitors looking for quality at good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: cafwin
Reviews.Content: We took a risk in booking this as there was a group of 9 of us needing 4 rooms and we didnt have many options for availability! It was a risk well worth taking!! From the outside it doesnt look like much, we drove up to it and didnt even realise we were at it, but once you get inside it is amazing. beautifully decorated, very modern yet still appeals to all ages, as out group ranged from 2 - 63! The corridors are dark with fairy lights in the ceiling that come on when you pass through, its beautiful! All the rooms seem to be similarly decorated and they are all gorgeous. 2 of our rooms looked out on to the street with the metro going directly infront of the window but once the window was closed, you barely noticed it&it certainly wasnt noisy enough to disturb your sleep. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, even booking us a restaurant for my mums birthday as we werent sure where to go as many places were closed on a sunday! and it was a great recommendation. The hotel is perfectly located, being close to numerous metro stations, within walking distance of the trocadero and the eiffel tower! In the opposite direction to these, you can walk to les invalides and there are more than enough bars/cafes/shops to satisfy everyone! The bus tour also goes from the eiffel tower so its great for getting your bearings! All in all, the hotel is fab and great value for money. I would go back in an instant and recommend it to anybody who fancies that hotel to make your trip that little bit more special.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: starfx
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, close to Metro in any direction. (Right across the street). Short walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Restaurants next to hotel catered to tourist, but walked down a couple of blocks to local area with good food and local stores. Hotel was very retro and very clean, staff was very pleasant, helpful, spoke good english. Room was small but clean, quiet and modern amenities. We would definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, 5 min to Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: weloveperth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine for the 1st leg of our Paris holiday. It is an excellent boutique hotel very near the Eiffel Tower (5 min walk away) which was great for us as the first day we went, the Tower was closed due to the weather and we could easily just walk there the next morning to see if they were opened. The walk along the Seine was also quite beautiful although since it is winter it was too cold for us. The hotel is situated directed opposite the Bir Hakiem station and is next to Subway and 3 other restaurants. We ate at both italian restaurants and recommend the one next to Subway. The supermarket is about a 5 minutes walk to the left of the hotel entrance and we usually pick up some Evian and a bottle of wine before heading back to the hotel. There is also a laundromat about 10min walk after the supermarket in a quiet residential area although it cost us Euro9 for a load and about the same amount for the dryer. The lift is absolutely tiny. It fits only 2 persons and we had to contort our bodies to fit in our 2 luggages. The room was tastefully done with a comfortable bed, tea & coffee making facilities and a mini bar. The TV is quite small but we hardly watched any as there was only BBC available (on all 4 nights we were there the CNN was not available). I thought the bathroom (with a bath) was a reasonable size and very very clean. It was the nicest toilet that I came across having stayed in 6 hotels in this trip (of course 3 of which were the Ibis chain). There were nice touches such as the good quality soap & shampoo provided. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel as it is next to a station and easily accessible, had decent restaurants just next to the hotel and if you want to walk along the romantic Seine at night or to the Eiffel Tower, this is the best hotel to stay in. However, being city folks, my husband and I preferred the lively ambiance (especially at night) in the Montmartre area although that area is probably not as safe as this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkmock2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and couldn't have been happier with the first class service by the staff and the convenient location near the Eiffel Tower, the Seine, across the street from the metro, near restaurants and shops. We upgraded to the first floor Deluxe room with a courtyard and a little sitting area, walk in closet and a clean spacious bathroom. The king size bed was very comfortable. The staff was most accomodating to all our needs including making reservations before our arrival. We had a wonderful experieince!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: slbPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 27-29th of Dec and found the hotel to be excellent! We paid a little extra for a club room (room 105) and i believe the standard rooms are much smaller and it was worth it as the room was large and the bed was massive!!! at least 6ft across. There was a litlle noise in the room as we were at the front and directly opposite is a main metro station but to be in the centre of a major city we did expect it and couldnt complain too much as the benefit of having the metro station opposite the hotel much out weighed anything else as we used the metro ALOT during our stay in Paris. On the first day we decided not to have breakfast in the hotel but this was a mistake as trying to find somewhere open very early in the morning was very difficult as restaurants stay open later at night so dont really start trading until 10am ish and we had left the hotel around 8am, when we did eventually find somewhere it was very expensive and not that enjoyable. We did enjoy the breakfast on the second morning, initially we thought it sounded expensive but discovered once we got home that it was about Â£11.60 each and the range of food, hot drinks, juice, fruit, pastries and cereal was good and we were able to help ourselves to as much as we liked and enjoy a lesuirely breakfast. The location was perfect, directly opposite a metro station with another main line metro just around the corner, and great close proximity to the Eiffel tower. The staff were very friendly, the rooms clean and spacious and we would definately reccommend this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: llangattock
Reviews.Content: Situated a very short distance from the Eiffel Tower and near to all railway/metro stations. Breakfast plentiful and rooms very clean. Would not hesitate to stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee008
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a lot from the Eiffel Seine considering its great reviews and the price paid for a room, but was somewhat disappointed. The room was very adequate and had a mini fridge and a bath which was useful as we were travelling with my 18 month old son. The maid service was slightly annoying as we could not predict when they would come to fix the room to ensure we weren't in there. It tended to be around lunchtime which coincided with my sons nap time so most days we had to try and negotiate for the maids to come back later which was difficult as their english wasn't good and neither is our french. The location is good for the eiffel tower and the metro stop and thats all. We had to catch the metro constantly to get to the major sites. But it is only a short ride to Charles de Gaulle Etoile so that was a plus. The restaurants close by are pricey but then so is all of Paris. The only other bad thing was that the hotel staff booked our car service to the airport and they booked it for only 3 hours before our plane departed when we specifically stated that we needed to be AT the airport 3 hours before to ensure we got the bulkhead seats with a bassinet for my son. And on top of that the car service was running late and came 45 min late. So it was a mad rush for the plane which we made just in time thank goodness. Overall it was an okay stay but i most likely wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Engagement”
Reviews.Author: dining_diva23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from 10th -13th of December and had a fantastic short break in the beautiful city! This hotel Was a perfect base for sightseeing and had easy access to both the Metro(brilliant service) and train station which are both situated directly opposite hotel. We arrived at the hotel Early at 12am and checkin wasnt until 2pm but the Man at the desk immediately arranged for another room to be ready for us. Although the room was small the bed was cosy and the Bathroom was spotless - hairdryer and shaving plugs in bathroom. All the People who were on the desk during our stay were a pleasure to talk to and if we needed help they were very inviting and helped us with route planning etc for all our sightseeing. Although Paris is an expensive city we made the most of it and although we Payed a little for this hotel there are many cheaper more authentic resturants away from the tourist attactions. Me and my now fiancee got a 3 course meal with a bottle of wine included for 60Euro!!. Before i Arrived in Paris i had booked some Excursions via Discountparis.com and viator.co/paris. I would recommend doing this as i seen people forking out double what i had payed over the internet. All in all we had a wonderfull time. Must Sees/Dos in paris other than the Obvious is Molin Rouge, Boat Trip along the seine. If possible i Would suggest going around Christmas time to paris as the wonerful Chrismas Market along the Champs elysee and opposite the eiffel tower were amazing as well as the lights!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TSprinks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine for 5 nights on my first (his third) trip to Paris. We really enjoyed this hotel and it certainly enhanced our enjoyment of this spectacular city. The decor is oh-so-sylish and very comfortable. The location is fantastic with a metro stop across the street and steps from the Eiffel tower. The hotel staff were friendly and spoke excellent English which was helpful to us as we speak no French at all. We had a room on the 5th floor. The hotel's elevator is, without a doubt, the smallest I've ever seen. The two of us could not both fit inside when we had our bags with us. The hallways were also tight and manuevering bags was tricky, but we managed. This isn't really a complaint though, I just found it interesting! I loved that the lighting in the hallways is on a motion sensor so the lights come on as you move through the halls. No need to waste electricity on empty halls! Anyway, our room was pretty cozy but I was expecting that. We couldn't both have our bags open at the same time (unless it was on the bed) so there was a lot of rearranging and climbing over things during our stay, but again, such a minor complaint when in PARIS! The room was very clean and stylishly decorated. I loved the full size tub and large, plush bath towels. It was wonderful having windows that would open as the temperature in the room always seemed to be too warm for us, even though we did not run the heat at all. Our room overlooked the train station so it was quite noisy with the windows open, but when closed, it was quiet enough that we could sleep easily. Our TV remote never seemed to work, but we never even bothered to mention it to the hotel staff since we were in PARIS! The mini-bar was nicely stocked and replenished daily. The bed was sufficiently comfortable and I appreciated the extra pillows. The hotel's breakfast was included in our rate and was fine. At about 14 euro a person, it would be nice to have had more hot items (instead of just hard boiled eggs and some bland sausages) but the pastries and breads were very delicious and there was always hot coffee, which is more than good enough for me. Unfortunately, we left the hotel in a terrible mood because the shuttle that the hotel arranged for us ended up being 1/2 an hour late. We made our flight, but with no time to spare! Not sure what that was about as no one bothered to explain or apologize for it. So just make sure you allow enough time for late drivers if you arrange your transportation through the hotel! All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying here again. Thanks, Eiffel Seine, for a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “How about some heat!”
Reviews.Author: TDT63
Reviews.Content: Nov. 29th to Dec, 1st 2010, Room 605 Pros - all the good things mentioned in other reviews; cons - 1st night no heat (so uncomfortable we had to wear jackets both nights), registered a concern, said they were aware of the prob. but couldn't get service there to fix it. I'm not in the business, but maybe you can offer a different room for a night? 2nd night I was assured when we came back from a cold day's sightseeing the problem's fixed-it was not. I should have told the young man at the desk to come on up to see if it's fixed. I'm no big complainer, but we're 64&65 years young, paying good money, celebrating our 40th anniversary, first time in Paris, all that romantic stuff, etc. Any classy hotel would offer a credit, a change of rooms,etc. but nothing of the sort was forthcoming from the front desk. So I vent my anger and frustration by writing in forums such as this, to be seen by all and sadly, those are the facts. I mean any hotel can have an unforseen problem, but unfortunately, that's not an excuse for badly mishandling the situation, which the people at this hotel did. When we checked out, I told them, for their own good, their next clients might not be as tolerant as we were. So, I guess if things go fine at this hotel it's wonderful, if not, keep our experience in mind, because you might not get your concerns corrected if there is a problem. Absolutely no excuse for what happened to us, none what so ever!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Eiffel Tower and subway”
Reviews.Author: jlb721
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a nice feel to it but the rooms very small. No room for two suitcases so one had to go on the desk. The subway is right across so that makes it very convenient to get around Paris. The tower is within a 10 minute walk. Did not try the breakfast buffet which was an additional 14 euro per person, which I thought was high considering the hotel room over $200 USD a night. Wifi was free. The location is ideal but cost was high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Tour Eiffel and Metro. Not close to great food.”
Reviews.Author: Tee_jay78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The staff was friendly, spoke english, and the rooms were great. There was a wonderful funky art deco feel to it. I loved the motion sensor lights. :) The hotel is very close to le tour eiffel and has 2 metro stops really close by which makes it great for getting around town. There is a marche just down the street where you can buy provisions and great inexpensive wine to take to your room. Good idea. Or, great idea, get a bottle and hsare it with your amore on a park bench under the lights of le tour eiffel. This in and of its self was a great reason to stay here. The restaurants around the area were not great in my experience. The take away was good, the eat in was of similar quality. when I eat in I hope for something a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: tribblet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights at the Eiffel Seine on a stopover on our way home from a cruise. We found it extremely suitable for our visit -- we were able to take the RER from Charles De Gaulle airport practically to the front door (but beware of all of the steps up and down to the platforms if you are rolling heavy luggage --and none of the occasional escalators or elevators that we encountered were working). The Metro station across the street made it quite easy to get around, It was a pleasant short walk to walk along the Seine, or to the Eiffel Tower, which made it easy to visit around 10 p.m. when it was all lit up. The nicely decorated room was small, as expected in Paris. So was the bathroom -- I kept hitting my elbow on the glass shower door when I tried to do my hair or makeup in front of the mirror. The shower was lovely, with good water pressure, but oddly enough had no place to put the soap. The king sized bed was comfortable, with extra pillows available. There was a flat screen TV, safe, refrigerator, hair dryer and free WiFi. The room was very warm at night and we had to keep opening the window to stay comfortable (the HVAC system did not seem to be working). Since the outside temperatures were in the 40's, we were going from one extreme to the other. The room overlooked a courtyard and was quiet except for noise from the adjacent room -- it sounded as if their closet was behind our headboard, and when they would remove articles of clothing the wooden hangers would swing and bang against the wall. The walls did not seem terribly well insulated, but that's Paris! The staff was very helpful and friendly. A Parisienne woman walking her dog led us to her recommendation for French cooking, and we had a fantastic order of Boeuf Bourguignon (served right in the copper saucepan), accompanied by rice, polenta, mashed potatoes, wine and bread at Le Volant, a short walk away. (I was delighted to see the restaurant and dish recommended on Trip Advisor!) The next night, another local sent us a few blocks up Boulevard de Grenelle, where we discovered a bunch of local restaurants and a department store. We chose Le Bouquet de Grenelle on the corner. We were offered a quiet table in the back room where we ate quiche Lorraine, green salad, and apple tart accompanied by the requisite bread and a bottle of wine. We had a delightful time communicating with our waiter and going with his recommendations. There are lots of shops nearby, including florists, butchers, groceries, and bakeries that will have you overwhelmed by the smell of the freshly baked breads and baguettes and the choices of pastries. We picked up a couple of apple pastries in the morning (alas the pastry shops don't sell coffee, only soda), planning to walk over to the Eiffel Tower for a morning picnic, but as we were walking we discovered a street market open below the elevated Metro tracks in the center of Boulevard de Grenelle, and paid it a visit. We were awestruck by the selections presented by the fishmongers and butchers, and the fruits and vegetables, spices, clothes and accessories available. Apparently the market is only open on Wednesdays and Sundays, and it's where the locals shop. It was a real feast for the eyes, if not the stomach, and if you find yourself in the area on one of those days, don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel close to metro and Eiffel Tower English speaking”
Reviews.Author: KamCam
Reviews.Content: This was our second year here. We were a family of five, niece,her husband and 4 year old daughter and us the' Nannas' aunt and uncle. The hotel is right across the street from the metro Bir- Hakeim stop. There are two reasonably priced restaurants, excellent food and service almost beside the hotel plus a Subway restaurant. The Seine River is right there too. The hotel itself has English speaking, very helpful informative staff. It is quiet at night one can get a good night sleep. The rooms are VERY clean,nice decor, beautiful bathrooms some with deep soaking tubs, plush towels with a warming bar. Mini bar fridge in room. One can walk to the Eiffel Tower. We felt safe going at night, don't miss the tower glowing amber at night. Also the tour bus stops right at the Eiffel Tower. One can hop on it and then tour the whole day with other connecting buses. Don't skip the people selling Eiffel Towers,key chains 6 for 1 Euro or the ones that light up for 5 Euros. Both great buys and people back home love to receive them as souvenirs. Most say this is as close as I will ever get to Paris! The buffet breakfast was in a very clean,attractive room with individual tables had real silverware and dishes. A 'french maid' kept the coffee pot full and restocked food items as necessary. Mostly cold items but there was hard boiled eggs and hot sausages. Excellent tea selection and coffee of course. Good variety of croissants,yogourts and cereal. Quiet, relaxing atmosphere, very enjoyable to have a quick or leisurely breakfast. One can store their luggage there once you check out in the morning. Tour the rest of the city and come back by 6:00 pm and pick it up. That's what we did then took the metro to one of the main train stations, Gare de Lyon and then headed back to Geneva, Switzerland . Overall the hotel is great. We will return again for 2011. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are stylish. The hotel was renovated within the last few years and you will be very impressed on walking in. Also one can get the train to the Palace of Versailles right across the street as well. Good travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sight Seeing”
Reviews.Author: Velovino
Reviews.Content: We loved the Art Deco nature of the hotel. We had a room in the back of the hotel it was super quiet and we slept really well. Its location near the Seine and Eiffel Tower--metro, subway and Batobus close proximity were a plus since we had a 9 year old who does not like to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: Bl0ndie87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night at the beginning of November, with my boyfriend as a surprise for his birthday. After reading hundreds of reviews I settled for the Eiffel Siene based on the high rating on trip advisor. I was not disappointed. The boutique hotel he a luxuriously decorated reception area, making you feel like you could be in the Moulin Rouge film and the rooms at compact but not nearly as small as I imagined. The beds are extremely comfy and the bathrooms were clean with a good powerful shower and nice complimentary toiletries. The receptionist was helpful, pointing out areas which would be good to go for something to eat and drink and explained everything we needed to know about the hotel on arrival. He was even happy to look after our bags for the day after we had checked out. The only critisisim I can find with this hotel in the temperature. It was far too hot in the hotel and it was too noisey outside to leave the window open. However, this does show off what good double glazing they have! If we'd have been staying longer than a night, I am sure reception would have altered this if it was brought to their attention as they were so accomodating. It was such a sweet little hotel, I could have happily stayed for longer...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tawaulady
Reviews.Content: It's a good 3 star hotel in a great location. It's minutes from the Eiffel Tower and just across the street from the Metro station. The staff were helpful and friendly. The WiFi was out when we were there so we had to share the use of the laptop available at the bar. The staff helped us with our internet check-in for our flight and since we are a large group it took a long time but they continued to help us even so! The only shortcoming is that not all rooms have a jug kettle and we all like to drink hot water in the morning or make a hot drink for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, stylish accomadation and friendly, informative service.”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireJulia
Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend Hotel Eiffel Seine. Friendly approachable staff and beautiful rooms coupled with great location made for a fantastic stay in Paris. Location could not be better - RER across the road, no noise heard in hotel though, 5minutes and you are stood infront of and looking up at the Eiffel Tower. The Trocadero is just across the road from the tower and both Champs d'Elesyee and Arc d'Triumph are within waqlking distance. The Batobus (water taxi) and Bateaux Mouches and 'jump on jump off' city tour busses are a short distance away. We would not hesitate to stay here again.....10/10 :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent digs for the money”
Reviews.Author: OpenedOnce
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in late September 2010. Overall, I thought it was a very good hotel for the money and location. Standing outside, you can see the Eiffel Tower, which is maybe a 5-minute walk away. Although it is not right next to the other main tourist attractions, they are just a train ride or two away. The Bir-Hakeim metro stop is literally directly across the street from the hotel, so getting around is extremely easy. In addition, there are lots of restaurants in the area (many w/ English-speaking staff) and street vendors selling crepes at midnight. The staff was mostly friendly and courteous, but be careful with the night staff, who may not be able to properly explain things. We learned the hard way that during evening hours/night you cannot have guests in your room (the staff could not provide a specific time when pressed for this info but estimated no guests after 8 or 9 pm). It's not like you'd be able to have a party up there anyway, because while the room itself was clean, it was also TINY, which I suppose is to be expected. A few things they don't tell you on the website: - You must leave your room key with the front desk upon departure (each time you leave) - If you want to iron, it must be done in the basement (no iron + board in room, and no, they will not bring you one) - The elevator is a pint-sized box that will not fit two people and their luggage (maybe one person and his/her luggage or two or three people w/o luggage) Regardless, it was a nice hotel with good staff and clean rooms. But I'd probably want to check out some other properties before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SwissDutchy
Reviews.Content: In February 2010 I decided to take my partner on a trip for his birthday. We stayed here because there was a good deal in combination with the Eurostar. At first we were not sure because of the 3 stars but because the location was great and when we came in, the hotel had a very friendly athmosphere. The room was not ready at first but we could have a sit in the very comfortable chairs in the lounge and waited for 5 minutes. The hotel is situated near the Eiffel Tower and the metro station is also around the corner. The great thing we discovered while being there is the balcony. You can open the doors and look over the city on your own little balcony. This was great, the beds are ok, they are quite hard, some like it, some not. The room is small and it does not have a kettle. For additional services, like tea and coffee, you have to go down and order it. Also the breakfast is quite expensive. While staying here, we had breakfast but not so much and in our eyes, this was quite overpriced. So if you want to stay here, please have a look around, there are lots of little corner restaurants/ cafe's where you can have a nice coffee and a croissant. The service was great! This was definately a plus. The people were very friendly and helped us with reserving some restaurants, which they were happy to do so. Everyone smiled and said hello. the language was sometimes a barrier. As soon as you are going away from the front desk, the level of English decreases dramatically, but nevertheless they stay friendly and very patient. I would probably go to another hotel next time to see a different part of the city but if you are planning to stay close to the Eiffel Tower, this would be a good value for money choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: annemjohnston
Reviews.Content: Paris is very expensive but this hotel is a hidden gem. Very good location, excellent breakfast and clean comfortable rooms. Rooms are on the small side but all rooms in Paris appear to be like this. Would definately recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Radon123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September and were very pleased with every aspect. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful. While we were there there was a strike going on affecting public transportation - the staff was great in giving us tips to make traveling less painful on that day. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep we had.”
Reviews.Author: JustinAndJane
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay - location right next to the metro and RER - good inexpensive restaurants nearby. Best bed we slept in during our trip across Europe. Romantic and very quiet (we were at the back overlooking the courtyard). Lifts for us and our baggage was welcome as we were very tired travellers at the end of our long journey. The decor looked fresh and brand new. The shower had good pressure. Room was small, as you would expect in Paris, but it was well layed out with good cupboard and storage space. The bar downstairs has a laptop for free use. Location is near the Eiffel Tower and across the road from the (above ground) metro station. And the Seine is practically across the road too - and I recommend the Seine River Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: eni77
Reviews.Content: For some communication issue, I had to leave another hotel I was staying one day earlier and had to find a hotel for one night fast! Eiffel Seine was the only hotel I called with one single room available. It's a larger room charged euro 250. The room is really spacious and the bathroom is also huge with a tub. However, during my stay, nothing really works for me! I was in Paris for work, and unfortunately had to be connected to internet all the time. Before I booked this hotel, I specifically asked about the WIFI connection. The receptionist confirmed that the WIFI is working through the hotel. However, as soon as I checked in I was told the WIFI was down for a day now. And during my stay in this overpriced hotel, 2 days 1 night, the WIFI hadn't been fixed! Besides the tech. problem, the TV was not working. Only 2 channel. No CNN or BBC and the connection was bad!!! Worst of all, the bed was the most uncomfortable. Not to mention that it cracked everytime I turn. I go to Paris twice a year for work. And this has been the most unpleasant Paris stay for me. STAY AWAY from this hotel. It's overpriced and service doesn't live up to what they charge for. The neighborhood is crowded with tourists and vendors selling key chains. Feel unsafe to walk around at night by my self.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Minor Problems, But Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: WellyWalker
Reviews.Content: Only a minutes walk away from a Metro Station, The Banks of the River Seine, a gift shop and a few restaurants this hotel really couldn't be located any better. Not to mention the fact that you are only a 5 minute walk away from the base of the Eiffel Tower. The multi-lingual staff are very friendly and nice and although the hotel is small, we found it very welcoming and cosy. We had a room facing the street which was sometimes loud with the French seemingly being in love with their car horns. However the windows were good and after 11.30, when the last Metro had gone by, things quietened down and you could easily get some sleep in the very large, comfortable beds. In the morning there was a nice big en-suite shower for us to use which was great. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as they did not serve a full English and we were not prepared to pay 14 euros each for a continental breakfast. The few minor problems I had with this hotel are as follows:. The receptionist is also the concierge, and whilst I had no issue with them from a receptionist point of view, the concierge part of the role left a lot to be desired. We only asked them two questions; one about Disneyland closing times and the other about whether or not the Metro strikes would effect the Eurostar trains. I'm sorry to say they got both questions wrong. We were told Disneyland closed at 11pm when in actual fact it closed at 7pm which ruined that part of the trip for us. We were also told that Eurostar trains might be cancelled so we should leave early just in case. However when we got to the Eurostar station we were told there was never any intention of cancelling any trains so we needn't have worried. Another slight issue we had is that you have to leave your key with the receptionist every time you leave the hotel and ask for it back on your return. This sounds fine, however we were never once asked for ID when we asked for our room key back, leading us to worry that whilst we were out, anyone could have walked in and taken our key. But those small issues aside this is still a great hotel and the location is perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone however perhaps do your own research instead of trusting the concierge/receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but some issues...”
Reviews.Author: BigShoeStu
Reviews.Content: The good first: It is close to the Eiffel Tower. It is decorated cute, trendy and kitchy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The issues: The BIG one is the website states "free parking on the Seine" and that is outdated information! So if you plan on renting a car, expect to pay for parking and it is EXPENSIVE and a pain in the butt. Allegedly, the parking used to be free, but no longer and they need to update their website to reflect this immediately. It's close to the Eiffel Tower - If you like to be in the touristy areas and assaulted by souvenier sales people every 5 steps you take then this is the place for you. Personally, not for me. WiFi - It was down a few times during our 4 day stay and we had login problems. This might have been a flook during our time, but I had to bring it up. Expensive - The value for the room is poor. If you are on a budget, I recommend finding a hotel further away that is on a metro line to get you in town. The metro is easy to figure out even if you don't know French (I don't know French). Don't be skerd.

Reviews.Title: “Safety, Comfort, & Convenience”
Reviews.Author: vampyredi
Reviews.Content: The front desk was manned 24 hours a day: felt very safe. Our room was clean, tasteful, and had a very nice size bathroom with a full bathtub and shower. Our windows opened on an interior courtyard that was quaint and quiet, so we could sleep with the window opened. There is one metro stop across the street and one on the corner, which made getting to all the sights super easy. And when we came home late, we could stop at one of the 4 restaurants on the same street and grab a late night snack. We really loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite clean!”
Reviews.Author: Keelie84
Reviews.Content: We had dirty toilet paper in our bathroom, hair on our bed, hair in the shower, mould in the corners and old paint pieces falling af off the door. Our room was very small, nice bed though. Very small elevator, very scary. Weird smell in the hallway. Breakfast was nice, but very small tables, we were afraid to move, to knock something off. There's a subway station right out front, wich comes in handy. Location's great, just outside the eiffel tower. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Wonderful rooms, location and service”
Reviews.Author: MaxB01
Reviews.Content: We booked this room after seeing pictures online and based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed at all. The hotel and rooms looked just like the pictures online. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. We had a superior room, which was quite spacious and had a nice deep bathtub (and shower). The staff was wonderful! Very welcoming when we arrived and willing to help us with any issues we had during our stay. We had breakfast included. I don't know that it was worth 14 Euros, but it was decent. As others have said, the location is wonderful, close to the Metro and RER. There were plenty of good restaurants in the area and a Subway sandwiches next door. I realize no one goes to Paris for Subway, but it's a good option for something quick and cheap on the way back from a day of sightseeing! Tip for anyone staying at the hotel, or just visiting Paris: instead of heading to the Eiffel Tower or Champ de Mars to see the tower at night, take a walk across the Pont de Bir-Hakeim (directly down the street from the hotel). There's a cut-out halfway across with a perfect view of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: melhuntington
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good - clean, friendly service, comfortable bed, very close to the Eiffel tower and a metro stop just across the street. Only problem was the shower didn't drain well so water pooled at the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of Eiffel Seine is the location”
Reviews.Author: KareBear26
Reviews.Content: I was expecting our room to be small but I guess I just wasn't quite expecting how small, especially having come from Amsterdam where I was also expecting a small room and being pleasantly surprised by the room there. I'm not a big person, 5'2" and 120lbs (curvy but not big) and I hated the bathroom in our room, the toilet was just a few steps away from the bed and you have a pocket door to close it off but it's a bit uncomfortable when you know your husband is on the bed and can hear everything you're doing in there! There's no fan either to mask noises! The shower was tiny and not great for shaving your legs, there's no where to put your shower products and no where to put your foot up to shave which I don't like. It seemed like the water temperature was inconsistent too, I kept having to change the temperature during one shower, it would go from burning hot to mild back to burning...maybe from other people in the hotel flushing their toilets or something? Other than that the room was ok, would have been nice to have a little bit bigger safe. What was weird was the power button doesn't turn on the tv, you have to push 1 on the remote and they don't tell you that, I told the front desk our tv was broken and then they told me you have to press 1. Our room was on the second floor and facing the metro, we did get quite a bit of street noise, heard lots of sirens. The elevator is a joke, 2 people max so I was glad we were on the 2nd floor and easily could take the stairs. The day staff was amazing though, I thought they were so nice and spoke English really well, we still greeted them and said thank you in French and they told us how to say a few words which we butchered but they were very patient with us. We bought a bottle of wine and some food at the super market down the street (the mini fridge is big enough to stock with your own food which was great) and the girl at the front desk gave us a corkscrew and wine glasses. There was a transportation strike while we were there and they posted signs around the hotel to inform everyone about it which was nice too. The guy manning the desk at night however was not so nice. The strike just so happened to be on a day we had scheduled to take a train to Carentan for a D-Day tour so we got up early and the night staff guy was still at the desk, I asked him to call us a cab since the metro was running like 1 out of 5 trains an hour and got lectured by him on why didn't I schedule the cab the night before and that was stupid of me...and my husband left while I was doing that to go to the ATM and the night guy yelled at me that he needed to get back in the lobby to wait for the cab and I should tell him but I couldn't leave to go get him and my husband was back within a couple of minutes anyway. Then what's super inconvenient was the entrance to the hotel locks after a certain time, they tell you it's open 24hrs but what they don't tell you is you have to ring a bell and wait for the night guy to open the door for you. One night we got there and it wasn't that late and a couple had been waiting for a while outside the door and we waited with them for about 5 minutes, they were pissed. Then one night my husband was sick and stayed in the room while I went and got him something to eat and I was only gone for 2 minutes but had to ring the bell to be let in and I could see the night guy sitting at the desk not doing anything but he still took his time letting me it. I don't know, maybe he just had it out for us but I don't think we were being particularly difficult. We never ate breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that, there are too many good cafes near by and a guy selling delicious crepes next door! The best part of this hotel is the location the Bir-Hikiem metro stop is across the street and the metro is the best, so easy to navigate! The Eiffel Tower is a 5 minute walk and although a bit away from the rest of Paris it's a great marker if you happen to get lost. Also Rue Cler is near by, a great little Parisian street full of great little shops. I don't think we'd stay here again, if we did we'd probably upgrade the room. Their wifi (although free) is really spotty, we lost connection a lot and we used it a lot to plan out our day and check trip advisor for near by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Trust theConcierge”
Reviews.Author: Usandthem2010
Reviews.Content: The staff gives EXCELLENT advice and the design of the hotel means that rooms have NO street noise - which given the location (across the street from the Bir-Hakeim Metro station and 4 blocks from Eiffel Tower) is AMAZING! They have three very nice courtyard suites just off the lobby and we were fortunate enough to be booked for one of them. Request them specifically if someone in your party has mobility difficulties as the elevator is quite tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: drew-cm
Reviews.Content: Was aware that rooms can be small so booked a superior room which was a wise choice having looked at a basic room when there. Asked for a quiet room which was provided. Very clean, comfortable bed and well serviced every day, and loads of hot water. Booked on-line and deal included breakfast, again a wise choice as the breakfast was the only area where improvement could be made for the price. Nothing wrong with it but a lack of variety after several days! Staff really polite and helpful with any information we asked for. Ideal location for Eiffel Tower, River trips and Open Top bus tours with Metro station opposite. On balance a good place to stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaveandKelli2008
Reviews.Content: Great location. We walked to see the Eiffel Tower every night - which was so romantic. It's close to all types of transportation. The rooms have recently been remodeled and were decorated quite nicely. That said, the room and bathroom were extremely small. So small that my fiancee and I had to take turns just to walk around the bed. We couldn't be in the bathroom at the same time either. I know that European rooms are typically smaller but this was extreme compared to any of the other hotel rooms we stayed at while on our 3 week vacation. I liked the hotel and it will be fine for you if you don't covet space!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheryl1512
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. There is a Metro station just across the street. There are restaurants and cafes nearby and the area is very safe. The lobby is attractive and the rooms are large and clean. The staff was was friendly and did a fine job. The concierge Jean Francois was just wonderful. Helpful, welcoming and he had a great sense of humour. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeAnne57
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, but clean, central location. would recommend trying to get a room not facing the street. Noisy and looking at the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjb200
Reviews.Content: Great location, funky decor, great staff. We had a deluxe room (traveling with our daughter) which made the room size far better than typical European hotel rooms. Would definitely return if/when we go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jwat21
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice, quaint hotel near the Eiffel tower. The staff was wonderful and provided fantastic information on where to go and what to do. This hotel is directly adjacent to a metro stop and only a few minutes walk to the Eiffel tower. I have been to many hotels in Europe and this one was better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly informative staff, clean smart rooms, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TuffKitty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 15 year old niece for a long weekend in Sept. The Hotel itself is very nicely decorated, the rooms are a good size for Paris with a roomy bathroom and free wireless internet and well cleaned. The front desk staff was really great - answered my emails and helped me make a reservation for dinner before my arrival, good with maps, very friendly and informative. Also the Metro is literally right across the street as is the RER C (you can switch to and from the RER B to go to and from CDG airport). Very happy with hotel and thought the price was resonable for such a great location. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the Metro but with the door to the balcony closed you didn't really hear to much and it didn't disturb us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good location yet noisy in front”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated, although the black avant-garde design gives you the impression you're entering a nightclub. Choose the rooms off the courtyard and not out front. Metro station at your doorstep and grocery store next door to save on the pricy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, charming”
Reviews.Author: PeterW37
Reviews.Content: this hotel has an excellent location. rooms are modern with free internet. breakfast room in basement is nice and food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see Paris from”
Reviews.Author: djoneill21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 12 days and choose Hotel Eiffel Seine solely based on Trip advisor reviews....and we were not disappointed... The staff were so friendly and full of help. The decor of the hotel is great! There is free Wi-Fi (worked ok on the 3rd floor most of the time) and a laptop in reception to use (Tip: book anything you can in advance to cut the ques). Our room was a â€˜standardâ€™ with double bed (Room 304) - size wise it was perfectly adequate. There was space to get around the bed and the en-suite was a nice size with a bath, in fairness our days were spent seeing Paris, not sitting in the hotel room... We had some very warm nights so the air-con was a great bonus (itâ€™s not in all Parisian hotels). The room faced onto the main street, and I had worried at first that the metro would be noisy but with the window closed the noise is minimal (the metro stops after midnight anyway). There is a building site getting underway down the street, and there was a little bit of extra noise a couple of mornings, but overall not a problem. As a base to see Paris, Eiffel Seine is perfect! The Metro (Line 6) is directly opposite the hotel and itâ€™s a great system, so easy to get everywhere! The Eiffel Tower is around the corner. There are a number of restaurants and a Sub-Way next to the hotel. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel so canâ€™t comment on it (â‚¬14 for breakfast is expensive!) Overall we really enjoyed our stay in Paris, and would definitely return to Hotel Eiffel Seine in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: spilmore20
Reviews.Content: I took my mum to Paris for her 60th Birthday. We stayed three nights and got a great deal via laterooms.com. The very close to the Eiffel Tower, we could see it from the room we were staying in!! The room was a reasonable size and was very clean, beds were changed daily. The bathroom looked brand new, very modern and had a lovely shower. The staff on reception spoke excellent english and were very helpful. On the downside, the rooms did not have tea/coffee making facilities, the iron was situated in the conference room (basement) bit of a pain when you are based on the 6th floor! Also i was given the option to book a smoking room, but when we got there we were told that smoking had to be done in the hotel courtyard. Other than that I would recommend this hotel as it was excellent value for money and in a great location for a first time visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: washmjd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Late Feb/March of 2010. I'm just getting around to writing the review, becuase I plan on staying here again next year. This location was fantastic with tons of little shops w/i walking distance. Right next door to the Metro. The Eiffel Tower was a 5 minute walk... I'm from NY, and was very pleased with the room (size and cleanliness).

Reviews.Title: “You will not be dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: pjpj40
Reviews.Content: First class location opposite metro.Whilst on a busy road opposite an elevated metro station the hotel is relatively quiet due to efficient double glazing and quiet air conditioning. Everything about this hotel is first class,from tha attractive reception,the small but beautifully presented bedrooms,comfortable queen size beds,quality linen and the overall helpfulness of the staff. You would normally expect this sort of quality in only 5* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: JEStrohl
Reviews.Content: Clean, pretty, well maintained, no frills hotel. Helpful, courteous staff. Great location: across the street from the metro and a few blocks from Eiffel Tower. Room size was surprisingly comfortable and larger than expected -- not spacious but definitely adequate. Room was very quiet despite overlooking the metro entrance. Great supermarket a block away -- we bought cereal, milk, juice, pastries, etc. and had breakfast in the room. Were able to store milk, juice, etc. in the room mini-refrigerator. Will definitely return and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel for a short sight-seeing stay and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cornwallis45
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The hotel is opposite the Metro and a few hundred yards from the RER. The Eiffel tower if 400 yards around the corner and access to the Seine, for boat trips walks etc, excellent. You can walk to the Place de la Concorde in about 25 - 30 mins; by Metro in minutes. The service in the hotel is excellent and the room we had, though hardly huge, was perfectly fine for our 4 night stay. Make sure you have the exact address to hand if Taxiing from a station - the drivers rely on satnavs and do not have 'The Knowledge' as in London. The only minor criticism is that it's cheaper to have breakfast at a nearby cafe - and they are expensive! All in all a fab hotel in a fab location for a fab sightsee in Paree!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay at the Eiffel Seine Again!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTraveler40
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Eiffel Seine. It is a very clean, comfortable and quiet hotel in an excellent location. The Bir Hakiem Metro stop is directly across the street and there is also an RER line across the street that will take you directly to Versailles if that attraction is on your list of sites to see. The Eiffel Seine is about a 4 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower which is advantageous if you plan to go to the tower early to avoid long lines to go to the top of the tower. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. We were traveling with our son (age 10) and the hotel was a very good choice because a triple room was available at a very affordable rate. The hotel also offers free wireless Internet service. Our criticisms of the hotel are very minor. One, there is not a full service restaurant on site. However, the hotel does have breakfast room and there are numerous restaurants along the block in which the hotel is located. Two, the elevator is very tiny. I imagine that people traveling with lots of luggage may have to make more than one "luggage run" on the elevator. Overall, the Eiffel Seine provides excellent value for the money. The location can't be beat. The cleanliness of the hotel is excellent and the staff are first rate. We would stay at the Eiffel Seine again.
