Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Ant1970
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfull experience! This hotel is perfectly situated, close to the Eiffel Tower and all transport! Although it is opposite the Bir Hakiem station, it is not noisy at all! Close to hop-on-hop-off transport! Just around the corner is the RER line which we took to visit Versaille! We could also get to all other attractions from here without any problems (including Disney, Moulin Rouge,etc). Ask the staff they are very friendly and more than willing to help! The hotel is beautifully decorated! The rooms are small, but very clean and tastefully decorated!!!! You do not want more than this!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location near Eiffel Tower and all transport services plus great concierge service and free internet."”
Reviews.Author: bridgewithdee
Reviews.Content: Only three blocks from the Eiffel Tower and close to all transport services (including hop-on-hop-off buses and river Seine cruises) make this 3 star hotel deserve a higher rating. Concierge service was superb and free internet a nice bonus. 3 alternative priced breakfast menus let you select what you want. Rooms are tiny but immaculate. AC helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: joseph2009Sydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a well presented hotel. The room decor is quite fancy and pleasing to the eye. The hotel is conveniently located across the road from Bir Hakiem metro station and has three italian restraunts right next door - one of which opens early everyday for breakfast. The breakfast at the hotel is fine although like all breakfasts in hotels in Paris is quite expensive - recommend that you go next door. Initially we stayed in a triple room and upon our return later a quadrupled room which was basically two twin rooms joined together. For any couple or family of three I would recommend that you book the triple room, which is ample room for a couple and adequate for 3 people. We also got tea/coffee making facilities in the triple which we did not get in the quad/twin rooms. Overall a very good hotel with helpful staff and an ideal location. Oh by the way, the Eiffel Tower is only a short walk around the corner. At 10pm they turn on the flashing lights for about 5-minutes, it looks lovely when they do this. So its handy having the hotel nearby late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AD09
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over 30th-31st July as a family of three. The location is unparalled-right outside Bir-Hakeim Metro stop(Line 6). RER stop is very near too. Eiffel tower is just round the corner and loads of eating places outside and nearby at a walking distance, including a Carrefour supermarket. We managed to find an Indian restaurant-Tajmahal (turn left on Bld. de Grenelle, walk for about 5-6 minutes, turn left on Rue Humblot). Good food, reasonably priced. The hotel though being just outside the metro, and on a busy road, had no disturbance at all. We found the staff at the reception very courteous and helpful. We had arrived early, but were able to leave our bags and get out and about. The hotel room (triple room) on the ground floor was brilliant. The verandah outside our room had lovely plants and we could sit and relax and have tea there. Our room for three was quite spacious. Tastefully done, with impressive decor. Clean sheets, comfortable beds and really soft pillows. Bathroom was squeaky clean. The room, surprisingly for European hotels, had tea making facilities as well. Loved the place, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjeldgaasj20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Eiffel Seine, and we were very pleased with the value for the money. As someone who researched prices, read reviews, and studied the area before booking, I'm very satisfied with my decision. The location of this hotel is fantastic, in that it's close to the Eiffel Tower (very handy for orienting you in an unfamiliar city), across the street from the metro (a huge relief after a long day of walking), and by some convenient businesses (grocery store, pharmacy, inexpensive cafes, souvenir stores.) However, be aware that the Eiffel Tower is no where near central Paris, so you can have some long metro rides to get to places such as Sacre Coeur and the Latin Quarter. This wasn't a big deal for us, but it's something to note. It was wonderful having an English-speaking staff on hand, though I wouldn't say they were overly friendly. This is probably a cultural difference, and I can't say they were anything other than professional and knowledgeable. People aren't exaggerating when they say these hotel rooms are very small, but we managed with some awkward balancing of our luggage. Having a refrigerator, air conditioning, and a balcony were well worth the minor inconveniences. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I myself plan on staying there my next time in the City of Lights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price”
Reviews.Author: P42DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between 13-17 July and found the rooms to be your typical size for the price paid (and location). The cleaning staff kept the rooms clean and tidy without the need to worry about who/what occupied the room before your stay. Anne at the front desk is very helpful and friendly. You'll find the location easy to access the metro, RER, Bato Bus and within walking distance to great sites, restaurants, museums, etc.. We walked from the hotel to the Musee Marmottan Monet within about 40 minutes (easy walk. turn right out of the hotel door, over the Pont de Bir Hakeim, to the Passy Metro stop, go up the two escalators and continue walking to Rue de Passy, turn left, keeping walking past La Muette Metro stop, into the park until the sidewalk dead ends and find the musee on the right in a non-descript large home.) You'll find some great markets and restaurants in the area. There is an all night market (Superette De La Poste) on Rue Desaix just a fews blocks walk away. Turn left out of the hotel and walk three blocks to the La Gitane Cafe. Look for the market on the left. Small but carries a good supply of goods for a late night treat. I can't mention enough about the hotel and location. You'll just have to find out on your own. But the location is great for walks to many places (right next to the Eiffel Tower) and close to the Metro/RER. HSI works at time in your room (we were in room 503) but found the internet worked best in the lobby. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulB1982
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. Easy access to Eiffel Tower. Restaurants nearby include Japanese and Italian and grocery shop. Internet available in Hotel. Rooms were clean and good size. Metro across the road. We would definately go back if back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Hieb_hm
Reviews.Content: A beautifully clean modern hotel with just a touch of rustic past. The staff were courtious and security conscious. Our room was clean and smelled fresh and new each day. Breakfast was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Go with confidence”
Reviews.Author: EalingGal
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel that gives you everything you want for a trip to Paris: location is amazing, you couldn't be nearer both the RER and metro (note - hotel is at top of the street, very unobtrusive and easy to walk past) , easy to get there from both airport and Gare du Nord - just follow hotel's instructions re RER and metro, and the Seine and Eiffel Tower are 2 mins away. Inside there's new and modern decor and furnishings, and very friendly service. Five of us went for 3 nights, taking 3 rooms. They had put us in adjoining rooms on 6th floor, which was very quiet with no noise from outside. Rooms were small but beautifully decorated, fabulous bathrooms, and everything very clean, great aircon. We used the bar each evening before going out - there is a small courtyard with plants which is a cool and quiet retreat. Very generous with the nibbles accompanying the drinks! The first morning we went out for breakfast but realised afterwards that was false economy - you can get orange/coffee/croissant in the hotel cheaper than outside, and the 14 euro continental breakfast is a good investment - there's plenty of choice and it sets you up for the day. Good restaurant recommendations from the staff, especially the local 'Bistrot d'en Face' - a quiet location with outside seating and has 26 euro menu for very good 3 course meal. River cruise (one hour 11 euros) and open bus tour (2 day ticket 32 euros) were both good way of seeing the sights, and 5 mins from hotel. We had all been to Paris before and experienced hotels that were real 'grot spots' - this was a delight and we would all go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Stewbenash
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eiffel Seine with my husband and another couple. Upon arrival, our friends were told their room was not available yet and they had been booked at a comprable, nearby hotel for their first night. I had read reviews that this has happened to others staying at Eiffel Seine and other hotels. The nearby hotel was not as nice as Eiffel Seine, however the manager offered to refund the cost of the first night and upgraded them to a superior, upper level room for the rest of their stay (which was more comfortable than standard superior rooms which are a bit small). The location is excellent, walking distance to Eiffel tower and other attractions, metro/RER stop is directly across the street from the hotel. Rooms were very clean, staff was very helpful and made excellent recommendations for shopping and restaurants. For the cost, it would be nearly impossible to the find a comprable hotel in this highly desirable area. I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franklcasey
Reviews.Content: We stayed forr 5 days and loved the room and it's location. It is right next to the Metro stop, Bir Hikeim and if you stay in a room facing the back (street views are a bit noisy) you will love it. There are lots of places to eat around th hotel and therefore I would skip the breakfast and jump for a streetside cafe which is cheaper and much more Parisian. We only used the minifrig to keep our wine cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NanaJSomersetUK
Reviews.Content: Good location a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and opposite a Metro station. Thought the latter may be a problem as our room faced out over the Metro (which is above ground in this area) but the room on the top (6th) floor was reasonably well insulated from the noise and the trains aren't actually that noisy. Some traffic noise but not too bad. We paid slightly extra for a Club room which is a bit bigger than the standard rooms and was a good size, as was the very nice, very modern bathroom (a large shower rather than a bath). The room had a small balcony and a side-on view of the Seine. Room and hotel had excellent decor in Art Nouveau style. The room didn't have a huge amount of storage space for your clothes but there was sufficient for our 3 night stay. Air conditioning wasn't terribly effective but did help a bit. Tea and coffee were provided in the room along with a kettle though there was only 1 of everything - 1 regular coffee, 1 decaff,1 regular tea, 1 mint tea, no milk! To be fair though we didn't check whether we could request more but it did seem odd to provide so little in a room for 2 people. We tried the breakfast buffet (continental style breakfast) and thought this was very good - 14 euros but you can have as much as you like for that. They only serve breakfasts there, no lunch or evening meals, but there are masses of nearby places to eat. Staff are very friendly, helpful and speak good English. I would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mradley
Reviews.Content: Was an excellent hotel which was very clean and in a great location right near the metro/RER stop. The room was reasonable by European standards. Bathroom and the room were clean and like new. Did not eat breakfast there as was 14 Euros extra per person with a limited choice. Out the front door right to Metro and RER making navigating Paris (and going to Versailles) a very easy venture. Eiffel tower only 5-10 minutes away. Staff was courteous. Bought the 6 day Metro Pass and the Museum pass which was a good deal except when they tell you you can bypass the lines, that is not entirely true. All children under 18 are free to ALL the museums which is a great money saver. The catch is tho that you must still wait in line to get the free ticket for the children therefore not saving the time they say you do (if you have children). This was not true however at the Museum D'Orsay. Go to Sacre Coeur area. Was true old Paris feel and beautiful view over Paris as well. Love Paris and would stay at the Eiffel Seine again in a heartbeat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Smeeeagain
Reviews.Content: We booked a Classic Double room on the top floor with a view which was what I requested when I booked through Booking .com The Hotel contacted me several times via email, before our stay to assure me that everything was in order and that they were looking forward to welcoming us which made us feel very welcome. The staff were very proffessional and very helpful. There is also free Internet in the Reception area for guests Room 512 had a small balcony and the windows opened to the street which overlooked a Bridge and had a small view of the River Seine. It was very noisy when opened but the windows were double glazed and once they were shut we could not hear any noise outside. Paris in June it gets dark about 11.00pm so it was very important that the curtains were double backed and once drawn it was quite dark which was good.. so dark that sometimes there is a tendancy to sleep in :) The rooms were small as most European Hotels are, and it was very clean. The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were also left daily. There was a mini bar but as I have noticed in Europe, most hotels of this nature do not have coffee making facilities. The Hotel is only a couple of streets away from the Eiffel Tower, the River Seine and the Louvre. We enjoyed our stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rtgDayton_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Room was a joke. Size of a small double bed with a 20 inch walk way to bathroom and foot of bed, nice staff, clean enough.View from hotel was a railroad station.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - well located”
Reviews.Author: mandpstone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located opposite the Bir Hakeim metro station which is very handy for getting about, and a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. It is right next door to some great eating places and down the road is a supermarket which was very handy during our stay. Staff were very friendly and accommodating - we were able to leave our bag there until check in time and until we were ready to leave after check out. The room was cosy and was more than enough for the 3 nights we stayed at the hotel. It was very clean and modern. Would definitely stay again at this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant,clean.luxury,staff helped us so much during crisis”
Reviews.Author: glasgowguy10
Reviews.Content: The trip was for my sisters birthday and The staff were so welcoming.The room was luxury,cleaned every day,towels replaced,bedding changed too.The hotel was 5 minutes from the eiffel tower and really handy for trains/metro system.The station faced the hotel.The people at recpeption were helpful when we were stranded in paris because of the Volcanic ash cloud crisis.They arranged eurostar tickets and calmed us down and Arranged our extended stay.I'd reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the centre of paris.There was great restaurants and a supermarket nearby for eating out and stocking up on snacks/lunches.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: beekay458
Reviews.Content: I traveled with spouse and two friends. Our rooms were definitely small but nice. Navigating around another person in the room was tough. Our rooms were on the street side so our 1st floor room did have street noise from the outside throngs of people and the train. A decent breakfast was included in the rate. Hotel employees, especially concierge Jean Francois were very helpful. One problem was hallway lights. The lights outside our room were frequently out and we had to fumble our way in the dark and feel the doorway to find he place for the key door transponder. WIFI on our floor did not work at times. Good AC & comfortable beds. YES, AS OTHER PEOPLE HAVE NOTED, PICKPOCKETS ARE VERY ACTIVE. We were hit by a gang of young girls in the RER station. Do not run for a train. They will throng you and try to get to your money. Hotel is in very convenient location for transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic oasis”
Reviews.Author: Russmel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine for a three day stop over on the way back from a business trip in Germany. After the hussle and bustle of peak hour Paris RER it was wonderful to walk into this oasis. The rooms were clean and well appointed and the were very helpful. Located within a few minutes walk of the Eiffel Tower and opposite the train it was a perfect location from which to explore Paris. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: GreatPlace2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a must. The staff were so friendly and the hotel is very clean. We received prompt responses with any issues we may have had. The metro is right across the street from the hotel. We went to this grocery store down from the hotel and purchased drinks and snacks to fill our mini fridge in the room. This is definitely a good hotel to stay during your visit to paris. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I would always stay at the Eiffel- Seine because of Frederique and Anne.”
Reviews.Author: boondocker34
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minute walk to the Tour Eiffel - if that. Not only was all the staff extremely helpful and friendly, but Frederique and Anne at the Reception were absolutely fantastic! We missed our connection with a tour company through no fault of our own (we were sent to the wrong train station by the TGV staff at Gare du Nord.) Frederique spent over an hour calling TGV, and the tour company Westcapades to try to either get us another time or at least some of the money (over $1000.00 prepaid for 4 people ) back. We were turned down on both counts. But not without Frederique trying! More thanks to her than I could ever express. Both of the mademoiselles went out of their way booking restaurants - etc., for the four of us. Myra Renault, Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for all the Paris sights”
Reviews.Author: unigirl
Reviews.Content: My now-husband and I were looking for somewhere clean and comfortable, that would be near to the major sights of Paris, for a couple of nights at the end of our honeymoon. The Eiffel Seine provided us with all of that - and more. Thank you fellow TripAdvisors - you've come up trumps again! The hotel is immediately opposite the Bir Hakeim Metro station, and about two minutes walk from Champ de Mars - Tour Eiffel RER station (you come out of the station, cross the main road, and you're practically at the hotel). Upon our arrival at the hotel, the charming receptionist (who spoke excellent English) gave us some information about the hotel, and advised us our room would be ready in three minutes - it was ready in even less than that! We paid â‚¬320 for two nights in a classic room, so were delighted to be given a complimentary upgrade to a club room as we were on our honeymoon - totally unexpected, and very much appreciated! We had room 405, which was on the 4th floor, and overlooked the road and metro line. We had no noise at all from the Metro, and the road was only a little noisy during the day. Who spends all their time in their room in Paris during the day anyway?! The room was spacious compared to what we had been expecting, and had modern Art Deco style decor. The bathroom was also very modern and had an amazingly powerful shower. The only negative comment I could make about our room was that the handle for the shower was a bit loose, as was the door handle to the bathroom, and there was a small stain on the carpet next to the bed. None of these things caused a major problem nor ruined our trip - just something we noticed. We couldn't comment on the food in the hotel as we didn't eat there, nor did we drink in the bar. We asked the receptionist where we could go for nice evening meals, and she directed us to the Latin Quarter / Notre Dame area (about 10 minutes away on the RER). In that area, you can find some really good value restaurants (as well as the expensive ones) that provide good quality French cuisine. On our first night, we had a two course meal each, a pichet of wine and a bottle of water for about â‚¬40 which we thought was very reasonable. A three-course meal in the Latin Quarter again with the same drinks was about â‚¬45. Definitely have some French onion soup if you can! For breakfast, we were looking for pastries and hot drinks. If you turn left out of the hotel and walk for 7-8 minutes along Boulevard de Grenelle, you will come across Stephane Secco's bakery / patisserie which is on the left hand side of the road. We had two pastries each and a hot drink each which set us back about â‚¬9.50 - and they were delicious too. There is a supermarket right near to the hotel, which is great for buying bottled water and other essentials, and there are several cash machines between the hotel and the bakery, too. We had booked a couple of excursions before we went to Paris. We paid approx Â£190 for a Paris Illuminations tour by coach, followed the late performance of Moulin Rouge with champagne. The coach tour (run by Paris Vision, and we booked through Expedia) was very informative and lasted about 90 minutes, taking you past all the major sights and many more. Moulin Rouge was OK - though we had no room to move in our seats, we queued for ages to get in, and there were boobs out the entire time. I'd say if you're desperate to see it, then do, but if you're toying between that and something else at the same price - go for the other option! We also went on a lunch cruise with Bateaux Parisiens which starts from near the Eiffel Tower and lasts for about 2 hours. We had the middle class of service, so were sat next to a window. We had booked directly with Bateaux Parisiens, and were thrilled to be given our own table - we were expecting to be on a table of 4 - and subsequently a bottle of wine to share. Our three course meal was absolutely brilliant - the iced nougat was to die for - and we really enjoyed the musical entertainment whilst on board. Worth every penny. So to conclude, if you're looking for a hotel in Paris that is near to all of the major sights, has a comfortable bed, and has amazing staff that will do everything they can to help make your stay fantastic - then book this hotel! Thank you to the reception staff at the hotel - you made us feel very welcome, and were so helpful in directing us to where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly hotel very close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Margaret033
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel with clean well appointed rooms. The staff were very helpful from the minute we arrived to the minute we left - nothing was too much trouble. It was approx 5 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and a lovely walk along the banks of the Seine to lots of other Paris landmarks. The Metro is literally opposite the hotel so very convenient for us to visit Sacre Coeur. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: FromFLtoItaly
Reviews.Content: Located a minute's walk from a Metro stop and an RER stop, and just a few minutes to the Eiffel Tower you couldn't find a better hotel for the price. Friendly English speaking staff buzz you in after dark, which is nice. Room is small, which is to be expected. No noise from the Metro, only from honking cars below. We were so tired from walking all day though it didn't bother us much. Didn't pay for the breakfasts as there are cheaper and better places a few streets over. They offer free wifi but the signal was very weak from our 3rd floor room and only could connect if I sat near the window. General Advice: learn and use the Metro/RER trains immediately and don't forget to have omelets while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “immaculate & great location: tower around corner!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in April, and we so pleased. We did get a Club room as we had read the rooms were small, and it was perfect. Our bathroom was huge, big shower (and yes, there was no shelf, which was a little inconvenent but ok). We had a big window that overlooked the metro/train station at Bir Hakim but the noise really wasn't too bad. Our bed was huge and comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. The room was pristine clean, nice big closet and mirror. the hallways are small, as well as the elevator... we are small people and the two of us barely fit in the elevator. Also, the halls have sensor lights that turn on as you walk so sometimes you have to walk slow to light your way. Also, I felt very secure, the doors to the lobby were locked after a certain point at night, and the (rather large) man at the desk had to let you in, so people off the street couldn't be wandering the hotel. We did not eat breakfast there (seemed expensive to us) but the cafe next door was good, and there is a supermarket down the block if you turn left out the entrance to the hotel. but what really made this hotel excellent was the location. It is next to a cafe on either side, and when you walk to the corner and turn the corner, it takes your breath away: the eiffel tower is right there! we were able to run out at night to see the lights glimmer on the hour, and see it during the day at different times and different views as we walked around the neighborhood. It was magical. It was easy to take the subway around town, and the staff was very helpful with questions on directions. Also the price for this hotel was very reasonable for a centrally located hotel in Paris. I would absolutely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: DANDS66
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at this Hotel. So many Hotels to choose from but this one deserves its rating. Good location. Nice room and spotlessly clean. We did request a quiet room and certainly we never heard any noise. All the staff were very friendly and helpful with very good English. Relaxed atmosphere and felt very welcome. Breakfast was ample and set us up for the day. I would stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Eiffel Seine Hotel was a great hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: finwhale
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine was a great hotel. It was a five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine river. It was across the street from the metro and we were able to find our way to the beautiful Paris attractions very easily. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They spoke english better than many people that you encounter in the U.S. I don't believe our vacation could have been any better. A brief review of the Parisians that we met. They were also very friendly and helpful. Quite a few times when we were looking at our map and lost someone would would come up to us and offer to help in perfect english.

Reviews.Title: “very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kg26
Reviews.Content: good hotel in a quite location near the Eiffel tower. cafes and supermarkets near hotel. metro station opposite and tour bus stop 2 mins away. we had the club room which was a good size and had tea and coffee making facilities. rooms are clean and modern. a bit away from the center of Paris but easy to get around from this location. overall a good hotel in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous clean and comfortable hotel, staff friendly and attentive.”
Reviews.Author: jujuloz
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in central paris, it is located near the eiffel tower and across from the seine, there are excellent transport links, the bir hakeim RER is immediately across the road (did not hear any noise) and the champs de mar eiffel metro is a few minutes walk. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, speak good english and can direct you to your destinations. Although the breakfast is pricey it is good and there are numerous places nearby at a cheaper price. An excellent all round comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MACEMC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine 3/30-4/2/10. Overall, it was a positive experience. On the positive side, it has a great location and the metro is right across the street. The hotel is decorated nicely. On the negative side, the rooms are small and look as though they could use some fresh paint. Our bathroom looked a little worn and tired as well. The hotel advertised free wifi and it didn't work for the entire duration of our stay. That was a real frustration since I had reported it immediately and was told it would be taken care of. We had to wait to use the 1 computer available to guests of the hotel. The immediate area around the hotel offers little as far as restaurants that are any good. You will get ripped off... they are not worth the money. Travel elsewhere for food. We would return to the Eiffel Seine...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a perfect weekend away!!”
Reviews.Author: NuttersCG
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Paris, a romantic weekend away just me & my husband. After reviewing lots of hotels in Paris I had started to feel I was never going to find one with excellent reviews - them I found The Eiffel Seine. We stepped off the RER and there it was right in front of us! On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff, who were very helpful throughout our stay. Our room was quite small, but from my trawling of the internet I think most hotels in Paris are quite small. It was lovely - very clean, bed linen crisp and clean, bathroom spotless, complete with tv and mini bar - what more could you want. Had a very nice view over a pretty courtyard. The location of the hotel was ideal, as you leave the hotel and turn the corner, there right infront of you is the Eiffel Tower!!!!!!! Also shops and restaurants all around - great. We would definately go back to this hotel - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to Immerse Yourself in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DadAndPapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during March Break (school holidays). Having stayed at a two-star on a previous visit to Paris (and being used to North American hotels), we elected to spend a bit more on a three-star. It was PERFECT! This was such a wonderful hotel! It is right off the RER/Metro (you can walk underground to Bir Hakeim Station) where you can go anywhere, and the Eiffel Tower is literally around the corner. The neighbourhood is safe for walking in, though we spent most of our time in other arrondissements. Despite the proximity to the metro, it was quiet (and our room faced the tracks). We had a package deal, so our breakfasts were included, and were just what we needed to head out for the day. We are just down the street from Poliane, where you should treat yourself to one of the best bakeries in town. There was a small fridge in the room which was nice to have. The rooms are small by North American standards, but reasonable by Parisian standards. The bathroom was EXCELLENT by Paris standards. The decor was nice, and the walls were well insulated. There is a comically small elevator which was helpful as we were on the sixth floor. The staff were always very nice. We go to France every couple of years, and will strongly consider this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: janiemacCoventry
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Location perfect, literally just a few minutes away from the Eiffel Tower. Staff where incredibly helpful even giving us French lessons!!! The room was excellent and very spacious (room 12). Having read other reviews (which were very helpful) we took the advice and ate our breakfast at the local cafes. We can't comment on the food at The Eiffel as we didn't dine there. Although we did use their bar and treated ourselves to half a bottle of Champagne, unfortunately we didn't look at the price, a mighty 27euros!!!!! hence we only drank there once!!! But having said that we would definitely use the hotel again. Well done Eiffel Seine, you made out trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: GandV2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, exceptionally helpful staff, small room but very clean, and the balcony with view of the Seine was a bonus. Conveniently near a train station, but not too noisy. 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Good continental breakfast, with some hot options - boiled eggs and small sausages. Expensive, but so is all of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greyo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Right at the Bir-Hakeim metro stop and around the corner from the Champ de Mar RER stop. Room was much bigger than expected and was a great surprise when we arrived. Staff were helpful and friendly and you can walk to some prime tourist spots such as Effiel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Trocadero. Easily one of the best medium priced hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, very clean, comfortable, good location!”
Reviews.Author: TigerBJ
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our short break at this hotel. We were glad that we had booked the breakfast as it was a very convenient start to the day. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable (we had the cheapest room). By the way there wasn't tea/coffee facility in this grade of room. The metro is very handy for exploing the sights quickly and we also enjoyed the more leisurely Batobus.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Zara
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful! Upon our arrival at noon we were immediately checked in by a lovely lady on the front desk. They kindly upgraded myself and my partner to a superior room which was great, the room and bathroom were immaculately clean. I did contact them a few weeks prior our trip and requested whether this was possible as it was my birthday and they did! Reception was very welcoming. We stayed for one night (Arrived Sunday - checked out Monday noon). Hotel is close to all the activities we booked. Our Bateaux Dinner Cruise and the Eiffel Tower, both situated 5 mins walk from Hotel Seine Eiffel. Monday morning we checked out the Eiffel Tower, and walked to the Louvre which was 5KM away. You could easily use the metro but the weather was lovely and we wanted to check out the sites along the rive Seine. Also a friend of mine told me you can catch a cruise that acts like a bus and stops at all the tourist hot spots! There's also bikes you can rent outside the hotel. Hotel overall was lovely, the people were great. Located right outside Bir-Hakeim metro station which is 30 mins from Gare Du Nord (Single ticket was 1.60 Euro) and quite a few cafes, crepe stands and various restaurants dotted down Boulevard de Grenelle.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but adequate room”
Reviews.Author: OwlsAerie
Reviews.Content: The fresh bed linens and fluffy towels were well appreciated. Location for Eiffel Tower excellent, as is the Metro station right out the door. However, you will need to make at least one transfer on the metro to get to most other attractions. Limited number of restaurants in near vicinity. We were very impressed by the design of our bathroom overall, however, there was no place in the shower to put any bath essentials, such as soap or shampoo except on the floor. It was very inconvenient. We were amazed at the thoughtful design of the automatic lights in the halls and stairs. The breakfast room had a lovely atmosphere, however, we were very disappointed in the choice and quality of items. We have come to expect the high cost of food due to the dollar to euro conversions, but the quality to cost for this "full" breakfast was very disappointing. Use the bistro next door instead.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to base your stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TuPz
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel, within 5 minutes walk of the Eiffel Tower. We arrived on the Eurostar into Gare Du Nord and it was about 30 minutes transfer to the Hotel by Metro. The rooms are quaint, with modern decoration. Ours wasn't a massive room, but perfectly adequate for people exploring the city and wanting a comfortable place to sleep and relax at the end of the day. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest, Romantic, Unique hotel near the eiffel!”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds00
Reviews.Content: From CDG it was very easy to catch train and get to the hotel. Follow the signs for paris by train, go to the ticket window and buy a pass for the number of days you will be in paris and catch the RER B to st Michael/Notre Dame get off there and go up the escalator and get on the RER C to champs de mars Eiffel and when you walk up the satirs out of the metro your first site is the Eiffel! Wonderful. Walk across the street past the cafe's and your hotel is right there. From the second you walk in the door you greeted with freindly personnel that will check your bag if your room is not yet ready( early am arrival from the states) And they are very helpful. There is a great cafe and pizza place right next door with reasonable rate in paninis and pizza. the hotel is small and the elevator is very small but it is different than staying in a huge chain hotel! It makes your trip different, The room is small but the bed is very comfortable!!! We had a balcony to stand out on and just take it all in! There is a wetbar in the room but a bit pricey as is normal. For the price you cannot go wrong with the ease and location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to relax after a busy day in Paris”
Reviews.Author: paulie101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was top rate and a perfect place to relax after siteseeing in busy Paris. The location was second to none right on the Bir-Hikiem (number 6) line and next to an rer station. Staff were very freindly and always greeted us with a smile. The bed was very comfortable and the shower brilliant. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxed hotel this is the one for you. The website shows how nice it is but its even better than it looks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ejstar79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We booked via the internet and got a terrific deal for a 3 night stay - the best deal I found in Paris. The hotel was lovely and modern - great ambiance and wonderfully helpful staff. The gentleman at reception was very welcoming and had lots of advice and tips for seeing the city. The location could not be beat! 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and steps away from the metro and RER train. Lots of great restaurants nearby and a supermarket just a block away. The room was comfortable (very comfy beds!), although small - but that is to be expected in Paris. Even though it was small, it had all the amenities, including mini-bar, tv, wifi (better reception in the lobby), heated towel rack, hair-dryer etc. We loved this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable, friendly place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: afirmiano
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a standard double room. Our room was a little small, but comfortable. Room and bath cleaned every day, friendly and helpful staff, wi-fi, good amenities, great location: 5 minutes away from Eiffel Tower and very close to the station metro. The breakfast was expensive by offering (14 euros). We recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight :)”
Reviews.Author: vbokan
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days there. Absolute recommendation for hotel. Location is excellent, 2 metro stations couple steps away (literally) and you can get wherever you want in 15-20 minutes max, but we suggest walking since hotel is 30m away from Seine and we walked by it every night returning back to hotel. Real pleasure. Also, hotel neighbourhood felt pretty safe and felt very comfortable during the night also. Room was a bit small but nothing that would cause any problem. If you're having trouble with a room size in Paris, then you must ask yourself why did you come to Paris? Staying in room or enjoying the city? Perfectly clean, toilette too. Bed was extremely comfortable. Linen perfectly clean. Almost nothing wrong, except rooms were a bit overheated during night and wifi signal wasn't the best, probably because of the rooms distance from router but nothing that could cause trouble. Free wifi included and TV with mostly french TV stations. Staff was really great and helpful. Breakfast is 14EUR but we choose to visit bakeries for it. Definitely going back to Eiffel Seine next time when we go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AhberZ
Reviews.Content: Overall it is a great stay in Eiffel Seine Hotel. The only negative feedback I have is there is no heater in the toilet and no hot water available in the room. Other then this everything is great as per review by everyone else here.

Reviews.Title: “very good on the whole”
Reviews.Author: I-love-to-shop-more
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Our hearts sank when we saw how close we were to the metro station, but we slept in one of the front 'club' rooms and never heard a thing. It is in a great situation for sightseeing. I recommend the use of the metro rather than taxis as it is far cheaper, and you soon get the hang of it. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as it is far too pricey. There are cafes next door which are cheaper and in the surrounding streets. You need to really shop around when it comes to eating out though, with the exchange rate so poor, it is truly extortionate at the moment. My only gripe was the tea and coffee in the room. We specifically asked for milk as it was not provided, and we were left one mini carton for 2 of us. Each day there were just 2 sachets of coffee and I asked for more to be left when we went out and there was none when we returned. The man on night duty said he had no access to it at night, so we had to go without. It just seemed a bit penny pinching to me, and a hotel should be able to access such basic requests 24 hrs a day. Other than that it was clean and comfortable, and a good base for any stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel nestled in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jtowners
Reviews.Content: My husband & I always wanted to visit Paris, and we used Trip Advisor to find the Eiffel Seine. It was WONDERFUL. The staff is very friendly, helpful and responsive. They also speak fluent English and gave excellent directions and recommendations. The location - right across from the metro, two blocks from the Eiffel Tower and near many nice restaurants and a market was outstanding. We purchased a Paris Pass, and a metro pass was included with it - an easy and convenient way to see the city. We stayed in a room through the courtyard, and the room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. There is a crepe stand at the end of the street, which we enjoyed too! We have traveled to many cities and the experience at this hotel was far above and beyond what we have found elsewhere. When we return to Paris, we will stay at the Eiffel Seine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: twinkhas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what all the other good reviews say it is. Amazing location, couldnt be closer to the eiffel tower and the seine with 2 metro lines a 2 minute walk away the rest of paris was so accessible. The service was impeccable and yes the rooms were small but ample however the rest of the hotel made up for this small inconvenience! we were unlucky enough to get a room at the end of the hall so we did hear quite a lot of noise from the pipes on the end of the building which did get annoying at times but wouldnt stop us from staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel with nice rooms, although a little on the small side. This was not an issue though. We had a family room which consisted of two separate room one with a double bed and the other with 2 single beds. Both rooms had an ensuite which was beautiful and clean. The rooms were at the end of a corridor and we were able to close a door off in the corridor that was leading to both rooms. This allowed us to have our own space and keeping the bedroom doors open when needed. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was worth the money. Staff were wonderful! The kids loved the free WIFI in the room. Eating establishments around the hotel were on the pricy side but nice. We ate dinner twice at the restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinRobbie
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from a 3 nights stay in Paris. We stayed the Eiffel Seine and what can I say?? First, the pros - Location is just brilliant (metro, Eiffel Tower & sight seeing buses all within 5 mins walking distance), the staff are SO helpful, friendly, mannerly and up for a laugh, rooms although small are comfortable and very clean with new towels and bed linen each day, the shower has great pressure and the bed was a dream to rest in. The decor is wonderful, very interesting and homely. There are many places to eat nearby along with supermarkets and bank link machines on the street. I loved the little shop with the fruit outside it, it was always open late so if we needed something to snack on instead of raiding the mini bar we would head down there instead. Now the cons of the trip, the lack of soundproofing in the hotel drove us mad! We could hear the people in the room beside ours talking and they weren't exactly shouting. When they got up at 8am one morning, the noise of them talking and opening and closing the wardrobe and bathroom doors woke my partner who then could not get back to sleep (i'd taken a sleeping tablet so didn't notice :-} ). The room could also be very hot so we slept with the window open but that was ok. Overall, I would recommend this wonderful hotel to everyone but just be aware that it might be a tad noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MMGLA
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. The service was fantastic. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful (especially when my boyfriend and I were trying to learn how to say things in French!), the hotel is completely energy efficient, the location is fabulous, and the decor is beautiful! If you don't want a small room--stay out of Europe! Of course the room was tiny, but was it unlivable?! Absolutely not! We were completely comfortable and we had the smallest room size the hotel offers. The view was beautiful (so beautiful that we slept with our curtains open so we could see the glow of the city lights each night). I hated leaving and when I return to Paris, I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: norfolkexpat
Reviews.Content: Been to Paris many times- this time as I was taking my daughter, decided to stay away from Montmartre., where I have always been based. Glad we did , because the Eiffel Seine is a little gem, right opposite Bir Hakeim metro. As the Metro is so cheap and quick you can be at the Louvre or Notre Dame within twenty minutes. Very helpful front desk, all information provided, and the Eiffel is five minutes walk, with the Seine one minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CSRE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great: 2 minutes from metro, very nice staff, comfortable rooms (yes, small too), wi-fi, a lot of tv channels, nice bathroom with amenities. No breakfast included and they charge 14 Euros for it, i would recommend eating somewhere else for that price. You can also but all kind of tours right in the reception, and they provide you with a map and all the info you might need to know Paris. Only thing i would add to make it perfect is bath robes! I would stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly well located”
Reviews.Author: JASGOLDY
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, well located but room a bit small but probably normal for the size of hotel. Location near the Eiffel tower, a Metro Station and an RER station was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel. Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Leopardstars
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Paris. My husband and I stayed here from 9/26/09 - 10/3/09. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful and courteous. There are a few interesting things about the hotel. 1. In order to operate the lights in your room, you must have the key card in the slot by the door. 2. You must give your "key" to the front desk whenever you leave the hotel. Entry to the room itself is keyless (think of keyless entry for cars - it's the same for the room). Since this would be expense to replace if lost and the fact that the hotel name and your room number is on the "key card". I didn't mind handing it in. One less thing to lose. Fortunately, we only had to wait for the front desk attendant to come back once. 3. The elevator REALLY is small. We had quite a few bags since we were travelling to Europe for two weeks. So my husband went up with two bags and then I went up for the other two. If you are on the lower floors, I would just use the stairs. Since we were on the 6th, we tended to use the elevator. Rooms - DO NOT book anything smaller than a club room as these are small rooms. I was expecting this because of the reviews on this site, but was still surprised. I believe my university dorm room was larger. Despite this, we still managed to fit both of us and all our bags into the room without tripping over anything or each other. To get the king size bed, the hotel pushes two doubles together - a standard practice in Europe. However, I didn't even notice this until the third night. The bathroom was great though and it was nice to have an actual shower Location - This hotel is in a fabulous location. The Eiffel Tower is no more than a 10 minute walk away. This is perfect for those who want to visit it during the day and see it lit up at night. NOTE - the light show starts on the hour. By the Eiffel Tower is also a stop for one of the sightseeing bus companies. We purchased a two day pass and a river tour. This served as our transportation for two of the days we were in Paris. Les Invalides (home of Napoleon's tomb) is approximately a 20 minute walk. Right across the street from the hotel is the Bir-Hakeim Metro stop and the Champ de Mars RER stop. Using these stations you can see all the Paris sights including the Palace of Versailles (use the RER). My best advice is to purchase a carnet of tickets for the Metro as they are good for Metro and the RER. My husband and I only ate breakfast at the hotel once as we felt 7 euros for coffee, juice and a pastry was overpriced. If you go down the street (away from the Seine) there is agrocery store where you can purchase two croissants for 1.5 euros. We also enjoyed several crepes from the crepe stand that is on the corner. We did eat at both the restaurants by the hotel and while the meals were good, we felt that it wasn't anything we couldn't find at home, especially the Italian place. However, go down the street (away from the Seine) and you can find a number of authentic French restaurants. If you go for their special, you can get a good meal at a decent price. However, these restaurants do not start serving supper until 7pm, so if you can't wait this long, go to the restaurants near the hotel as they serve throughout the day. All in all, we would definitely return to this hotel if we were to visit Paris again. Pros - location (near the Eiffel Tower and the Metro, great river views. Cons - Room size, breakfast prices

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kmccallum14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff were all very helpful and very friendly. We don't speak any french but it was no problem at all. The hotel is right across the street from the Metro and we used it to go all over Paris. There is also a grocery store just down the street which was very convinent. There are many restuarants on the same street (and many more around the area). It was great walking by the Eiffel Tower almost every evening on our way back from sightseeing. I would stay here again if we ever go back to Paris (which we would love to do!!). We had such a great time. The rooms are smaller then US hotels but the beds are extremely comfortable and we really weren't in the room that much. We spent a lot of time out sightseeing or drinking wine in the lobby. It was great having free internet access too!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and really cozy.”
Reviews.Author: writingwanderer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in a Paris hotel. Our first was in the outskirts of Paris and very economical. For this trip we were looking for location to be able to explore the city on our own. The Eiffel Seine was perfect! Two blocks from the Eiffel Tower and directly across from the Metro stop. There were also lots of cafes to explore for a morning breakfast as we passed on the one offered by the hotel which was a bit pricey. The hotel itself was beautiful. Lovely lobby. Personnel were extremely helpful, gracious and accommodating. Tiny elevator was a little tough getting two of us in with two suitcases. Room was very nice with a big window overlooking a courtyard. It was however, tiny with hardly room to move once we opened suitcases and/or sat at the desk to check email. Had to climb over the bed to get around anyone in the chair. The bathroom was good sized considering the room size. Nice shower/tub. Good amenities. The only other problem was that the room became very warm and we could not get control of the heat. We ended up sleeping with the window wide open. It was comfortable but I was concerned that we'd end up with a pigeon inside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynniebud
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris quite a few times now and this is easily the best hotel I've stayed in. The location is perfect, and although I was worried about potential noise from the metro station across the road I didn't hear anything at all once in my room. I stayed with my Dad in a twin room, which was basically two single beds pushed right up against each other with enough space to walk around the outside. It was a small room (for the price - Â£115 for a twin room per night) but immaculately clean with lovely decor, and the service was fantastic. 24hr access so we didn't have to worry about being back for a certain time, and friendly knowledgeable staff who couldn't do enough to help. I will definitely be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff! lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: domridley
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for what we wanted...it was a cozy Parisian hotel in a fantastic location - next to the seine, around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and a metro stop outside the front of the Hotel. The room itself was lovely, small but exactly what we needed...and very clean. For a base while doing the sites in Paris this hotel is perfect...we will be going back to Paris and back to this hotel. The only thing i would say, is don't do the breakfast in the hotel...go around the corner to one of the cafes for breakfast or one of the thousands of cafe/brasseries in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: scraffy
Reviews.Content: Was my first time to Paris and was totally impressed with this hotel and loved the decor, the room was bigger than expected as every one made comments on how small they were, but think there were various sizes. Was very easy to find the hotel and extremely close to everything with a supermarket and cafes close by, the staff were very friendly and helpful and I would definately come to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Escoffierf
Reviews.Content: The hotel being so close to the subway and close to the Eiffel Tower and Hotel des Invalides made this the perfect location for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RufflesArkansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eiffel Seine for a little over a week and it was just wonderful! It was in a great location-the Eiffel Tower is just around the corner, the Statue of Liberty is within walking distance, and the Metro was right across the street! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. Every morning we would come down to a very friendly staff who made it so easy to travel around Paris. We would just let them know where we were headed and they would pull out a map and tell us the best way to get there! They spoke perfect English so it was very easy to communicate with them. The rooms were very clean and the window opened up to a great view of Paris!! I would suggest anyone who is a first time traveler like ourselves to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: hauckjb
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine had a great location. It was right next to the subway station and about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel itself was very small. The stairway and elevator were not very well lit up and our room was very small. They also have a weird policy of making you give the front desk your room key everytime you leave the hotel. Then you ask for you key back when you return. The staff was helpful when I asked but not overly friendly. I would rate this hotel on a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the highest a 6.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: rgbdo
Reviews.Content: A real Parisian experience. Located close to a market, the Tower, cafes and the Metro. The rooms were clean but definitely smaller than what Americans are use to. No alarm clock, so bring a reliable travel clock or a cellphone. Also, free Wi-Fi and local telephone calls. Still, very quiet rooms and we slept well after long days of walking. The staff was extremely helpful with us and everyone (as I witnessed the concierge help another, non-american couple). Never ate breakfast at the Hotel, it wasn't necessary. Overall, a very good experience, and what I expected after reading all of these reviews before I booked it. I would go back to the Eiffel Seine again, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: beautifulbeaufort
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms. Two blocks from eiffel Tower and just across the street from the metro, the location could not have been better. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The lift broke on the first night and I was on the fifth floor, so I requested a room on the lobby floor and was relocated the next morning to a suite off the lobby and adjacent to the courtyard. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: chris37422
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located fantastically, with nearby Metro and RER stations. The River Seine is a stone's throw away and the Eiffel Tower is 5 minutes walk. The hotel is full of Parisian charm, decorated superbly with excellent friendly staff at all hours of the day. The rooms were immaculate and the cleaning staff do a fantastic job-the unsung heroes of the hotel!. Rooms were a little small, but bed was comfortable and the bathroom modern. On the negative side, for the price you pay for the rooms, breakfast should be included. The breakfast is expensive when bought alone and there are plenty of more filling and cheaper options around, with pattiseries, supermarkets and restaraunts on the same road. A great stay, and a lovely hotel, and would recommend, just think the breakfast lets it down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect haven for business trip”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, well designed rooms. Free WiFi. Excellent breakfast. Excellent location. Helpful staff. Totally different in nature from the massive Pullman and Mercure establishments just around the corner. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jobeato
Reviews.Content: Eiffel Seine hotel is situated in a perfect location. Everything is near.- supermarkets, cafe's, metro and attractions. Just a few minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are a bit small; but that is common in Europe. The hotel is very clean and so is the surrounding. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. We also had no problem communicating with them. They spoke english very well. They even let us check in early. My only complaint is the air conditioning. In the winter time, the air conditioner did not have the option to choose fan or cool. It was preset to heat only. At times, it got so warm, we had to turn the air conditioner off and open the windows. Other than this, this hotel is great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great location, Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: megmcaleese
Reviews.Content: Such a pleasant little hotel, right next to the Eiffel Tower. Perfect for romantic getaway. Opposite to a metro station so makes sightseeing very convenient. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: grpGeorgia_USA
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, very helpful with everything. I would go back today!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: mrosalie
Reviews.Content: Reserved here through a package (air/hotel) on Orbitz, and feel we got a tremendous deal considering the quality of the hotel experience. The standard rooms have very nice outfitted bathrooms, bedrooms are a bit too small for two people to walk around at the same time, haha. Rooms are cleaned very thoroughly daily. Front desk staff is very fluent in English, didn't really pick their brains too much as I had done a good deal of research before arriving. The breakfast was around 15 euro a day, never did it as its possible to eat breakfast very cheaply in the surrounding neighborhood. Walk down Blvd Grenelle (away from the river) and you'll hit 3 bakeries before hitting the next metro station. There's a grocery store, Monoprix, one block down thats a good place to buy meats, cheese, and they have really good values on wine. As far as sit down meals, we found a nice little pocket of restaurants within walking distance by the Charles Michel Metro stop. Only other things to keep in mind, we got a lot of rain during our visit in Early Dec (obviously not the hotel's fault) Also, if you like to walk, the walks to the big Paris sites just seem a little too far from this hotel, but the Metro/RER will get you there cheaply and quickly

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: rixichik
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel, the room was small but perfectly formed and not at all cramped. Staff friendly and in good location. There is a metro right outside the door and both SNCF and RER within 5 mins walking. All of the main land marks are within walking distance and the hop on hop off bus and boat are literally 2-3 mins away. I will certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NI_Triper
Reviews.Content: Just round the corner from the Eiffel Tower. Tube just across the road and another line, just around the corner. Hotel very clean- Mackintosh Decor, Staff were very friendly. Rooms may be a little small if you are larger than average - but grand for us. Got a good deal on the internet through TA. This is the 2nd time we've stayed in this hotel, probably says enough in itself!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place great location”
Reviews.Author: uberhartmonkeybert
Reviews.Content: Nice place in a great location. It is just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower right on the Seine. Directly across from a Metro station. During the night you can even see the tower reflected in the office building across the street. Free wireless was nice as well. The hotel staff spoke English and were very helpful. We didn't bother with the restaurant or bar in the hotel since there was so much variety within walking distance. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the station but it was surprisingly quiet when the windows were closed. There were a fair amount of cafes and small stores nearby. Further down the road there is a corner that has a bakery, a cheese shop and a cooked meats shop. We made a fun picnic out of it. Some small problems were that the TV was pretty weird, it wouldn't turn on all the time. Also, if you are used to American hotels, I'm sure you've noticed the lack of alarm clocks in European hotels. The TV served as the alarm clock, but since it wouldn't always turn on, I never trusted it. The room was also very hot (we visited in November). We turned down the heat, and even turned it off completely, but we would always have to open the window sometime in the middle of the night. The soundproofing on the window was really good, but when we had it open it was too noisy outside to sleep. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Setting”
Reviews.Author: swfedor
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Inexpensive accomodations with lots of personality. Extremely clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. Good location near transportation and sightseeing. Bed was roomy and comfortable and the room itself was nicely decorated. Would recommend in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and modern with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzie000Liverpool
Reviews.Content: The hallways were very small and our room was small, but very clean and very modern. Everything you need in a hotel room. The hotel is in an excellent location, right opposite the tube station (which you can get to from the main train at the Airport - the train ticket you buy at the Airport covers you for the mainline train and the tube fare to the hotel). The Eiffel Tower can be seen from the corner of the road that the hotel is on, which is quite a nice 10 minute walk away. All around the hotel area are restaurants and cafes, all reasonably priced, also a supermarket to stock up on water, wine & snacks. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location eiffel tour on ur door step! lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: whelanIreland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, website not at all decieving, what you see is what you get, hotel staff very friendly and welcomed any questions and helped with directions to help get you around the city, the metro is outside the door( very quiet never heard it at all). plenty of very french style cafes and restraunts on your door step, highly recommend it, you will not be dissappointed

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CSS01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located next to Eiffel Tower and across the road from metro and train. The breakfast was served in a small living room but it was always very good, with friendly faces by the staff. The staff helps when you need a place to go out dinner and to buy essentials.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k.”
Reviews.Author: anniversary30years
Reviews.Content: The location was superb, but rooms were rather small hallways needed more lighting. could use smaller towels for washing your face! I also think the hotel could have had some essentials that you may have forgotten to bring, otherwise our stay there was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with easy access to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: bunny25
Reviews.Content: You can decide to use the metro right outside the hotel or walk to many of the famous landmarks in Paris. Hotel had everything we required for a short city stay. Very clean and comfortable. I would recommend happily for such a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Added tremendously to a marvelous Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: UmyIllinois
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, wonderful service, superb location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeek23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on a metro stop as well as the C RER line. It was also convenient to many places to eat and just 2 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was very clean and very small. We had a corner room with very odd angled walls, but were able to split the two twin beds apart and still have some walking room. The bathroom is modern and clean but the half shower wall was very strange. Even with the shower head angled towards the corner, water still spilled out to the floor. The hotel also has a laptop at the bar with free internet access which was a nice plus. We got a good deal on the room by booknig at least 3 nights, for around $120/night. I probably wouldn't pay $200/night for this hotel, but it was fantastic for the price we booked at.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travelfan31
Reviews.Content: We were very suprized by the hotel. It was in a great location right across from the Metro station and around the corner from the Rail station. Three minutes from the Eiffel tower and lots of restaurants around. We spent four days there and loved every minute of it. The staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was very good and lots to eat. Concidering we were right across from a Metro station we never heard the metro unless we opened the balcony doors, and even then it was fairly quiet. The only thing is you have to be carefull with the elevator as it only holds about 500 pounds total, also as they are very much into saving energy so the light in the halls only come on when you are in the halls. Not a big problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: treichow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Paris. The location was great... we were able to walk everywhere or take the subway (stop within walking distance). Staff was very helpful and rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in great location”
Reviews.Author: MartinF99
Reviews.Content: At first glance, on a busy junction by the train station i had my doubts but the friendly staff, very clean rooms made our short stay really enjoyable. I went with my mum and dad and even they raved about it - that's some achievement!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Baralor
Reviews.Content: The location is super convenient you are close to all the most important points to visit in Paris!!, and you have the metro and the RER basically in the corner. The staff was amazing! so helpful, nice and polite and they are fluent in english, spanish and other languages. The room has everything you need and is clean and nice! I'm coming back to this hotel and I have recommended it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonNorfolkVA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from Oct.1,2009 til Oct.5th. The hotel is small,but great. Rooms are good,beds very comfortable and bathrooms are wonderful. Lots of local restaurants in the area. Great transportation close by. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Beautiful decor, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MsRobynG
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable hotel about a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and Metro/RER stations. The price is so reasonable, I was not expecting it to be nearly as nice as it was. It is a boutique-style hotel, as it is small, and has very nice and charming decor. The staff are very friendly as well. I would definitely stay here if I went to Paris again. It is misleading that it is a 3 star, as it is much nicer than many 4 stars I have stayed in in England.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Akisanta
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - took a family suite which were 2 seperate rooms with their own bathrooms at the end of a passage which we could close off. Although situated in a busy area the rooms were very quiet. The hotel is across the road from the Seine and around the corner (literally) from the Eiffel Tower. We would definately stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Outstanding Staff!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTravel4Fun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Eiffel Seine. One simply could not ask for a better location to see Paris. The hotel is located directly across the Blvd de Grennelle from a Paris Metro Stop that is the main line south to Versailles. It is within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The surrounding neighborhood is dotted with excellent bistros and restaurants, as well as a Boucherie (Butcher), cheese shop and several bakeries. Add a bottle of excellent French Cotes de Rhone and you have everything you need for a picnic in one of Paris' many parks. Drinking of wine (or beer) in the parks is legal, in case you are wondering. The staff at the Eiffel Seine are very knowledgeable about what to see and how to get there. The recommendations they made for restaurants were spot-on. Rooms are very clean, but small by American standards. (or is it that American hotel rooms are large by world standards?) If your room faces the Blvd de Grennelle, be prepared for some street noise - noticeable, but not intolerable. The high rating on Trip Advisor is one of the reasons we booked this hotel. We highly recommend it, and will stay there in the future when we return to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcome to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Calpurnia09
Reviews.Content: I spent my first night in Europe in this lovely boutique hotel. I was very tired after a long trip from Australia, but although it was only about 9am when I arrived, I was pleasantly greeted in perfect English and taken without fuss to a lovely, quiet ground-floor room off a little courtyard dotted with pots of sacred bamboo. The large bedroom was decorated with beautifully framed prints of paintings by Gustav Klimt, one of my favourite artists. The bathroom was also large and very clean with a full-sized bath. After settling in I decided to explore and the concierge gave me a map and pointed out how to get to where I wanted using the metro station across the road. It is easy to get to any of Paris's attractions from here. Although the hotel is on a busy road I was impressed by the quiet, relaxed atmosphere inside the Eiffel Seine. The friendliness of all the staff, particularly the concierge Jean-Francois, is one of the hotel's greatest assets. Only breakfast is served at the hotel and while light meals are available at cafes only steps away I would suggest walking along the Seine to the the bridge across the road from the Eiffel tower. After crossing this impressive bridge walk though the Trocadero gardens and across the courtyard between the two museums until you come to the Cafe Trocadero, where you can buy a two course meal for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizziec19
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise for my birthday, and I was very pleased with the hotel. Good location near to metro. Nice to walk by the river and close to the Eiffel tower. Rooms were a reasonable size, our room overlooked the busy road but the windows kept all the noise out. Comfortable bed meant we had very goods nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Clover85
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and regretted we didn't stay another. The room was small, but everything else about the hotel was stand out. The bed was soooo comfortable; the bathroom was pristine; the staff were friendly; a laptop was available to use free of charge; and it was located right behind the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Margil6559
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and across the street from the Metro station. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are small, but not unusual for Europe. I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “memorable time”
Reviews.Author: ianodel
Reviews.Content: For a very special anniversary,I stayed here with my wife. The location could not be better.Each morning, after breakfast, we strolled out into the sunshine and just around the corner was the eiffel tower. The Seine is just metres away.The rooms are small and I would recommend upgrading to the club class room as the standard is too basic. We would love to come back

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grockle69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend break, having read all the great reviews. This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing. The rooms were quite spacious for France and very clean. Found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. Would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting paris. We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, stylish and great location!”
Reviews.Author: happyleaves
Reviews.Content: my husband and I and my parents stayed there for 4 nights in Sept and it was fantastic!! walking distance to the eiffel tower and around, easy for the metro and RER. They also have a laptop at the bar area for people to use and we used that for transferring data....Room is small but clean and quiet. Definitely a place to stay when visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: SebastianMelm0th
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It was great value, clean, with comfortable beds, modern bathroom, friendly staff and cool dÃ©cor. The breakfast is excellent: bread and croissants come from a local baker.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Dreababy217
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eiffel Seine was simply beautiful. From the moment we walked through the inward curving automatic doors we were taken by the dazzling details. Jean-Francois at the front desk was ever so helpful and got us last minute dinner reservations at a great restaurant (Chez Francis) with a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower..speaking of it's just a few blocks away from the hotel and clearly visible from it. The metro is directly in front of the hotel (when you exit, look to your right&there it is!). You can hop on the metro from either airport, super cheap & easy. Enjoy this place, we certaintly did!! Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Movesnegril
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 7th wedding anniversary in Paris. We booked Eiffel Seine due to its proximity to the Eiffel Tower and a very quick and easy connection to all the other places we wanted to see. The location was perfect.
