We were greeted and checked in by a lovely gentleman who was the fountain of all knowledge for Paris visitors, very patient and very polite - simply great service. The hotel was very clean and decorated in Art Deco style, which we love. The room was small, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom was petite for sure but just the ticket (shampoo, soap supplied). Breakfast was really great and set us up with hot and cold food. We will visit Paris again and we will look no further for a place to stay other than Eiffel Seine Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Starlagalaxe
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel! The services was magnificent! Everything you need is only a couple of steps away! I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the Hotel for a Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BibiPaul
Reviews.Content: Small well place hotal right by the metro and the Eiffel Tower, very pleasent staff, clean pleasent rooms. Helpful information provided - will use again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: peanut94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eiffel Seine with my boyfriend from 9-3 to 9-10 and I have to say, the hotel could not have been better. We were across the street from 2 metro stations. The Champs Mar station is a great station to have close since it takes you straight to Versailles, and takes you to the transfer points of all the other sites of the city including the airport. The rooms were small but very clean and well maintained. The hotel was also in a perfect location to restaurants and souvenir shops. The restaurants are literally next door for several blocks. Additionally, the hotel is about 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and across the street from the Seine River. From the hotel, we were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre (about 45 minute walk along the river), and Place de Concorde. If you don't want to walk, these sites are about a 10 to 15 minute metro ride away. The hotel staff was also wonderful and it helped that they spoke English because my French is limited to 3 words. Overall, a fantastic stay and I would recommend this hotel to singles and couples travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel that lived up to it's reputation!”
Reviews.Author: LivingOneDayAtATime
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (7 years old) and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine during a family vacation to Paris. Prior to the trip I spent many many hours researching all the hotels trying to find one that could accommodate 3 to a room, was available, had good ratings and would not break the bank. Came across the Eiffel Seine and took a chance. In the end the chance paid off and had a wonderful stay at a great hotel. Pluses: * Location - Just down the street from the Eiffel Tower. Across the street was a subway entrance. Grocery store just down the street (the best route to go to try to avoid the insane Paris restaurant prices). * Hotel Itself - Clean and nice. The hotel is exactly what it looks like in the pictures. * Service - Excellent. No problems with English. Very helpful and friendly. * Room - Small, but very suitable. Clean. Good bed. Small fridge in room. No complaints. * Price - not cheap, but when you consider what you would pay elsewhere was well worth it. Side note: would definitely recommend staying in the heart of Paris and not in the suburbs. The hotel prices are cheaper in the suburbs, but you will end up paying a fortune in transportation costs and will end up wasting huge amounts of time with extra travel... * Negatives - We came in from London via the Eurostar train. We followed the directions provided by the hotel to find our way. Worked great up until we came out of the subway station (there are 2 close to the hotel - the RER and the Metro. Metro is across the street - RER is about a block away) - couldn't see signs, not sure where we were etc. Another words - we got lost for about 5 minutes and then all was good. * Only very small little things - didn't like the shower, had a few problems hooking up to the hotel wireless internet, the bathroom vanity had a few chips of wood stain out of it - that's about it... I have had the pleasure/displeasure of traveling quite a bit on business so have experienced some of the best and worst in terms of hotel experiences. Would rate this up there with some of the best I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iwouldratherdrive
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. The location is beyond perfect. Less than a block(more like 100 feet) to the subway station that can take you anywhere in Paris, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, but still tucked away not in the busiest section of Paris. The rooms were a tad small by American standards but to me that was what was so charming about this hotel. All the available space is designed perfectly and beautifully. The beds were comfortable the bathroom was beautiful. It is a smaller boutique style hotel but still has Free Wi-Fi and LAN internet. The staff is amazing and never misses an opportunity to help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: DMilneAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in brilliant location - only a 3 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Very friendly staff and very good value for money. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Londoncarls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine with my mum and sister for a girly weekend in Paris. It exceeded all our expectations. The staff were very helpful, hotel was lovely and clean, and located only a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower (with Bir Hakeim metro station just opposite) it is a very reasonable price. We had a triple room which consisted of twin beds and a camp bed which was very comfortable. The lift is very small, not sure if you had a pram or wheelchair it would be large enough but that is the only slight disadvantage I can think of for staying here. Breakfast is well worth the money as much better than your usual coffee and croissant. Cereals, yoghurts, fruit, toast, pastries, eggs - and the dining room is very modern and pleasant. We will definitely all be remembering this hotel for future trips and hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: NannieSan
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times and the standard is just as good this time as first time round - staff are really helpful and welcoming, room cleanliness is excellent and the buffet breakfast has a really good choice to suit all tastes. So convenient for the Bir Hakeim metro literally across the road from the hotel and just a short walk to the River Seine and Eiffel Tower - wouldnt stay anywhere else in Paris Sandra Moran

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience Start to Finish!”
Reviews.Author: awd6634
Reviews.Content: You hear about the tiny rooms in Europe and no bathrooms in room, etc., but this was a great hotel! I would always go back and stay there again. It was very clean, quiet, and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant, staff couldn't do enough for you”
Reviews.Author: TravellinKerry
Reviews.Content: It the perfect spot for attractions, on the Metros doorstep, round the corner from the Eiffel Towel and the staff are a font of information, they would suggest restaurants, mark them on the map, suggest best times for attractions, and even google presents for you! Only thing I would recommend is that they get some do not disturb signs as once they cleaners came in three times in half an hour, but fair play to them for trying, the receptionist did call to check if we wanted our room cleaned after that and they left us alone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in All of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: WNB95
Reviews.Content: where to start? our trip was perfect! the staff was amazing, so nice and helpful! when you check in they give you the DL on paris, its great! dont be fooled by the small hallways or the size of the building! the rooms are very roomy! we had a quadruple bedroom, my bedroom was breathtaking a balcony overlooking the streets of paris and a comfy bed, it was very relaxing! the subway is across the street from the hotel and the eiffel tower is about a block away! a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great staff and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: erik822
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location Super easy subway access Clean room Wonderful shower Helpful staff Comfortable bed Cons: Tiny rooms (Common for Paris hotels) Mediocre, expensive breakfast We loved this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The rooms were tiny (all Paris hotel rooms are tiny), so don't go expecting a big room. In fact, don't think you'll be able to spread your suitcase out all, because you can't. The restaurants, cafes and bars in the immediate vicinity weren't much to brag about, but 3 or 4 blocks down the Bd De Grenelle the food was quite good - and less expensive. The bed was comfortable, there's a safe in the room, the closet is decent and the shower couldn't have been any better. The rooms that look out on the main street have a view of subway station, but with the windows closed, you honestly can't hear it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching now - this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire30something
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip after reading the reviews and was more than delighted. I took my mum to Paris for 3 nights (27 - 30 July), we stayed in a superior room (room no 307); the room, hotel, service, cleanliness was fantastic. I do not have one single criticism. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wendyDevon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eiffle Seine Hotel in July for 2 nights with a group of friends. The hotel rooms are very compact and bijou but the location is brilliant. I would certainly recommend the hotel, its very clean and most of the staff very friendly. The hotel is right opposite the metro station and the eiffle tower is a 5 minute walk away, so is the river so you can catch the boat and see all the other sites Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: santosbrazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, the rooms and the decoration are very good too. The staff is friendly and receptive. My wife and I had a wonderful time durind our staying. I hope to be back in Paris soon and of course at the same hotel. Thanks a lot ! Rodney and Silvia Matos - Brazil !!

Reviews.Title: “A great launching pad to discover Paris”
Reviews.Author: gwoper
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and easy access to the RER. Unbelievably close to the Eiffel tower. Clean rooms with plenty of amenities. Restaurants around the hotel were disappointing (We found better service, food, and atmosphere elsewhere) Neighborhood was safe but not as lively as other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrmNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, with an affordable rate. Right next to Eiffel Tower and right across the street from the Metro. Couldn't ask for anything better. Asked for early check-in............got it. Asked for late checkout............got it. The only thing negative was the unusually high rate for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nicole_s09
Reviews.Content: perfect location-literally 3 min walk from the eiffel tower.few nice restaurants nearby.have a crepe from the stand on the corner-wow!not an awful lot to do on this side of the bridge bar the eiffel tower but if u want to stay near the eiffel tower its perfect.rooms are tiny!!i booked a superior & it was still tiny so just beware of that.lift is also really small.room for 2 people-thats it!but the reception staff were nice & the rooms were clean enough.i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sallymita
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Eiffel Seine and it was a good choice. I recommend it as it is located right in front of the Eiffel Tower. Just perfect for a sightseeing. Good quality price. i booked through http://www.prestigia.com and get a 20% off. Will definitly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ICYicy
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 7-nights, really enjoy it. The staff there speaks decent English (except one guy on night shift) and all are very helpful. The room size is fine as of Euro standard. The washroom is in good size and clean. We've a room facing inside, so can't hear any Metro noise, very quiet. They have in-room wi-fi or you can use their labtop at the bar. There're many cafes around and a supermaket with 3 min walk. Metro and RER are just across the street, 15 mins walk to Eiffel which is great as we can walk back on July 14 after the firework (take > 30 mins that day though coz it's packed). One odd this is they request all guests to leave the room key with them while away for security reason (???). The lift is really small, can only fit one person plus 2 luggages, but we're only at 1st floor so walk every time except check in and out. Overall it's a great hotel, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: DevonGreggles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days 11th - 14th July for our wedding anniversary. It was booked as a package deal through Eurostar. We decided on this hotel after reading lots of reports on TA and when we arrived we were not disappointed. The staff were excellent and spoke very good English (good job really, as my French is poor). The room was clean, bright and very quiet, even tho our room looked out onto the metro. We decided not to have the hotels breakfast as it costs 14euros, but we did manage to find a very good supermarket down the road and plenty of bars etc to get cheaper breakfast. It was ideally located being about 5 mins walk away from the Eiffel Tower, River Seine. We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient! Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ford720
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located. 1 min to subway station. 8 mins walk to Eiffel Tower. Easy access to food: restaurants. Staff are warm and friendly. Nice and modern decoration. Room is clean! However our room size is very small. Comes with free wireless internet. Will recommend to friends. Yes, we will come back to this hotel if we are coming back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: rellegood
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris June 14 - 17, 2009. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating. They made us feel very welcome. The continental breakfast was very good. Nice selection. The location was fantastic. The hotel is about 50 feet from a metro station and a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are a little smaller than I'm accustom to in the U.S., but were very nice. I have already given contact information to several friends that are planning to visit Paris soon. I absolutely loved Paris and plan to return in a few years. When I do I will stay at the Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cdm23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with 3 teenage children and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. We were so grateful to them for their sight seeing tips and guidance with directions. The rooms were quite small compared to American standards, but were very clean and comfortable. The elevator was tiny, so it took several trips to bring all our luggage up to the rooms, but that was part of the charm of this small hotel. The only thing that took some getting used to were the tubs with very high sides and half glass shower enclosure. The hotel location was great - near the Metro/RER and within a comfortable walk to numerous places of interest. There was a grocery store nearby, and several restaurants on both sides if you wanted a quick bite. The prices were quite expensive and with the exception of a couple of waitresses, the staff were not very welcoming at any of these touristy cafes. However, if you went out the hotel, turned left and walked several blocks you would discover wonderful markets and small neighborhood cafes where the staff were extremely friendly. The most amazing meal we had during our entire European trip was at a tiny restaurant called Le Decaze. Nearby is a bakery called Poilane which had some of the best pastries we found in all of Paris. So it is definitely worth your while to take some time, get away from the touristy areas and explore the charming neighborhoods, enjoy the local cuisine and meet real Parisians.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff at prime location.”
Reviews.Author: wolk47
Reviews.Content: A well appointed, clean boutique hotel. Easy access to Metro and other Paris transportation. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We would definitely return to this lovely hotel. Thank you for such a pleasant visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location next to Eiffel Tower, fab deco and stadd”
Reviews.Author: ellis1407
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful stay here. Everything you need to see is right here. Staff were friendly, helpful and the deco was lovely. Would definately come back here and plan to next spring with our two children

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room!”
Reviews.Author: rach0152
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect - right next to the Metro and a wonderful stroll to the Eiffel Tower and River Seine. The staff were very helpful and pleasant! The bed was a little uncomfortable, but other than that we were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sasdax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June and were very happy. Having travelled to Paris on numerous occasions we are aware that the rooms are on the small size so were happy with the size of the Superior room that we booked but a little disappointed that there was no view. As it turned out the weather was very hot and as the room overlooked a central courtyard , the room remained reasonably cool. The lift was small but although we were on the 6th floor it was adequate for the 2 of us and a couple of times we were joined by a fellow resident so OK. After all you don't stay in the lift! Staff are friendly and speak perfect English and not off hand if you don't attempt to speak French, although I made the mistake of booking in, in French and the receptionist continued to speak in French, thankfully I knew enough to understand. Some people seem to have a problem handing in the key, for us, just a another item not to lose so no problem. Hotel is well decorated and very clean, bathroom adequate size with plenty of towels and toiletries. We did not take breakfast in the Hotel as there are plenty of eating places just outside, (although the waiter in the 1st out the hotel door on your right has an attitude problem). There is a perfectly good supermarket down on the left and a little further on a wonderful baker, that sells beautiful croissants. The Hotel is around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and a short walk to the Seine and the start of the Batobus and of course there is a Metro right across the road and the RER line around towards the Eiffel Tower. What we stay again, yes if we needed to be in the area

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: sissy2007l
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is great.They all speak english are very helpful.The hotel is great.I had a room on the 5th floor and it overlooked the metro.Metro is across the street and 1 down the street. A nice little store down the sidewalk to get some drinks or whatever,my room had a little refrig.so you could buy things at the supermarket.all in all would stay here again.very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Very So-so”
Reviews.Author: Dixietrout
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked a double room many months in advance directly with the hotel and I called the week before we left to confirm. When we checked in we were given a room on the 6th floor (no view) and told to turn in our key to the hotel clerk for security reasons whenever we left the room. The elevator was about 3 feet square so it took 2 trips to get up there. The room was unbelievably small. Since we were traveling for almost 4 weeks we had 3 suitcases (2medium and 1 carry-on size) and nowhere to put them. I also felt like I was staying in a firetrap being that high up. We immediately asked for another room. We were told there wouldn't be one available until the next day and it was a "Superior Room" which would cost 40 Euros a night more. We agreed, so the next morning we hauled our suitcases back down and they stored them until we returned late the next night. The new "superior" room was adequate in size (altho the bathroom was very small) and clean. Again, no view, altho a "Superior" room. The TV didn't work. The clerk from the lobby couldn't make it work either and promised to send someone the next day. It didn't work the next night either. It wasn't that important to us since we were hardly in the room but when you are paying for something you should be able to use it. There was adequate hot water with decent water pressure. No mini-fridge or coffee maker. The room was quiet, bed comfortable enough, and we slept well. Since the room was on the 3rd floor we were able to avoid using the elevator, which made me feel safer. The staff spoke very good English and they were polite. There are several restaurants and a convenience store near the hotel where the food was reasonably priced for Paris. Coffee though, is extremely expensive! We shared one cup in the morning since it was over 4 Euros with no refills! There were 2 metro stations across from the hotel, which was very convenient, but the Eiffel Tower location isn't the best. There are dozens and dozens of men who are constantly in your face trying to sell junk trinkets all around the Eiffel Tower area. (These men are also at Sacre Coeur and one even grabbed my husband by the hand!) The French police make a big show by blowing whistles and riding their bikes after them about once an hour. The men all scatter, then 60 seconds later, they all come back laughing. The Paris Police are useless. I hadn't been to Paris in many years and I was disappointed in all the graffiti and hucksters everywhere. All said, this hotel and its location were just OK and if we return to Paris I would try to find another hotel in a different area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with metro on other side of road”
Reviews.Author: AyrshireJenice
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, the staff were helpful, rooms quite small but clean and has a lovely outside area for having a drink. There's several bars and restaurants just doors away and the metro is on the other side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit just as good”
Reviews.Author: Savannah08
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay in this hotel having previously stayed here in 2007. The location of the hotel is great five minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower with the Metro across the road and the RER just around the corner. We decided to stay in a superior room this time which was more spacious however facing the front so a bit noisy but it was fine. The breakfast was included in the price and it was very nice. The hotel itself is clean, modern and very comfortable. I would have no hesitation in staying here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for Valentine's Day Feb 2008, The hotel is in a great location just 5 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower, there are 2 trains stations accross the road from the hotel one is RER A Champ De Mar and the second is Bir Hakem, If you are flying into CDG you can catch the train, to the hotel, you have to change trains just once journey cost's approx 12 euro each oneway. The hotel is Art Deco Boutique Style in a trendy area, with lots of cafe's nearby. The rooms as mentioned before are small but clean and the bathroom has a frosted glass door, which is see thru, didnt cause us any problems for us as we are a couple but may cause problems for some. The elevator is tiny, smaller than a bathroom cubicle and fits approx 2 slim people with small hand luggage, also the corridors to the room have auto lighting which only switch on when you exit the elevator, corridors are very slender had to walk one behind the other and have a bit of a brothel feel and the walls are black, Didnt bother us too much but it was something we didnt like. If you plan to visit the Eiffel tower, please go as early as possible in the morning, we went at 9am and waited approx 15 mins and took the stairs as the elevator was out of service. Over all a lovely weekend and based on the location and cleanliness we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: kirwin12
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris last week and stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine. Though not the Ritz, this place was wonderful. The staff was superb and helped with my extremely limited French. I was sick the first day and they were very supportive. The rooms, although small by American standards were clean, up to date. I love the fact that they are "going green" with their lighting and love the art noveau decor - very parisian. The location is perfect - across from the train, around the corner from the Eiffel Tower, near several cafes and down the street from the world famous Polaine bakery. They serve breakfast in a downstair area or room service at extra cost. We were too busy to eat! Couldn't ask for more!!!

Reviews.Title: “It Was Perfect, Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Retirement42
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Paris and our stay at the Hotel Eiffel Seine. The hotel was absolutely perfect and beautiful by any standard. The art deco is dÃ©cor is tastefully done and the appointments are wonderful and modern. We chose the hotel based upon these reviews and found it to be exactly as advertised and so much more. The neighborhood of the 15th arrondissement also offered us an opportunity to see real Parisian life as we walked the streets, ate at the bistros, shopped in the stores and enjoyed the people of Paris. If you want a chain hotel and are satisfied to see the tourist attractions but not really see Paris, this is not the hotel for you. But if you want to experience Paris, ride the metro each day and live within a community with the citizens of this beautiful city, you will be more than satisfied. The staff is goes out of their way to be courteous and helpful. The service is excellent, and the price compares competitively with other hotels in the area. Walk to the Eiffel Tower each night, use the metro across the street, ride the RER at Champ du Mars and stay at this hotel. We certainly will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrip2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd leg of our European adventure and were pleasantly surprised. We were there for 4 nights and were given a lovely courtyard room on the main floor...it was convenient and different. The room was definitely small, but as everyone says, you are really only there to sleep. It was clean and nicely decorated in a very modern and artsy style. In retrospect, I determined that the beds here were one of the best on our 1 month trip. We didn't mind the metro ride to the attractions across the river and appreciated the proximity to the Eiffel Tower. It was nice to go there at night with less people around and just sit at the park beside it. The only negative about the place was the noise in the mornings. We think it was the cleaners in their storage room, or perhaps the sounds of the restaurant next door...it meant for very early mornings!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ichannelview
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five nights at this hotel and I must say that the staff were very accommodating to us. The rooms were neat and cozy and the hotel is conveniently located in the midst of shops, eateries and the subway. I was disappointed that our room did not have a view of the river or the Eiffel Towel, but overall it was fine. Not made for the handicapped or anyone with physical limitations. The room is also not equipped with individual heat settings so some nights we were quite cold. No frills strickly just a place to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: firishnd
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine Hotel is a fantastic hotel with a fabulous location. From the first moment we walked in when the front desk staff switched between french, english and spanish with ease, the experience just got better and better. if you are looking for American sized rooms then this hotel is not for you, but if you want a great location and a nice, clean place to lay your head then this hotel cannot be beaten. The bar downstairs gives half bottles of wine for around 8.50 EUR which is a steal and indicative of the well-priced hotel on the whole. Within 50 metres of both the RER (Tour Eiffel) and the metro (Bir Hakeim) this hotel is within a 15 minute ride of Champs D'Elysses, Notre Dame and within 20 min of Versailles. My wife and I had a great weekend which was topped off by this amazing hotel! Thank you to you and your staff

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, friendly, art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harv52
Reviews.Content: Visted for my wifes 40th birthday after reading the reviews. Was not disappointed. Location is fine within 5min walking distance of the Eiffel tower althougth to see the other sites you have to travel a bit (notre dame 10mins by metro) which was not a problem as there is a metro station directly outside the hotel. River seine is across the road with the Batobus stop(river taxi) also 5min walk away. Rooms are small but what more do you need? Very clean everywhere with some nice attention to detail. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels that we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: lyjymo
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine is in a great location, close proximity to the Eiffel Tower, across the street from a Metro Station and around the block from the Seine River. Our room was well appointed and kept very clean. The Staff were welcoming, warm and always ready to assist us. Breakfast was lovely and satisfying. We loved the location and the staff. We enjoyed being so close to the Eiffel Tower and the staff made us feel completely at home.

Reviews.Title: “I would happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KarenDelaware
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Some people may complain that the room is too small, but you only sleep there. The room was very clean and well appointed. The hotel also was concerned about energy conservation with 'motion' detection lights. It was conveniently located to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro and a walkway for leisurely strolls along the Seine. If I ever have the op[portunity to return to Paris, the Hotel Seine will be my choice of hotel. Karen

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3-night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark_and_Lizzie
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Eiffel Seine under a Eurostar Package from London Paris. The location is great fro central paris connections, 5min walk to Eiffel Tower. We chose this hotel given its good rating, reasonable rate and near to Metro for Versailles. When we arrived the desk spoke good english, but was happy to converse in pigeon-french so we could practice ours. He gave us some good recommendations for places to see, eat and visit. Including directions to a supermarket to buy water, etc. Our room was on the 1st floor and overlooked a busy road and Metro station. The sound proofing was excellent and we had 3 good restful nights sleep with very little disturbace from outside noise, except for drunken revellers on Sunday morning. The hotel accomodation was good quality, clean and in good working order. The decor is in the style of Art Deco with some nice touches in your room and circulation spaces (starlights in stairwells, etc). Although basic, no Satellite or entertainment system, the TV did show some english speaking channels so we could catch up with the news of the day and there was free wireless internet access. Useful for us to upload our pictures of the day to facebook! Overall the Eiffel Seine is a gem and definitely a recommendation to friends and future stays ... if you can get a good rate through an online system. The 180Euro standard rate would be a little steep if going directly ... but shop around and you can get it for much less (we wer less than 100Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lcas
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in Paris with my mom at the Hotel Eiffel Seine and it was wonderful. It is right across from the Metro and the Seine, and a short walk to the Eiffel tower. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, and the staff were awesome - very friendly and helpful. Loved it all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smurfee4
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, staff were extremely friendly and had great english,i would definitley recommend any one to stay here a great boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: toxickim04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Paris, and I am so glad he found this hotel! It was right across the street from the train, and the Eiffel Tower was about a 6 minute walk. It drives me crazy when people complain about the room size, it's in the middle of Paris and you are just sleeping there and washing up, why do you need a huge room?? Maybe since I've been living in Europe I'm more used to it. The mattresses are separated because they can't fit a huge mattress through their stairs and elevators, give them a break! The staff was so helpful, and they are there all day and night so it doesn't matter what time you come in at night they are there to help you. It is right by a ton of little food shops and stores, I would HIGHLY recommend going to the crepe stand on the closest corner to the hotel. It was cheap and great! The inside restaurant was really good too. All in all I would really recommend this hotel. My husband and I were really pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: mrpiii
Reviews.Content: I took my girl friend for her first trip to Paris. The Eiffel Seine proved to be an excellent choice. A Metro stop was immediately across the street and within a half mile there were an excellent assortment of restaurants and cafes (I like to walk in the morning and visit a cafe for breakfast rather than eating in the hotel). The rooms are small; but very clean. The size was a shock to my very American girl friend -- but certainly standard to slightly larger than usual for European hotels. The chief attraction is the quality of the staff who were without exception helpful in assisting in finding sights and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “adorable hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: darnielle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine and loved this hotel. It is right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. There were great souvenir shops close by, a few cafes (one right next door was the best) and a grocery store just down the street. The Metro is steps away, a bank, a bank card machine, and mulitiple other businesses. The staff all spoke English beautifully, and were always ready to give directions or advice on anything you will need to know. We felt very comfortable and safe being two women alone. The only bad thing was the elevator! It seemed a little primitive! My daughter took the stairs because it was very small and had no escape hatch!! We got more exercise going up and down the stairs. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated and ver French! We are planning to return to Paris in a few years, and would stay there again in a heartbeat. I hope this review is helpful! Au Revior!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: spiritoleo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Eiffel Seine. The best thing about the Eiffel Seine is its people. Each and every person with whom we dealt was unfailingly helpful and pleasant. The breakfast is excellent, and the breakfast room very charming. Our room was small by American hotel standards, but that was to be expected. Terrific location, convenient to the Metro, the river taxi, and the Eiffel Tower, but far enough from the Eiffel Tower so that the streets in the immediate vicinity were not crowded with tourists. I wholeheartedly recommend the Eiffel Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: E_of_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We spent a most plesant week staying in this cosy hotel around the corner from the Eiffel Seine. The room was very clean and comfortable. We were on the third floor with a view of the river. Even though the Metro train was above ground across the narrow street there were no noises the disturbed us in the room. The staff of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We speak very little Frence, but this was not a problem as the staff all spoke English. Just across the street is a staion for the Metro and the RER. Buy a Carnet of tickets. Skip the breakfast and check out some of the local cafes for a better price. Be aware you are in Paris not Las Vegas so the rooms are rather small, but you do not travel to Paris to stay in your room. The bed was very comfortable, There is a closet. You can turn around in the bath. All of these things were not the case in other hotels we have stayed in in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Clean and kind.”
Reviews.Author: rideskis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to the metro, RER and taxi stand. Rooms and bath are good sized, recently updated, and very clean. We stayed in a Club room on the 6th floor, view of the river and away from potential metro noise. The front desk and cleaning staff are extremely kind and ready to help with any need (they speak English too). Plenty of options close by for good eats. A well stocked grocery is one block away. Definitely recommend the Eiffel Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean. Definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: RadioRoom
Reviews.Content: Room on 4th floor overlooked Metro station with views of river. No noise from Metro, good double glazing. Air conditioning available in summer. Very well docorated, excellent reception staff spoke English. Continental breakfast at â‚¬16 is far too expensive so did not use hotel. However plenty of restaurants serving breakfast locally at â‚¬8 upwards. We found a great bakery about 5 minutes away. Get away from main drag and immediate local bars/restaurants and walk away from the river and there are some lovely restaurants about - keep away from the tourists in the Eiffel area and eat with the locals. Location great for walks along the Seineand with the metro makes this hotel so easy to get anywhere in Paris and it is right in a residential part which means you are not part of a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: TheRock70
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in March at the Eiffel Seine Hotel. We were in a standard room on the second floor, facing the street. The room was small, but manageable. The bed was one of those conforming mattress type beds that did a number on the back. The bathroom was of good size and the maid kept the room clean. The television had 2 english channels, but froze up whenever we were watching BBC. You would have to unplug the tv so it could "recharge" and the channels could be changed normally again. The staff at the front desk were outstanding and helped us get around town The biggest issue we had was the noise that significantly affected our sleep, coming from multiple sources. The hotel is right next to a train station, so you could hear the groups of people screaming outside the window. Suprisingly, the trains are very quiet, but the constant car horns were a problem. Finally, the walls are very thin, so we had the privy of listening to arguments, televisions and door slams from the other rooms. The location is fantastic. The Eiffel and Napoleon's tomb are a 5 minute walk down the street and the Arc is a 10 minute trainride. The trains are next to the hotel and it is very easy to get around. There are several restaurants in the local area and it is safe at night. Overall, the sleep deprivation left a bad taste in our mouths with this hotel. If you are willing to overlook this shortcoming, I would highly recommend reserving a room on the back side of the hotel away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ia2k
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The metro is easily accessible, lots of people in the area (feels safe). Literally, a five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Check-in was quick and easy; check-out was even easier. The room was clean and comfortable. I had a room that faced the street, which has a nice view of the people walking in the street, the metro running, and buildings on the other side of the Seine. The staircases to the rooms were amusing. Several eateries available right next to the hotel; I really loved Pizza Florentia next door. This boutique style hotel is definitely on the top of my list for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madidi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel boutique. Rooms size is ok for Paris and the bathroom was big enough. Very calm. There are goods choices for meals around and the location is excellent. Just in fornt of a metro stop and one minute walking of the Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Dr0119
Reviews.Content: As expected, the rooms are typically small, but nicely decorated and VERY clean. The front desk staff are very helpful and don't look down on you because you don't speak English. IOW... NO French attitude! The location is almost perfect... good local restaurants... 2 block walk to the Eiffel, canal boats, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MYCH901
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel in a Fab Location. Very close to the station although we managed to walk everywhere which was nice. Eiffel tower about 2 mins away and Le Louvre was walkable but much quicker on the metro. Lots of very good restaurants in the vicinity. We ventured about 15mins walk away to the rue de dominique where there were some very good restaurants. Our room was a little on the small side, although very clean and comfortable, it got very hot at night and we could not really open the window as we were directly facing the station platform. Would recommend the stay as it was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: cadunne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. yes the rooms are small but that is what you expect in Paris. The whole feeling in the hotel is warm and friendly. It was spotless and had everything we required. I've already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atlantatravelers2
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Good location - close proximity to Eiffel tower (within 1/2 mi) and METRO station (with a hundred yards). 2. Very clean rooms and bathrooms 3. Fairly comfortable beds 4. Good housekeeping services 5. Helpful multilingual staff (though the heavyset gentleman who worked the desk periodically was a bit snotty). 6. The rooms are small but on par considering the price and city. Cons: 1. Our room faced the street and the traffic noise outside was quite loud in the mornings. If you're a deep sleeper this would probbaly not be an iddue though. 2. We had the mid-grade room and it did not come with an iron or ironing board. 3. WATCH YOUR STEP - to save electricity, the stairway lights only come on when triggered by motion detectors. They tend to come on at the very last minute, and my girlfriend took a spill down the stairs trying to navigate them in total darkness... its not a huge deal, but be careful on the stairs at night. Overall - this is a good little boutique hotel for the price. If you want to be close to te Eiffel Tower, its location and price probably can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tjeep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little jewel box located in the heart of Paris. My room had been so recently renovated that the smell of paint was still in the air, and everything seemed fresh and new. As others have mentioned, the decor is art deco, as inspired by Gustav Klimmt. Loved the white and sparkling clean bathroom, with large shower space. There are wireless connections available for laptops, and an in-room safe and minibar. There aren't any coffee machines, irons, or other amenities available at some larger hotels. What the hotel lacks in amenities it makes up in charm. The staff was friendly and helpful. The 45 rooms are located in a very up and down fashion. As others have mentioned, the elevator is limited to 3 people and is tiny. The stairs are somewhat steep and dark, as automatic lights come on when triggered by motion detectors on the upper landings. The location is superb, within minutes walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, and immediately next to both the Bir-Hakeim metrol line 6 and Champ de Mars/Eiffel Tower RER C stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,friendly staff and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jakeylad
Reviews.Content: Nice warm and friendly hotel in a great location, we had a club room that was adequate and very clean, a 3 star hotel with 5 star prices like the rest of Paris. The breakfast was 16euros but there was plenty of places locally to have a breakfast.The staff were extremely friendly and couldn't heap us enough. The costs were the only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SlimNevaShady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine on a 'romantic weekend' in January. This place is fantastic!!! It's well-located within a stone's throw of the Eiffel Tower and about 10 seconds walk to the Bir-Hakeim station (which takes you directly to the Champs Elysee among other places). It's also just across the road from the Champ de Mars station (which has better links across Paris). It's also on the riverfront and there are a couple of guided boat tours available just across the road (for 7 Euro per adult which is great- this was probably the best touristy thing we did on the weekend). The hotel itself is beautifully decorated (Art Deco style with lots of influences from Gustav Klimt). Apart from the 3-person lift and slightly narrow hallways and stair case I thought the size of the place was perfect. The room was really nice and comfortable and above all CLEAN! with a HUGE bigger than double bed. There's a flat screen TV (French channels only) and the bathroom is lovely and well-designed. The shower for example was HUGE. The weather was awful (windy, cold, rainy) so we actually spent quite a bit of time (especially in the mornings) at the hotel and it was comfortable. A great base to explore Paris from but equally a nice place to chill out and enjoy yourself. The staff were friendly and very helpful (not to mention tri-lingual!). Only downside is that breakfast (available as a buffet in the dining room downstairs or in your room) is 16 Euro. And with the pound being so poor right now it just wasn't economical for us (although you'll be hard pressed to find it much cheaper anywhere else). Other benefits: free wireless access (you have to get the code from reception) and use of the laptop at the bar. There's also a safety deposit box in the room. NB: Although the train was right outside the window (as you'll see from the pictures) we didn't hear it at all! We absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Excellent, Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_CE_Copley
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I did a midweek break from the UK. The Hotel is central .. right across the road from the Metro, Seriously no noise, Perfect. Location is fantastic near the Eiffel Tower with easy access to all the major Scenic Locations. The Hotal was clean and food Excellent. Highly recommended. Looking to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybean47
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were planning a short trip to Paris and we wanted a hotel which was centrally located, clean, comfortable and good value for money. After checking deals on Expedia I chose the Eiffel Seine Hotel because it had good reviews and seemed to fit the bill perfectly. The Hotel is situated in a side street just across from the river Seine, and although it doesn't look much from the outside, it is deceptively chic and modern on the inside. The man on reception was very efficient and polite, gave us all the information we required about our stay in perfect English. Oh, and the hotel is across the road from the Bir Hakim metro station so it is perfectly placed for exploring Paris. The Eiffel Tower is 5 minutes walk away. The lift was a little snug, could be a problem for people with a lot of luggage or mobility issues ie. a wheelchair or mobility aid. The hotel was tastefully decorated and clean. Our room was small but was perfectly acceptable for our needs. The beds were comfortable and bathroom well equipped and clean. The room looked out onto an inner courtyard and so was very peaceful, we were not aware of any noise during our stay. We could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower from the window which was a bonus especially when it was illuminted each night. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris. I am visiting Paris alone in May and was hoping to book into the Eiffel Seine again but unfortunately it was a little expensive for my pocket this time around, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: canuckinch
Reviews.Content: I post this review simply to confirm the positive feedback that already exists on this form. I hadn't been to Paris before and so spent several hours trawling websites etc. trying to choose a place to stay. My wife and I were well pleased and would return in an instant if given the chance. Breakfast was brilliant, staff helpful and rooms appointed well and very clean. It all helped to make our getaway weekend unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & a very artistic enviroment!!”
Reviews.Author: FinancePhD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Eiffel Seine hotel for two days and we were really happy with our choice!! The location is perfect for sightseeing, just paces from the metro and RER and next to the Eiffel Tower!! The staff was really friendly and professional, while the hotel is really special due to the decoration and the stylistic details that are apparent almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base to explore the city!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirstylou1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TA we booked two nights stay at Hotel Eiffel Seine from 15th to 17th Jan 2009. The hotel is superb if you're looking for a small, clean, well located base from which to explore Paris. There are several metro stops close by, one situated just across the street and obviously the Eiffel Tower is a two minute walk around the corner. The rooms are well equipped with good bathrooms (good shower/lots of hot water) a tv and air con, although we couldn't reduce the temperature because it was set for winter and our rooms were a little stuffy at night. This wasn't a huge issue though and rather that than being freezing! We booked a Club room and it was an ok size, I couldn't have coped with anything smaller to be honest. The bed was huge though which was great and unlike other reviews I found the bed really comfortable. We booked on a room only basis because the breakfast was 16 euro per person which I find fairly staggering, especially when there is an abundance of fantastic patisseries on the walk down bvd. de grenelle towards the metro. We crammed a lot into our two/three days so we found it better to eat and walk at the same time and spend the money saved on breakfast on some well earned afternoon beers! Overall I thought the hotel was lovely, and the staff were very helpful during the booking process.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: JanineManchester
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this hotel to others. The hotel was in an ideal location, just a minutes walk to the nearest metro station and 5 minutes walk to the eiffel tower. The hotel staff are all really friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean but are quite small, however the location and the price of the hotel more than makes up for this. The only qualm I did have with the hotel was that the rooms were far to hot at night, however considering it was minus 10 outside others may have appreciated this. I would not hesistate to rate our overall experience as excellent and would advise anyone who is after a clean, comfortable hotel, in the heart of Paris and at a reasonable price to give the Eiffel Seine a go

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: GlennkFlorida
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from our first trip to France. We stayed 5 nights in Nantes for a tournament then 2 nights in Paris to sight see. It was very comforting to see the hotel right across the street as soon as we got off the Metro. The lady at the front desk was very helpfull and spoke perfect english! The room was small as expected but was clean and well decorated. I booked the room for 150 U.S. a night and it had free wireless internet! The location was perfect. Five minute walk to the tower so we allways had a land mark if we got lost. Paris was amazing! Definately not disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: elca67
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was my fiance's 40th birthday and he is a keen photographer. I knew he wanted to photograph the Eiffel Tower and the hotel was in close proximity. In fact only 5 minutes walk away. We stepped off the Metro and the hotel is right opposite, which makes it an excellent location to get to most of Paris's other attractions. On reception the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the mini bar was good with just a few nibbles and drinks, but with room to keep your own snacks. You could see the River Seine from our window. On the metro is it is cheaper to buy a carnet of tickets (10). In fact in 2 days we saw the Eiffel Tower, Arc De Triomph, Place Du Concorde, The Louvre and Les Invalides. The Eiffel Tower looks fab at night. On the hour every hour for about 5 minutes it sparkles. the best view was from the Champ De Mars park behind it or from the Trocadero on the other side. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Christmas break”
Reviews.Author: Mackenzie10
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel for a lovely Christmas break. The hotel staff were so welcoming and were always available to answer our questions (which we asked nearly every day of our stay!) It was made even more personal by the fact thay they said hello to us and asked how we were, referring to our names (a little touch, but put a smile on our face). The location of the hotel is convenient (right next to a convenient metro station and within 5mins walk of the Eiffle Tower). The decor throughout the hotel is appealing, modern and clean and the beds provide a good nights sleep. The air con didn't seem to work properly thou (this may have been with it being winter and us not fully understanding the machine), often it released hot air during the night meaning it got a little hot. Overall, i would definately recommend this hotel especially if you are looking for a relaxing, parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OmarAlexander
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Amazing location with lots of restaurants and shops around. Market, bank and pharmacy are just a block away and a metro station right in front. Minutes away from all major Paris attractions via bus or subway. Eiffel Tower is just around the corner. The hotel is cute and very comfy. Very clean. What makes this hotel fantastic (other than location) is the staff. I had the pleasure of meeting two of the front desk members, Jean-Francois and Frederique. They are the nicest people you are ever going to meet. They speak great English, Spanish and many other languages and they will help you with anything and everything. They booked our tours, gave us directions, recommended restaurants, made reservations and they even helped me with buying some cold medicine for my wife. I cannot say enough of how helpful they were. A true pleasure. We booked the rooms with the breakfast included and it was great. Lots of fresh breads, sweet breads, cheeses, hams, salami, fruits, coffee, lots of teas, orange juice and grapefruit juice. They had hard-boiled eggs as well as sausages. The breakfast room is very nice with great linen, china and silverware. If you are staying for a few days, I would recommend getting the breakfast. It's a great way to start the day. Having some fresh coffee, great bread, reading the newspaper and planning your day. The rooms are small as expected but quite comfy. Bed was good, room was always clean and restocked after we came back. Free wifi is great if you have your laptop! Helps you keep in touch plus getting info to plan your days. Overall, great hotel. Cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great”
Reviews.Author: badnil
Reviews.Content: My daughter had stayed at this lovely hotel a couple of years ago at the recommendation of a travel agent in Iowa who had stayed there. As such, when we were booking our stay in Paris, I told the travel agent that the Hotel Eiffel Seine would be where we wanted to stay. I stayed there with my daughter, her friend and my mom and our stay was wonderful. The staff was professional, considerate & knowledgeable. Location is perfect for getting around Paris. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dun8
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and helpful staff. Rooms on the small size but they were extremely clean. Staff were helpful. Metro (Train station) 15 seconds from hotel and rooms were quiet. Eiffel tower minutes away. Also, very safe and several restaurants in the area for breakfast and lunch. Around Euro60 for taxi from CDG Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Greg09
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my (now) fiance's Christmas present. I have to say I was not disappointed. The hotel is a little on the expensive side however as some people will know staying in Paris is about location and believe me this Hotel has it! Not only is it by the main metro line it is also VERY central to most of the good attractions Paris has to offer eg the Louvre, Tour Eiffel and Notre Dame. Most of the attractions being only 10-15 mins by Metro. The rooms are modern and clean, the staff are very helpful and above all welcoming. The area is quiet and we did not experience any trouble in this area at all, and felt safe at all times. It can get a little busy on the side walks as it is on the main line for the Eiffel Tower, however it is HIGHLY recommended that you leave EARLY for the Eiffel Tower as it can be VERY busy and the queues are very very long, luckily because this hotel is only 5 mins from the Tower you will not have to leave the hotel too early to get there. We are already planning our next trip back and would quite happily stay in the Seine Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff, Stiff Beds”
Reviews.Author: shnugen7
Reviews.Content: a) Location: The location is amazing. It is right next to the Bir-Hakiem Metro stop and literally a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. There is also a great crepe stand, a supermarket, and three good (and cheap) restaurants right next door. b) Staff: Very courteous and helpful. Knew a great deal about where to eat and visit in different locations in Paris, aside from the "Must sees". c) Rooms: Small, which is to be expected. Bathroom is good looking, but I'm confused as to why there was only half of a shower door. The worst part of the hotel, bar none, was the rock hard mattress on the beds. It caused my family and I a great deal of collective back pain. This hotel would be a 5-star review if it wasn't for these beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstraiger
Reviews.Content: I found the Eiffel Seine through this forum and booked it based on the reviews I read. What a great find! The location is perfect: an easy walk to many sights, a couple of blocks from the Eiffel Tower and across the street from the Metro. The staff could not have been friendlier and the room was decent-sized and always clean. The use of the lobby laptop and free wi-fi was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinksbumf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only (unfortunately) for my daughters 18th celebration. Lovely hotel, exactly as it looks on website. Very friendly staff who can't do enough to help, excellent location. Rooms clean if a little 'bijou', breakfast a bit qwerky for the young adults in party but then this is Paris! Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pilotboy1985
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here on Canadian Thanksgiving, right until October 17th. The hotel had a perfect location, within walking distance to the Tower. We walked there every afternoon, and every night. There is also a nice Italian Restaurant right outside the hotel, and next to that a nice place to get a good Crepe. The staff was very friendly and ever so helpful. We were treated like family, as appose to Hotel Guests! Room was small, but I didn't expect anything huge. The bathroom was nice, but what's with that half Glass door for using the shower with? Perhaps a French thing? who knows. I would seriously consider staying here again. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meganadpi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. It was very clean. Although the room we had was small compared to U.S. standards, it was probably big when compared to other European hotels. The staff was extremely friendly and the location is just two blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely recommend it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I am used to bigger hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Setting”
Reviews.Author: fpam
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and directly across the street from the Metro station (subway). Rooms are tiny but the staff are very friendly and helpful. The only issue was that the rooms were warm and leaving the window open was a little noisy. Did not eat there but they have a nice room set up for breakfast. Great little cafe and Italian restaurant just outside the hotel. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nickydee3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a really lovely 4 day break staying at the Eiffel Seine. What a wonderful little hotel. A fantastic location, across the road from the river seine (and a lovely dinner cruise!), and around the corner from the Eiffel Tower, so the name is very apt. Although there is no restaurant at the hotel (a buffet breakfast is offered at an extra charge), there is a restaurant next door open from 7am - 10pm, (their omelettes are fab and the staff were nice). The hotel reception upon arrival, and throughout were amazingly helpful, happy, friendly and couldnt do enough to make our stay more enjoyable. They even found out the weather reports on the computer to let us know the best day for the Eiffel. We didn't need any other forms of transport as the topless tour busses were leaving every 10mins from the eiffel (the red ones are Â£20 for a 2day pass), and they stop at all the major sights, so you just get off and on as you please, explore the area and go back to the bus stop again. Minimal transportation costs. The rooms are small, yes, but so are most of the hotel rooms in Paris. We had a MASSIVE shower, our room was also always spotlessly clean, and we had a lovely maid and the room was fine for a 4 day stay. We were sight seeing from 9am til 4pm, having a shower then off for an evening meal and coming back to sleep off a busy day. The only poor point i can even think of to say is that they only have CNN as an english channel, and all we had was Obama vs McCain! I would definately reccommend this hotel for your break to gay Pari.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: simonLethbridge
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location. Rooms are small but the location and friendly staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: frenchchats
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively and stayed at many hotels around the world. We found the Eiffel Seine had exceeded our expectations. Jean-Francois was phenominal. Great English. Spent over a half hour making reservations and recommendations for us for the 4 days we were there. Also very helpful was Fredrique. She spoke great English and helped make reservations as well as give directions. We have never received such support in a hotel before. Place was clean, modern and the room was adequate size for Paris. Large clean shower, great towels and a nice refrigerator to store cheese and lunch items, some drinks. Computer to stay in touch was free to use. English newspaper available every day during the week. Grocery store and bank within short walking distance. We felt very safe and secure. Across the street from the subway station is a huge plus. You can get anywhere in a short time for low cost. We will return to Paris again and will not hesitate to stay at the Eiffel Seine again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Hotel itself is average though”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location extremely close to the Eiffel Tower and next to the train station so you can get to all the main sight seeing attractions easily. The hotel itself though isnt the best the room we had was tiny it could only fit the bed, we couldnt fit our luggage anywhere we had to move the furniture around so we could open our suitcases and then had to step over our suitcases when we wanted to use the bathroom. Other than that the hotel was clean and offered free internet at the bar which was a big help. We were never in our room only to sleep so if your just looking for a bed to sleep this hotel is in a great location for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Re-sold our room 3 days before we arrived!!”
Reviews.Author: DanWarwick
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel in August this year, for a trip in October. When I booked the room I explained that this was a surprise for my husband and we would be arriving late and even with this information they re-sold my room 3 days before we arrived!! So when we arrived at midnight on our first night in Paris, we were told that we were being moved to another hotel down the road. To be honest the hotel that we were moved to was delightful, but it wasn't the hotel that I booked! I did a lot of research before booking this hotel, i wanted to be walking distance to the Tower and once we were moved to the new hotel, although it was only a couple of metro stops away, that isn't the point! I can say that when we were told that we were moving I was furious! We were even given the paper work which showed that they had re-sold our room to Mr Watts 3 days before our stay!! I can't say what I thought about this hotel as I didn't get the chance to stay there, I can however tell you that if you do get moved, or this review has changed your mind...take a look at the Hotel Ares as this was lovely..

Reviews.Title: “Saved 1 week of our trip to France”
Reviews.Author: aklipper
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, rooms all terrific. Walked to Eiffel Tower a couple of times a day. Staff spoke excellent English and could not do enough for us. After a week we moved to our second hotel in Paris.....unsafe area, very unattractive, and both outside entry and elevators required pin for use. Immediately called JF at the Eiffel Seine Hotel desk and though the hotel was full, he found a small room for one night. The rest of the week was spent in one of their nicest rooms. Great eating nearby with locals and neighborhood, not tourist prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MavandCharlie
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be above our expectations. The location is great with a metro stop just over the road and its a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. We stayed in a Club Double Room and found it to be a very good sized room for Paris. The hotel is quite modern and our room had all the amenities and was very clean. The staff on reception are excellent, they were very helpful, friendly and professional airport tranfers organised easily and dinner suggestions offered (which turned out to be great) - they were happy to help with anything. For a small hotel the bar and reception is open 24 hours which is excellent. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MrsC2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel at the end of August. It was easy to find and just over the road from the metro. It is just 5 mins walk from the Eiffell Tower. The room we stayed in was small as you would expect in this price range but was very clean, quiet and nicely decorated. Our tariff included breakfast and there was lots on offer including croissants, toast, cereal, fresh fruit as well as yoghurts and cheeses. if you take a room without breakfast there is a little cafe just up the road serving reasonably priced breakfasts. Staff at this hotel were very friendly and willing to help ion any way they could. All in all ,if you are looking for a reasonably priced place to lay your head during a city break to Paris then you could do much worse than staying here!

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: lorrainemch77
Reviews.Content: IWe stayed in the Eiffel Seine Hotel for 3 nights in August for our wedding anniversary and both myself and my husband were more than impressed. Lovely clean hotel. The staff were extremely approachable and friendly. We upgraded our room and were given a gorgeous suite on the first floor with a quiet area outside the room where we could sit in the fresh air and sip wine after a busy day touring Paris. The Eiffel tower is a stone throw away, And a lovely walk along the Seine from all other attractions. Restaurants outside hotel were nice but a tad expensive but isnâ€™t all of Paris the same?? All in all I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: topper44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Eiffel Seine and this was just the perfect hotel for us. My Mum and I usually travel to the USA, but decided this year on a change. Yes the rooms are small, especially as we have been spoiled with the size of hotel rooms in the USA. But, having spoken with others whilst in Paris this seems to be the norm, especially for European cities. Although small, the rooms have everything you need including extremely comfy beds, which were just what was needed after a long day sightseeing. The room and bathroom are very clean, facilities included fridge, safe and a hairdyer in the bathroom. No tea or coffee making facilities though, we like a nice wee cup of tea of a morning!! Breakfast was included in our room price and was good. It was light and got you started. Eating all the time in cafes is expensive, so we limited ourselves to once a day. There is a small supermarket just down the road from the hotel, we used this quite a lot. The staff were very nice, always pleasant and willing to help. The metro station, Bir Hakeim is right across the road and the metro is the best way to get around. The Eiffel Tower is literally round the corner and the Seine across the road. We tended to cross the road and walk by the Seine, as the guys selling the souvenirs really got on my nerves. On this note, just be aware of the scams that unfortunately seem to plague tourists, the guys with the string bracelets at the funicular at Sacre Coeur, the female beggars at the Eiffel Tower and the woman who I got, who pretended to pick up a gold ring, which she claimed to have just found and when she established it was not mine, she tried to sell it to me!! Unfortuately for her, she was not that good an actress and I'm a canny Scot. Paris is a wonderful city, with interesting places to visit and beautiful gardens to sit in. Mum loved the tower, I don't like heights, but went away and her trips on the Seine. I loved Notre Dame and the Lourve. We both loved the laid back atmosphere. Finally, we would not hesitate to recommend the Eiffel Seine to anyone thinking of visiting Paris, it has everything you would need to make make your stay a pleasant one. And it is was a nice feeling when other people on our shuttle bus to the airport commented that our hotel looked lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Place”
Reviews.Author: JonhSP
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel is not similar to the other rewiers. First of all it is not possible that this hotel is ranked as the 33rd best hotel in Paris. From the very first moment I arrived there I felt IÂ´ve maid a bad choice. The decoration is awful. The room is not so clean as should be. They do not replace the toileries. To finally make my mind that this hotel must be avoided was the fact that I found a mouse at the hotelÂ´s bar. Do I need to say anything more?

Reviews.Title: “The only thing special about the whole stay was our engagement”
Reviews.Author: DWMLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked a club room in this hotel for the night I proposed to my girlfriend, and emailed in advance saying that I was going to be proposing so could they please pull out the stops to make it a memorable stay. It all went 'ok', in the sense that the room itself was fine (and a great bathroom), but the guy on reception was pretty hopeless (at one point we had come back in and wanted our room key, but had to stand there for 2 minutes and cough loudly before he stopped dealing with the debate over payment that he was having with another guest for the 2 seconds it took to hand us our key). The main thing though is that whilst you can't expect a hotel necessarily to upgrade you or give you anything for free, I had thought that when I'd told them I would be proposing that night that they would at the very least have thought to put some flowers in the room, or a little bottle of champagne, or offered complimentary breakfast - something, anyway. The manager had bothered to reply to me before we arrived, promising they would make it a memorable stay for us, but in the event they did absolutely nothing. Had they taken the trouble to make our stay in the hotel special then we would presumably have chosen to go back there time after time to relive the excitement of our engagement - but next time we visit Paris I will be looking for more for my money than merely a 'nice' room and proximity to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: helenandandy
Reviews.Content: We have recently got back from staying @ the Eiffel Seine and loved the hotel. The location is outstanding (as I`m sure you have read on other reviews) and the train/metro links to the hotel are extremely easy and fairly quick. We bought a ticket that lasted us 5 days on arrival @ the airport station (90ish euros for 2 people) and this can be used anywhere within zones 1 - 5. Station line 22/24 and change @ Denfert Rocheau (or whatever it is) getting off @ Bir Hakeim. The hotel itself is lovely, and as titled above, delightful. From the mood lighting triggering as you walk to you room to the friendly staff everything is delightful, just don`t walk too fast through the corridors or the sensor doesn`t pick up the movement and you`re in darkness. The breakfast is lovely and just enough, nothing too heavy so you don`t set out for your day feeling weighed down. The room we had was nice and clean and despite people using the words small, cute etc it was certainly bigger than one we have stayed in in London!!! It is `small but perfectly formed (puke!!!) and is very comfortable to put your head down at the end of a very busy day (take VERY comfortable shoes!!!!!) As you have previously read the Eiffel Tower is more or less just round the corner and is a short walk away. The twinkling lights come on @ 10 and 11pm (don`t know about any other times) and last for 15 minutes. Don`t miss them, it is truly spectacular, go over the road away from it, it`s a better view. While on the touristy bit when visiting the Arc de Triumph take the metro line Bir Hakeim (the 1 opposite the hotel) and don`t get off till it terminates at Charles de Gaulle Etoile. We had to ask for this one as we couldn`t see it labelled on the map. Other than that everything is clearly labelled and just ask @ one of the info desks in the stations or @ the front desk in the hotel if you get stuck, we did all the time. You will certainly enjoy your stay at Eiffel Seine and have already recommended it to my sister.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helentasker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first wedding anniversary and it did not disappoint. We booked it through Hotel Direct and got a fantastic deal with breakfast included. This seems to be a point of contention with some other reviewers as the breakfast could be considered expensive at â‚¬16 per person. However, it is well worth it if you can find an inclusive deal. Our room was quite small, as to be expected from a Paris hotel, but it was perfectly formed with everything you need from a hotel room. The bed was comfortable and the linen clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. Above all, the location was perfect. Just round the corner from the Eiffel Tower, and right across the street from both the RER and the metro. I cannot recommend this hotel enough...BOOK IT!

Reviews.Title: “Free parking in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: welshbulldog
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel literally just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are small but they are clean. It is directly opposite the Metro so access to the rest of Paris is easy. We took our dog and she was made more than welcome!! Breakfast was good - a simple continental breakfast in a small clean dining room. The corridors in this hotel are mad - they are jet black and you do wonder what the hell your room is going to be like, but rest assured they are clean and bright. One of the best things about this hotel apart from its proximity to the Eiffel tower is that over the road next to the Seine is a totally free car park. We were a bit reluctant to leave our gleaming pride and joy there but after a few trips to check on it we realsied that it was perfectly safe.
