So we had three days free parking in Paris - unheard of!! I would definately go back to this hotel - its not the best I've ever been to but for the price it is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Among the Stars”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDreamers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip overall, and our decision to split our stay between two hotels, the other was Hotel Grand de Champaigne, was a wonderful decision as we traveled with our toddler daughter. We were able to visit the sites by foot in the area nearby. And, of course, we visited the Eiffel Tower each day and night to see the twinkiling lights. The staff was helpful and courteous, and the access to internet helped us a few times to keep us in touch with family back home. It was clean, comfortable and a place we would stay again. The restaurant we would recommend nearby was called Atome and served good food and portions for a reasonable rate. There is also a nice little grocery nearby for essentials that came in handy with our child. Great location and a great stay! I fell among the stars when we found this gem!

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: SmallWorld_GoSeeIt
Reviews.Content: I have to say those who gave good reviews were right on. This was a great little place. We went to Paris for part of our honeymoon and wanted to be near the Eiffel Tower. For what we were looking for, the hotel location was great with convenient access to restaurants, sight seeing, the metro, and of course the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were very small but very modern and very clean. The staff was excellent; friendly and very helpful. Back to location, being just a couple of blocks from the tower we could walk past it everyday, the wife really liked that. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the open-top bus tour stop and the Seine river cruises. The hotel is right beside the metro but the room was still very quite with the window closed. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttTheD0t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days and can't fault it. The location is fantastic if you are sightseeing - across the road from the metro and just round the corner from the Eiffel Tower. We chose a superior room and it was clean, decently proportioned (for Paris!) and quiet. The shower was poorly positioned and there are no in-room tea or coffee facilities but these were minor niggles. Paris is all about the cafes so why stay in for coffee anyway? The staff were all multi-lingual and couldn't be more friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. We had a minor issue with the room not being restocked properly (every day something else was missing) but all we had to do was asked and it was resolved. We tried the breakfast once and although the room was quiet and nicely decorated, the food was disappointing for the price. You can get better value for money at any of the cafes on the same street. Overall, the place was perfect for our short stay and if they work on the minor details, this place will be unbeatable in this price-range. We will be returning and staying here again. What better recommendation is there than that?

Reviews.Title: “Klimt and Mackintosh combine to give a stylish welcome”
Reviews.Author: Urbophile
Reviews.Content: After a rather frustrating and hot journey (Eurostar delay, engineering works on RER) we arrived at Eiffel Seine in a less than receptive mood. Immediately we were welcomed by a friendly and bi-lingual receptionist, who was seated at a desk rather than standing officiously behind a counter, in a cool (in both senses) and stylish entrance lobby. The tiny but efficient lift delivered us to our third-floor room which was equally stylish. Unsurprisingly, being in an old and traditional Parisian city building, the room was on the small side and rather oddly shaped, but it was quiet, air-conditioned, and provided with all necessities (except, not being English, no tea-making facilities). The double bed was large and comfortable, although with the air-conditioning switched off the duvet was a bit too warm. The breakfast room, in the basement, was pleasant enough; the buffet breakfast, entirely self-service, was adequate although not worth the advertised â‚¬16 (we were fortunate to have an inclusive rate). The whole hotel is decorated in the style of Charles Rennie Mackintosh, with many reproductions of Gustav Klimt paintings from the same period. Combined with the courtesy and helpfulness of the staff this made for a relaxing environment and a pleasant contrast with the busy-ness of the city. Which however is easily reached. The Eiffel tower with its throngs of tourists, and the comparative calm of the Champ du Mars at its feet, is less than five minutes' walk away. Bir Hakeim metro station is immediately opposite, while the RER line C (when it is fully reopened) is also close by. River cruises (including the useful Batobus hop-on-hop-off service) are five minutes away. There are many restaurants and bars in the immediate neighbourhood, and though the area is clearly a tourist magnet, there is a feel of the real everyday Paris as well. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a stylish and good value base for a holiday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Jock_Murphy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Eiffel Seine Hotel for 5 nights in August. I booked it through their site on the internet as they offered the best rates. The hotel is conveniently located to the Eiffel Tower on the left bank but the best thing about the hotel is the Metro Station (Bir Hakeim) directly opposite the hotel. Literally steps away although I must add there is minimal noise since the trains are electric and can barely be heard. The hotel was lovely, very clean and had a wonderful bed (superking) in our club selection. The only downfall was perhaps the decor, wallpaper in the room was badly marked by luggage etc and the paint work could have done with a little touch up. However saying that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would go back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle040
Reviews.Content: The hotel Eiffel Seine is lovely. The location just opposite the metro and being able to walk to the eiffel Tower was extremely convenient. The rooms are smallish but adequate and the bathrooms are great. The staff are gracious and happy to be of assistance. Breakfast was included in the price and there was a wide variety to choose from. Part of the attraction was the small lift as after a day touring, stairs just weren't an option. We also made use of the free internet which was great. The small fridge in the room also enabled us to get some drinks and snacks from the supermarket to take on our travels. Overall we were very impressed with the Eiffel Seine and would most definitely stay there again and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Deligthful Stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler109
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and modern and conveniently located right across the street from the Metro. It is within a very short walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel staff were extraordinarily pleasant and helpful, giving us many useful tips about navigating Paris and the best sights to see. They have internet access in the rooms and also a free computer for use at the bar for guests. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful and the ambiance was very nice. This is a great place to stay if you are not planning to spend all day lounging in your room. On the same street, there are cafes, shops and a market - all very convenient! The room was a little tight and the walls are a little thin - you can hear your neighbors if they get too loud. The bath was small but functional. These issues did not get in the way of the glorious few days were spent in Paris. We would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it for others. Best for couples or small groups - a small space for families with children!

Reviews.Title: “Such a cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jules_79_CI
Reviews.Content: It was a very small hotel (two taxi drivers had difficulty finding it) but I believe it used to be called the Eiffel Grenelle. Part of the reason for choosing it is that on the airmiles website it had breakfast included in the price - we're not big eaters so it is never worth going to a restaurant and paying for a big breakfast! Breakast was sufficient for our purposes, there was bread and a toaster, croissants and other pastries, and orange juice and tea / coffee. It was all serve yourself. The hotel was rather nice, the receptionist allowed me to attempt my "petit peu" of french but she was able to converse in english. There are only 3 or 4 rooms per floor and a tiny lift - just big enough for 2 people and 2 suitcases. This would not be a suitable hotel for smeone with disbalitities in my opinion - although not impossible. We didnt use the metro underground at all but there was a stop opposite the hotel. 2 restaurants almost next door and a small supermarket just a few minutes walk away, would recommend that if you go when the weather is hot you stock up on water, we kept a couple of bottles in the minibar which was handy. We were about 5-10 minutes walk from the eiffel tower and just a couple of minutes from the river Seine. Most attractions are located along the Seine so if you like a walk it is very easy to get around. We didn't use the metro undrground at all, instead we used the batobus ion our first full day and bought a ticket for L'Open Tour bus - it stops by the eiffel tower so we used that on our 3rd and 4th days to get around and see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and great location”
Reviews.Author: _Duke417
Reviews.Content: This was a small hotel, but it was very cute, a short walk from the Eiffel tower, and right next to a delicious crepe place. The staff was very friendly, and there was a complimentary computer with internet.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Uk-Traveller300
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly helpful staff, small but very comfortable room especially bed and pillows. Convenient for Eiffel Tower and seeing Paris, train stop across the road. Breakfast a bit pricey for what was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: adnam1
Reviews.Content: Great location, polite staff, clean, and nicely decorated. The price was also very appropriate. Loved it and will stay again if/when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: imGLADhesRICH
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful. Great short walk from the Eiffel Tower, and right next to the Seine. Subway was right across the street, though we had rather not used it cause the subways smell and my family couldn't handle it. But the bus was another wonderful way to get there. Staff was completely helpful when some of our tour plans didn't go exactly the way we hoped. Cleaned the room everyday. Good size room, I guess for being European? Haha, beautifully decorated. We stayed at the top floor with a wonderful balcony view. We didn't eat breakfast there for it was way too expensive. Instead try to bring your own food, find some market or stock up from the farmer's market that is a short walk away from the hotel on certain days. Food in Europe is expensive period. There were cafes right next to the hotel, which were great. Sold crepes too. Room needed some updating on wall paper though, there were black marks, probably from luggages, but all in all, it was a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2HappyTravellersUK
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique hotel, Clean, smart and quiet. Breakfast was above average with superb coffee and croissants as you might expect. It is located near to the Eiffel tower which is a relatively quiet district. If you are looking for a lively, Paris night out you will have to travel by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: erein
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed in the Eiffel Seine during June 2008. We were very impressed with the hotel, it is located near a metro station and restaurants as well as the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is decorated beautiful, the reception staff very helpful and the staff in the breakfast room friendly. The breakfast was delicious - it consisted of a nice fruit salad, yoghurt, cheese etc. The bed was very comfortable, we felt well rested in the mornings. The room and bathroom are clean and modern. I will recommend this hotel to any person who wants to visit Paris. I can understand why this hotel is a "Fodor's Choice hotel".

Reviews.Title: “very very recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: basemhkm
Reviews.Content: it was a great stay in this hotel. very very friendly staff, they were helpfull and lovely. great location 3-5 minutes walking to eiffel tower. the room was very clean and everything is available. i would recommend this hotel for the my next paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: runtley
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with our four night stay in the Eiffel Seine Hotel this July, 2008. The staff was extremely helpful, the rooms were clean, quiet, tasteful, the location was perfect and the price was far less then we expected. We would heartily recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family, but, not our enemies--let them suffer! Tex and Monica--United States

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PDXYoungMarried
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and just a 2 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. We also used the subway to get to the hotel and it is a perfect location for that as well since there is 2 subway station across the street. We did not eat at the hotel, but thought the accommodations were very clean, nicely decorated, very comfortable and the staff was very helpful. We will stay at the Eiffel Seine the next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Seine is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeTravelers_08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine on our honeymoon in Paris. We were upgraded to a suite when we checked in, as the clerk at the front desk found out we were honeymooners. The room was quite nice and far exceeded our expectations. The front desk clerks were all very helpful. Each time we had a question, they were happy to help, and each clerk gave us useful information and tips on the city. We don't speak much French, but the clerks were able to understand and communicate with us accordingly. John Francois, a.k.a. JF, (one of the front desk clerks) helped us by mapping out the city and pointing out various points of interest that we might enjoy during our stay. The breakfast also exceeded our expectations -- the food was fresh every morning and there always was a nice selection of items to choose from. My husband and I were very pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Paris. Great location too -- we felt it was easy to get to where we needed to be, plus it was a short distance to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for women”
Reviews.Author: nancdc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as pictured on the web site. There are only 45 rooms so it is very cozy. The staff was charming and very helpful. The lobby was well-lit and welcoming with a delightful bistro next door and the Metro across the street. The beds were very comfortable; the bathroom was spacious with large towels. The rooms are small, but all have natural lighting. We had a small balcony with French doors looking out on the Seine. I was traveling with my 16 year old niece and we felt completely safe in the neighborhood. I would stay there again; it is the type of place I prefer over large hotel chains. The hallways are narrow and the elevator is tiny, but functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: TravlnFool23
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect - just a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are a couple of restaurants next door and the metro station is just across the street. The building's power went out while we were there, but fortunately was back on within 15 minutes. The room was extremely small, but the beds were very comfortable and the room was modern and clean. We ate the hotel's breakfast the first morning (which was not included in our rate) - it was nothing special and extremely overpriced (16 euros per person). The next few mornings we just walked next door to the restaurant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if I ever find myself in Paris again, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good quality”
Reviews.Author: angussydney
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a fantastic position for all the major sites. The eifel tower can be seen within 10 steps from the front door. The rooms are not paticularly large however they are clean and the staff were very helpful with directions and restaurant advice. After much research i was very happy with my choice of hotel. If you want a step above be prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST VISIT TO PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Dorisdogooder
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris, quite apprehensive hadnt a clue where to stay, just wanted something close to tourist attractions, clean and good value for money!! This hotel did not disappoint we would certainly recommend it to our friends and would return there again. Everything was a new experience for myself and husband and a brilliant one, what a beautiful city!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: globetrottingdiva
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel a couple of blocks from the Eiffel Tower and just steps away from the metro. Small but clean with a nice helpful staff. The rooms were as comfortable as they could be considering the small size. Even though right across from the Metro, and on a somewhat busy street, the noise is level very low. Considering how expensive Paris is, this is a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: bpeters850
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and the breakfast served each day was tasty and fresh. The staff was very helpful in making the day activity more fun. We enjoyed riding the subway and having the station so close.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaShropshire
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from 12 to 16 July and had a wonderful time. The hotel is lovely and staff very friendly - all English speaking. The room was small but too be honest this was no problem what so ever, you had enough space to walk around and get ready. Both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and big. There was a tv in the room (although only one English channel) and a well stocked fridge (with room for a couple of your own items although it wasn't overly expensive anyway). The hotel staff were very helpful and recommended a lovely French restaurant the one evening. Location wise, it couldn't be better - after a long day sight seeing it was great to get off the metro right outside the hotel, and it was lovely seeing the Eiffel tower every day and evening!! Also, if you turn left when leaving the hotel you will find a few bars, cafes, supermarket, restaurants and shops - we headed in that direct each morning and evening and find some lovely restuartants. The italian restaurant next to the hotel is also very nice. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but the restaurant there did look very nice, instead we went to a cafe/bar further up the same road each morning and had coffee, OJ, croissant and french bread for 8 euros each- lovely! It was also nice to walk along the River Seine which is right across the road. So to conclude - this was a great holiday and we would certainly stay at the Eiffel Seine again. P.s there was absolutely no noise what so ever from outside although the walls are a bit thin and you can hear other residents moving about at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fauxfaux
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my Mom. It was small, but very cute and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location was great and it has a nice cafe next door which stays open very late. They had a computer and internet access for hotel guests and a 24/7 lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and superbly located.....”
Reviews.Author: Whey-aye-Man
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with my wife on 17th June 08. I had requested a high floor to avoid noise and the hotel obliged, and once in the room I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was. On arrival the staff were very busy helping others, but they acknowledged our presence (and somehow already knew our names!) so we felt comfortable waiting. Check-in could not have been easier. An extremely small lift took us up to our room, at the rear of the hotel overlooking a small courtyard. Despite fears from having read previous reviews, the room wasn't too small.... just right for the two of us. It was clean & well maintained, and had a free-to-use mini-safe. The en-suite was modern & very, very clean. Blackout curtains ensured a superb nights sleep. The iron & ironing board were located in the basement of the hotel, not "in room" as described, but were available to use immediately when requested. Breakfast the next morning was excellent, a clean, quiet dining room with plenty of food options. The hotel was happy to look after our luggage after check-out so that we could enjoy our day in Paris without heavy bags to carry. There was also a laptop at our disposal in the reception area for free internet usage. In conclusion; this is an ideally situated hotel for transport links and tourism. It is modern, clean, and the staff are very helpful. I would wholeheartedly recommend it for single travellers and couples, and will most likely use it again myself.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: normajeanneLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would imagine a quaint hotel in Paris to look like. Very stylish with beautiful orchid arrangements. In addition to the attentive staff and lovely accomodations, the biggest plus is that it is across the street from the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “loved the eiffel seine hotel paris”
Reviews.Author: doctito
Reviews.Content: beautifully located at the #6 metro easy to get ANYWHERE. the rooms r slightly small but confortable . the great thing is they speak perfect english and made my american family feel very welcome! try it you will like it. we would stay there again! the restos title loved the eiffel seine hotel paris

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with charisma”
Reviews.Author: peterandwendy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extremely small. The lift was also tiny and we could not both fit in with a suitcase each. However, the room was very clean, comfortable and had all the required facilities. The hotel also had a lovely ambience. We would stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best thing about it, is that it is in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: I booked on line and when I arrived, the room I was taken to was not the type room that I had booked. I had booked a "triple room" that according to my booking had twin beds. Instead, I was taken to a room with only one bed. It was also on the ground floor and very dark with only one very small window beside the door. This was a bad design, because the door had a full glass in it and you had to pull drapes across the small window to cover the glass door to have privacy, so the room was then like a cave. I asked to be moved to an upper floor where the room would have some light. The lady kindly told me that she would see what else was available. Well, after waiting much time, she did not return, so I took my luggage and went back to the front desk to find that she was welcoming other folks and taking care of their needs leaving me to wait. I had prepaid when I made the reservation, so expected that my concern was not a priority. Finally, she said that she had only one other room with a window in it. She then led me to another ground floor room with the extra window. Since it was all she had, I took it. At least when I pulled the drapes over the full glass door, I still had a seperate window in the room that allowed in some outside light, which was nice. I had problems getting the A/C & Heat to work despite my best efforts. I could never get it to work, so I usually just opened the door to let some air in during the day, but then at night, the room got very cool and it would have been nice to have had heat. The room had a flatscreen TV in it, that sometime worked and sometime not. The lamp on my desk (sofa table) didn't work. As mentioned by someone in an earlier review, the walls (and ceiling) are thin because I was even awakened one morning by the sounds of the room above me. The small courtyard outside my ground floor room was nice, except that is where everyone would come to smoke and since I don't smoke, that was unpleasant to me. OK, that is the negative, but there are positives. As others have said, the location is convenient to the Seine River and just a few blocks away from the Eiffel Tower and there are a variety of cafes within an easy walking distance. I didn't use the train, but yes, the train is close by. Should you choose to give this hotel a try, I would suggest calling the hotel directly to make your reservation and perhaps on arrival, you will get the room you thought you were going to get. You might also want to request a high floor since the few rooms on the bottom floor are very dark and if you don't like smoke, and people milling about outside your room in the courtyard, you don't want the ground floor rooms. Oh, you might think this a silly thing to mention, but if you stay here, you will know what I am talking about. There is a trick to locking your door, so allow yourself some extra time and patience when you are leaving your room or entering your room and need to lock the door. I never really got the hang of it. The best thing about this hotel is that it is in fabulous PARIS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and best location”
Reviews.Author: DrMRanola
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my 2 children ( ages 13 and 8) at Hotel Eiffel Seine last May 8-12, 2008. Although this is our 3rd time in Paris (first time for my 8y/o son) and always stayed in big hotels, after reading reviews and personally calling the front desk a month before our departure about location and accessibility to metro, and most importantly, to restaurants and grocery- I decided to make a reservation. I was not disappointed! The staff were indeed very helpful and knowledgeable about Paris. As what other reviews have stated- rooms are indeed small, but very clean and quite. We stayed on the 2nd floor so we did not have any problem not using the lift. I had the chance to look at the 3 rooms behind the bar door (or reception desk), and thought it would be the best location for a family with 2 kids.You have your own patio and indeed the rooms are well appointed. No doubt about coming back or recommending this hotel to friends and family! Dr. M. Ranola Ligao City, Albay,Philippines

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: ellendq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we were delighted with the hotel. Booking on-line can be tricky because you just don't really know what you're getting until you're there. This hotel was very centrally located, within short walking distance from the eiffel tower (which was great because we were able to avoid the long lines of people waiting because we could get there very early!) and right beside two metro stations Bir-hakeim, and Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel. The deluxe room was lovely, clean and situated very conveniently. The staff were very pleasant, extremely helpful and welcoming. My two sisters and our mother agree that if we were to go back we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: itsmetwo
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable stay. The location is perfect for easy access to metro and getting around. The rooms are small but very clean. The above average rating is credited to the front desk staff as they made our stay most enjoyable. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris”
Reviews.Author: Loart
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very friendly staff and great location. Close to train station and within waking distance of major sights. Nicely decorated and clean, small but cozy. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Bowlinski
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpfull staff. Lift kept breaking. Stylish. Cramped. Walls thin so you could here next door flushing the loo. Breakfast is overpriced. Good locatation for seeing the Seine and Eiffel Tower, but for central paris you need to travel. Not many nice places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: schristensen
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night in this hotel, it was a wonderful experience. Situated a very easy 5 minute walk from the Eifel Tower and River Sienne, we were able to enjoy seeing the highlights of Paris in a very short time. The hotel is small and intimate with a lot of character. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were available for 24 hours and helped to arrange transport to the airport as well as answer our questions very competently. There is no language problem - I heard German and English used and am sure that other languages are also spoken by the staff. There are lots of cafe's and restaurants in the area as well as a grocery store "Marche" just down the street. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hmp_825
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, clean, comfortable room and very convenient location (next to station and round the corner to the Eiffel Tower) Will definiately be going back to The Hotel Eiffel Seine

Reviews.Title: “Only one night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 4countries6days
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We only stayed one night, but it was very nice. The staff was very kind. The location is great. We had a terrace outside our room which was a nice surprise. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locaation, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gform
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel. The room was comfortable and very nicely furnished. Breakfast was excellent. Would recommend this hotel. The only problem was that the room was a bit warm and we had to sleep with the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it agin”
Reviews.Author: winterswv
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. 2 or 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms were small but very cosey. Receptionist was very, very helpful. Price was reasonable. We would stay here again and so should you

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Hotel for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Laurissa
Reviews.Content: After finishing a whirlwind tour of Europe, my husband and I spent our last two nights of our honeymoon here, and loved every second! The staff was super friendly, and the hotel is clean, comfortable, and very tastefully decorated. We just loved the breakfast also. The bedding was very comfortable, and we were happy with our view of the Seine. We were so close to the Eiffel Tower, and the Metro, and many cafe's and even a grocery store! What more could you ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get...”
Reviews.Author: Lenee410
Reviews.Content: We are from the Philippines. My husband and I together with our children ages 21, 20, 16 and 9yrs old stayed in two triple rooms, 2nd and 3rd floors for 5days and 4nights. It is quite difficult to book thru the website because you are unsure as to how clean, comfortable and spacious the rooms will be but this one, luckily, was clean, comfortable and with ample space. What you see is what you get! A beautiful boutique hotel with eclectic design. Family friendly too. The location was good too because there is the metro across and another one near the easy walk to Eiffel Tower. The L'Open Bus Tour stop is also near the hotel. We enjoyed the breakfast too, a bit pricey though. There are several restaurants around the hotel and a supermarket which is also walking distance. The people at the reception were all very polite, helpful and very friendly, especially JF (Jean Francois) and Adrianna. Our family may consider to stay again at this hotel on our next vist. We certainly hope that you will continue to maintain the standard and maybe even improve it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Eiffel Seine Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michaelstar
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel Easy access from the metro and rar. the staff were most helpful. Everyone from the receptionists, wairess' and maids were all exceptionally friendly. I would definetely book this hotel again and woulod reccommend anyone to stay here. The Breakfast was teh best continental breakfast I have ever had in any hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eiffel Seine!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingPair05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I spent four nights at the Eiffel Seine. Our check in & check out was smooth and the receptionists we talked to were super friendly & spoke English very well. The elevator was small (could only fit 1 person with luggage), but thats common in Europe and was not a surprise. Our room on the 2nd floor was very well decorated and clean, I was very impressed. I really enjoyed the modern feel of the room & especially the bathroom. Everything was clean and there is a mini fridge witht the standard mini-bar fare. The view is of the Bir Hakeim Metro stop during the day, but when the sun goes down and the lights are turned on to the Eiffel Tower, there is a perfect reflection of it in the building across the street, it was a spectacular sight. The windows open, which is nice if you don't mind the noise. When you close them, you realize how much sound they block out! There are many brasseries, cafes & bistros in the area. There is breakfast at the hotel but we did not go to it because it was not included in our reservation. The price of the the breakfast was 16 Euro. We ended up getting snacks and breakfast items from the market up the street & greek pastries from the Latin Quarter, delicious! The hotel is in very close proximity to the Eiffel Tower, its only about a five minute walk. The "sister" Statue of Liberty is on Ile aux Cygnes, which is in the middle of the Seine. Just walk halfway across the brigde (under the metro) from the hotel and go down the steps. With the Metro stop right across the street the whole city is at your doorstep! We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: DaveDublin22
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Most delighted with the Seine Eiffel. Would love to go back.”
Reviews.Author: AJHEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a two night stay, and would have loved to stay longer. Although the room was small, it was comfortable, quiet and well designed, with an excellent mattress and good air conditioning. Very close to the Eiffel tower, and you would need to ask for a room on the tower side if you want to make sure of a view of it. The decor is smart without feeling corporate or bland, and the breakfast was good. The staff were charming and most helpful, and all in all for a 3 star hotel it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BlueJayFanToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel and enjoyed our stay. The location was terrific. We were within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and the bus stop for L'Open Tour, the city tour bus, and directly across the street from the Metro. Outside my window I could see the lights of the Eiffel Tower sparkle at night during their hourly show. Wow. The hotel was clean and looked recently renovated. The rooms were smaller than I had been used to seeing during our travels but I assumed that when looking at the photos of the hotel prior to arriving in Paris. All in all a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sweet and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: irish1953
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 5 nights in October 07. Very nice little boutique hotel. Nice and clean with morning breakfast very adequate with coffee, cereal toasts etc. Right across street from Bir Hakim metro gets you where you need to go. The Eiffel Tower is just a short walk right around the corner, this was a beacon for us to get back to our hotel from anywhere in the city when out walking. Can catch the Hop on Hop off bus and go anywhere also in the city just around the corner and down the street before the Eiffel Tower. Used this and the metro to get around very easy. The Italian restaurant a few doors down was very good and nice people worked there. Don't bother with the restaurant right next door overpriced bad food. Ask for a room that faces into the courtyard. Loved our room opened the french windows with the lacy curtains next to the bed in the mornings and had breakfast in bed everyday (can order the night before and not have to go down to the eating area if you choose) and enjoyed the morning rains coming down. Felt very French! LOL nice staff, very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta stay Eiffel Seine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Proud2beCanadian
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay!! Think of NYC boutique hotel rooms and you're there and oh so beautifully decorated. The website showed exactly what you are getting - no exaggerations so no one should be surprised at the size of the room. Elegantly decorated. Very attentive staff. We contacted the concierge two months before we arrived and asked for a reservation at the Jules Verne restaurant in the Eiffel Tower. They got the best table for us and it was a 'bucket list' moment. The lobby is quaint and makes you feel so very safe in the midst of a very busy Eiffel Tower area. There are restaurants, pharmacy, and metro right at your doorstep. It is three blocks from the Tower. It's a home away from home! and a most memorable stay! Signed Proud to be Canadian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenny1luis4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!! My husband and I stayed at this hotel last week for three days. This hotel made our experience in Paris so much greater! The staff was friendly, helpful and the hotel was small yet chic, trendy and very clean. They even gave us an upgraded room which was to die for and overlooked a very cute court yard. The location is the best feature yet by far. The Metro, RER, and Eiffel Tower were just very short walks. There were plenty of cafÃ©s and shops on the same street which were excellent and also a grocery store just down the block which came in handy. The breakfast was included in our package which was also great. We couldnâ€™t have had a better stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone- it was excellent!! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattKenz08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a superb location. Took my now fiancee' to Paris to propose. Directly opposite RER link and 4 min walk from Eiffel Tower. Spotlessly clean and staff went out of their way to help and provide information. If we go to Paris again then we would unreservedly choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la! Fabulous Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: dorise45
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights stay in the Eiffel Seine Hotel. It is absolutely great. Close to the Eiffel tower, bars and restaurants. The RER and Metro are also on the doorstep. There were 6 of staying in 3 rooms. All were excellent, stylish and the Deco decor made it unique and atmospheric. Much nicer than staying in a large anonymous chain hotel. showers hot and NO noise. Breakfast seemed a bit expensive, but there are plenty of places nearby for coffee and snacks. Paris of course is wonderful with loads to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect for weekend away”
Reviews.Author: WAB11
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great - the tube stop is right outside of the hotel, train line is a 3 min walk and the eiffel tower a 5 min walk. The staff were very friendly, efficient. The hotel rooms were clean, nicely decorated and looked quite new with modern bathroom fixtures. The rooms are a bit on the small side but from what I have read all rooms in Paris in this price range are on the small side. There are some local grocery stores, restaurants and cafes all in the area. The hotel also had a bag storage facility so we were able to leave our bags at the hotel before we checked in and during the day after we had checked out. Would definitely go back and stay again and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Herewegoagain1982
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine truly is a gem of a hotel. In a fantastic location providing easy access to all the amenities and tourist spots of Paris. I was there with my girlfriend, her mother and 10 year old niece and we all loved our stay. The hotel is stylish, fresh and clean. The staff are impecably turned out and incredibly helpful and friendly. Jean Francoise on reception was also able to converse fluently with myself in English and with my gfs mother in Spanish, she was most impressed! I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel to any friends or family who were visiting Paris. They provided a truly first-class service.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: briscouple14
Reviews.Content: We had a thoroughly great stay in the hotel, the staff were very helpful and all spoke very good English. The room although a bit small was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were very accomodating. The location was very good, close to the Metro and some very good restaurants. We would definately stay there again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the lovliest city”
Reviews.Author: Bene39
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris alone for 3 days and booked this hotel after a quick search on the internet... so I didn't really know what to expect. It was quite a nice surprise. Only a few minutes walking to the Tour Eiffel and next to the metro, this hotel is excellent to go anywhere in Paris. I parked my car in the parking of the Hilton just around the corner. The rooms are trendy but cosy, very clean. I modern bathroom.. heavy legs after a day citytripping were immediatly forgotten in my bath... with television view :) Breakfast is rather sober but good. The crew is very kind and gives any explanation you need to discover this magical city.. I was there alone but never really felt alone. In Dutch : een aanradertje !

Reviews.Title: “very clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: 1464lady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay. If you are looking for somthing very clean and modern than I would recommend this hotel. The rooms were small but exceptionally clean and it appears that they are trying to give you a similiar experience to what you would get at a U.S. hotel.The hotel has a modern feel to it with the way the halls light up as you walk down them as apose to the lights being constantly on, you also need to put the hotel key in a slot on the wall to turn the electricity on in the room. This was the second hotel we stayed in for this trip, the first was near Notre Dame. I would recommend this for the hotel its self and the proximity to the eiffle tower. However I liked the location of my 1st hotel better because of the neighborhood. At this hotel I had to walk about 5-10mins to find a bakery at the other hotel if I walked 5-10mins I would have more bakeries, stores and shops I would know what to do with. I would also suggest that you ask to see your room before you commit as our first room was on the 2nd floor in the front of the hotel. The problem with this is the hotel is on a very busy street and the metro runs right in front. being on the 2nd floor we would have been on the same level as the metro and I'm sure we would have heard the train everytime it went by. They were kind enough to allow us to look at other rooms and let us choose the one we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivingBarbie
Reviews.Content: WE LOVED THIS HOTEL! I tookl my partner away for his birthday here last August for a romantic break. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location right by the effiel tower, metro and a few bars and resteraunts. Its also very easy to geta taxi into the main town for evening entertainment. The hotel itself is very modern and the rooms are furnished very well. The rooms are clean and comfortable with everything you need and if not the receptionest is very very helpful. Also the bed is the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in!!! We went to an amazing Jazz club on the Saturday evening called the cavern, this is a must even if your not a jazz fan as its a fantastic night. Would definalty return here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter179
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our one night stay to discover we'd been upgraded to a superior room - an excellent start. The room was great: quite large and with the biggest bed we've ever slept in - fantastic! The bathroom was lovely with ample hot water, nice fluffy towels and toiletries supplied. Everything was spotlessly clean. The man on the reception desk was nice and helpful and seemed to go out of his way to give directions, tourist information and indeed any kind of advice that was asked. Paris was of course Paris: wonderful at any time of year and plenty to do and see. All in all we had a wonderful time and would certainly recommend the Eiffel Seine hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PansyPotter756
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated near all means of transport, the nearest Metro is opposite with the RER one minute around the corner. As it is only a two minute walk to the Eiffel Tower you can easily catch the hop on hop off tour bus and taxi boat. The hotel itself is clean and the staff very helpful. The rooms again are very clean but a bit on the small side. The breakfast was great and there was plenty of choice. I would certainly stay in the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MKrunner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel when I ran in the Paris Marathon.Directly across the road from the Bir-Hakim mtetro station, and 3 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are comfortable if a bit on the small side. The buffet breakfast seemed a little expensive especially as the Pound was weak agains the Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: copeyb
Reviews.Content: Not having been to Paris since I was 18 - Now 45 - My husband and I decided to watch our friends run the marathon. The Hotel is perfectly situated - straight off the Plane on to the RER and on to the metro easy easy easy - straight into the middle of Paris off at Bir Hakeim Line 6 - The hotel is straight infront of you just round the corner from the eiffel tower ! The Hotel is beautifully clean - and the staff extremley polite - a fab time was had by all and we are going back December to shop (Galeries Lafayette is a must) - PS No noise from the metro at all.

Reviews.Title: “Well compensated”
Reviews.Author: Shemala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel for three nights at the end of March. Our booking was originally for four nights, but the hotel advised us by email the day before our departure that they had made an error with the dates and they had no room for us on the first night. However, they had arranged for us to stay one night at the Ares Hotel, which is under the same management and situated a couple of blocks away. They agreed to pay for a taxi transfer the next day, upgraded our room and gave us complimentary breakfasts for the duration of our stay. A bottle of champagne was also waiting for us when we arrived at the Eiffel Seine. We originally chose this hotel for its location near the Eiffel Tower and the excellent reviews on this site. We weren't disappointed! The hotel did everything they could to make amends for their error and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our only criticism was the size of the bathroom which wasn't big enough for a bath and in our opinion would have been better with just a shower. This was our first trip to Paris and we would definitely consider staying at the Eiffel Seine again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: donna20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Eiffel Seine hotel to celebrate my 21st birthday and we don't have a bad word to say about this hotel! It was perfect for us and exactly what we wanted from a hotel! The room was small, but we expected this from a capital city as it was the same type of hotel that we had stayed in in London in the past and for us, a small room is not a problem as we only spent a couple of hours in it a day getting ready for the evening and then sleeping. The hotel reception is very modernly decorated with a nice area to sit and a bar area. The staff are all very friendly. They will also store your luggage for you if you arrive before the 2am check in time or leave after the 11am check out time. We arrived about 11am on the Friday and they stored our luggage for us until we checked in. We weren't leaving Paris until 4pm in the afternoon on the Monday and again, they happily stored our luggage for us until then. Free use of the laptop at the bar was also a great little touch as we were able to look things up we wanted to know about Paris on the internet whilst there. Our room was on the top floor and we had a nice little balcony. The room was very clean and we have absolutely no complaints about it at all. A nice clean bathroom with toiletries provided, enough towels, etc. The hotel was also in a great location. Just a short walk away from the Eiffel tower and the metro and RER line is right across the street from the hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better location. Breakfast wasn't included in our stay, but we would have a short walk along the road in the morning and find a nice little cafe to sit outside and people watch with a croissant and hot chocolate. Lots of the cafes have seats outside and heaters too, which was nice. It was also a handy location for watching the Olympic torch through the city which happened to fall the weekend we were there (although it wasn't very successful!) The River Seine and the boat trips were also near by. The metro and RER is very handy and being so close to a stop was great. We bought a 3 day travel pass and definitely think we got out use out of it as we used the metro alot and also used a lot of buses when we travelled around so that we could see more of the city rather than travelling underground all the time. Don't be afraid to use the RER or the underground to get to and from the airport! It's very simple. From CDG (which is a horrible airport!) we got on the blue RER, line C, towards Saint-Remy and got off at Saint-Michel Notre Dame and changed onto the yellow RER, line C towards Versailles and got off at Champ de Mars Tour Eiffel. At first it can all seem confusing but after a few trips you get the hang of it and by the end of the weekend we were experts with the busses and underground! All in all, a brilliant weekend in away in a fantastic hotel with absoulutely no complaints. We would definitely reccommend this hotel, we didn't see any better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: stuartb8
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Seine was perfect for our first trip to Paris. It is easy to get anywhere in Paris by using the metro just right across the street. There are several nice places to eat in the neighborhood and the eiffel tower is literally right around the corner. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast filling. The rooms were small but spotless and the shower was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rr_hat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Paris hotel a three minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, thirty seconds from the RER and 10 seconds from the Metro. Had a brief overnight stay on my way to south France (so I could do a Segway tour of Paris which I highly recommend). Staff were excellent, the room was immaculate and the price was very reasonable. Unfortunately, I had to leave too early to enjoy their breakfast. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed”
Reviews.Author: Patsy99
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay. It was exactly what we wanted from this hotel. It was a great location, the rooms were very clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The staff were very friendly and exceptionally helpful and recommended an excellent nearby restaurant for a celebratory meal. We cannot fault the hotel and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “I never realised I liked Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: mb961
Reviews.Content: Our party was three adults and three children. we stayed in two three person rooms which we found to be very adequate. The staff were very polite and helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful and was was a pleasure to see. I would not hesitate to recommend the Eiffel Seine to my friends and would staythere again on our next visit to paris

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: JAZZ_QUEEN_79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautifully decorated. Coupled with being greeted by a very friendly man on reception our first impression was excellent. You can get to almost all of the tourist attractions on the rer line which is a 2 min walk from the hotel. My only moan is that it is not a hotel for people who like to sleep late. You can hear the people in the room upstairs showering which wakes you up. Also, with only one member of staff running the breakfast kitchen,the later you leave it the less likely you are to get a clean table. On the whole though, it was fine for my needs and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Towering Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cloudleopard
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in Paris this Easter based at the excellent Hotel Eiffel Seine. Stylish Art Deco Interiors, which look as though just finished, both in the public areas and the rooms. Bright and professional reception staff. Immaculate housekeeping - your room was almost lovingly cleaned and tidied ready for your return. Great central location - to see the River Seine and the Tower when you left every day, be in a smart area of Paris and also have great transport links (RER, Metro or River) to tour the city. Great buffet breakfast - good selection of breads/pastries, good fresh fruit salad and coffee etc. The hotel was definitely a big part of making this the best stay I've ever had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac-Mabs
Reviews.Content: My new finance & I (he did it on one knee at the top of the Tower!) just returned from a 3 day break in Paris staying at the Eiffel Seine Hotel. The hotel was very clean throughout and decorated in a modern way. The staff were very helpful & the gentleman who checked us in spoke fluent English. We could ask any questions at any time to obtain information. The rooms were also very clean although ours was a little small. I believe all hotels rooms are like this in Paris. We had the basic room-there was a double bed, tv, wardrobe with a safe. The bathroom was also very clean and the shower was lovely & powerful. It also had a hairdryer. The location for the hotel is ideal if you want to be close to the Eiffel tower-it was not more than a 3/4 minute walk round the corner. The hotel is also across the road from the river and this was always a good point to orientate ourselves whilst out seeing the sights. When we wanted to get back, we headed for the river going towards the tower. We felt 3 days was enough to see the sights we wanted-we walked most of it but the metro stations pop up everywhere if the distance is too far to walk. There are boat trips also along the river. We saw Paris at night from the Eiffel tower & I would recommend that to anyone-absolutely fantastic. I didn't think it was expensive at all to get to top floor (12 euro's). Worth every penny for those views. Would recommend this hotel to anyone as in ideal location and of a high quality. If we were to return, I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jam2004
Reviews.Content: I used this site and Fodors Paris 2008 to research hotels and both were very high on this hotel and they were right on. Location is unmatched (Metro, RER, small super market, cafes, ATM and of course, the Eiffel Tower) are all so close. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Continental breakfast was well worth it. Free in room Wi-Fi was great. They also had a laptop on the bar for guests to surf the Web in the lobby. Now for the negatives: The elevator is REALLY small. Respect its' weight limits. My 10 year old daughter and I got stuck on it for 10 minutes in the dark with two older gentlemen, one of whom was somewhat clostrophobic. We finally were rescued by the front desk mgr. and maid. The shower door, while part of a beautifully clean and modern bathroom was half-sized. Unless you are careful, water sprayed out of it and onto the floor quite easily. The front desk was 1 for 2 on wake up calls. Fortunately, I used a back-up clock on the missed day. Overall, this property is highly recommended. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base”
Reviews.Author: RodsWales
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Paris staying at the Eiffel Seine. We chose the hotel simply because of it's location - right opposite a metro station (Bir-Hakeim) and we definitely made the right choice. The hotel could be seen immediately as we walked down the steps of the metro station and was ideal as a base for exploring the city and seeing all the sites either on foot or using the metro. We did walk to the Eiffel Tower as it is literally around the corner and as the hotel is a stone's throw from the river,we also used this as our guide .This also helped us get our bearings when we unsure in which direction to go - always follow the river heading to the tower. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were a little on the small side but this wasn't an issue as the only time spent in the room was at night when we crashed out after a busy day. The only thing that I personally missed from the room was tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was served between 7 and 11 so you could eat before an early start or have a later breakfast, which was very convenient if you planned on getting to the Louvre or Tower early to avoid the queue. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Superb Location, Superb Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: stubbsy1979
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Eiffel Seine, with this being our first time in Paris, we weren't quite sure what to expect. We'd been advised that the hotels in Paris were not the cheapest & the room's are not the biggest. And I have to say that our hotel room was quite small and a little expensive (compared to England), but the dÃ©cor of hotel & quality of the room were both exceptional. The only slight issue I had, was the hangers provided, were a little too big for the wardrobe (but if thatâ€™s the only issue, then you can see how good this hotel is!) The staff were polite & very helpful, all in all a top hotel, definitely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CYanWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the Eiffel Seine. Can't say enough about the location. There was a metro stop right outside the door and a RER line right around the corner. The Eiffel tower was less than a half mile away. The room was very comfortable and modern. The beds were comfortable. The shower was great with plenty of water pressure. The rooms were very clean and the area felt safe. We would definitely stay here again if we are to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarahluke
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Paris for a long weekend for his birthday. The hotel was gorgeous! It has been recently decorated and is so modern and very attractive. Our room was fresh clean tidy and again recently decorated. The room itself wasnt massive,it was adequate. I dont think any rooms are massive in Paris but it was more that big enough. We had 2 bed side tables, a desk and chair, a (small) cupboard and storage area, a shelf, 2 mirrors (one full length) and a large stool. The bathroom was AMAZING. gleaming white and very spacious!it was a lovely bathroom no complaints at all! Overall, the hotel and staff were all fab. Breakfast was lovely as was the bar and available drinks. A quiet hotel which is very calming friendly and modern. Paris is a beautiful city and we made the most of our stay. The hotel is situated a couple of minutes walk from the eiffel tower and based on the river seine where the river cruises are divine. The hotel can help to arrange these so do ask! Also on the city tour bus route where u buy a ticket and can use it for 2 days!!! well worth doing! Loved Paris and didnt want to come home :( Wish we stayed for a few more days as the shops were FANTASTIC and would have loved to have had some time to do some retail therapy! Have a fab stay everyone

Reviews.Title: “a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: timsmith1963
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights at this hotel in early march 2008 and were very satisfied with all aspects of the hotel. the rooms and bathrooms were spotless, the staff lovely and friendly and location was very convenient for the metro and getting to all parts of paris. with the eiffel tower just a few minutes walk away and some really nice bistro's just a few doors away it is an ideal location for a break in paris. a complete must if you are there on a sunday morning is to walk to the nearby market which is under the metro line between dupleix and motte and a fantastic way to spend a cople of hours and quite a few euro's. i also recommend the duck dish from the small menu at the brasserie which is literally next door and then grab yourself a crepe from a takeaway stall attached tothe same brasserie and stroll up to the tower for 2200 when they let it literally sparkle with flashing lights - fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location; enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chix24
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hotel may not appear very exciting, but we were thoroughly impressed with the decor of the interior - art nouveau and all very clean and welcoming. We were greeted by an exceptionally helpful member of staff, who sat us down and rearranged rooms to allow us to settle in, even though we arrived at least 2 hours before the official time. Although our room was quite small (2 single beds next to each other for 2 female friends was perhaps not ideal), it was well equipped and relaxing. We had a top floor room which just allowed us a view of the Eiffel Tower! Breakfast was brilliant - from 7-11 which covers every possible desire, but we found it quite busy when we ventured down at around half 9, and the room is not huge. However, the choices were excellent and the most delicious croissants were available in abundance! The location is perfect - just opposite the Metro and only a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. We found several good and fairly cheap restaurants just close by. I'd definitiely return to this hotel and have already recommneded it to friends and family. Check out its own website for more detailed information.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short, non expensive weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Realtin-Beag
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Paris. The Tour Eiffel Seine proved to be an ideal base for exploring the city. With the Eiffel Tower litterally in the back garden it meant that we were in easy reach of the tour buses and boats along the Seine which made it very easy to get around. Unfortunately the Metro station facing the hotel was closed for refurbishment during our stay but it is due to re-open on 10 March making it easier again to access all the unmissable sights of Paris. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful and the breakfast was more than adequate for what you'd expect from a continental breakfast.. Croissants, rolls, cereal,youghurts, fruit salad, boiled eggs, sausages etc.. The room, although small, was very clean and like the rest of the hotel, beautifully decorated. All in all great value for the money, i would recommend it without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, minutes away from the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Karen60Mansfield
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Eiffel Seine. The location is great, only minutes on foot from the Eiffel Tower. It is stylishly furnished and the main reception/bar area is both trendy and comfortable. The room we had, though not especially big, was more than adequate and the beds extremely comfortable (struggled to get out in the morning - or perhaps that was due to all the walking we did!). Again, they were nicely furbished. The bathroom, a little on the small side, but again very stylish and immacutely clean. Lovely deep bath - excellent for soothing away the pain of aching feet. Friendly and efficient staff. Not sure about the stairway carpet and walls - a bit dark and gloomy, but loved the pretty ceiling lights. There was renovation work going on at the Bir Hakeim metro station which was literally directly level with our room, but we didn't hear a sound. If you're there on a Sunday, don't miss the excellent local market which takes place under the railway line a little way down the road. It was lovely. Would we stay there again? Definitely. Reasonably priced - excellent value for money. A big hit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: blackandwhitefatfred
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Eiffel-Seine and I can only say good things about it. Very well decorated, 3 or 4 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, very friendly and helpful staff and the beds were the most comfortable of any hotel I can remember. There are several lovely bistro's on the same street and 2 more just before you come to the Tower, service and food were spot on in any place we tried. Get a hop on/hop off bus from beside the Tower and see the city, prices were 26 Euro for one day and 29 for 2 days. The metro is close by but we used taxi's, found them reasonable. Make sure to go up the tower, we left it until about 10.00pm and the queues were short, it's open until 11.00 so you have plenty of time. Loved the Eiffel-Seine and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Potential”
Reviews.Author: speedboat
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Eiffel Seine was equally good and bad. The room was a nice size and clean, however, the room looked to have been recently renovated and unfortunately had a very strong smell of paint, to alleviate this I had to open a window, which meant that I could hear the renovations of Bir Hakeim metro station take place. I'd consider staying here again, but perhaps once the rooms have been aired a little and the renovations of the metro station completed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PIggy205
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris during the weekend after Valentines Day and booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trips Advisor. The reviews are accurate - the location is fab - once you step outside the hotel, turn left - and there it is - the Eiffel Tower! You are just a few minutes walk away! Once walking back to the hotel around 10pm - we saw the Eiffel Tower with flashing lights. My boyfriend read that the this happens every night for 10 mins every hour between 10pm-12am. You probably wouldn't see this if you stayed far away from the Tower. Its a shame the metro station - Bir Hakeim (re-open early March) - was closed for refurbishment as it is literally at the door step but luckily the nearby metro stations are no more than 5 mins walk. What I find is that Paris is quite small - and if you stay at this hotel, you can literally walk to the Eiffel Tower, then cross the bridge towards Arc De Triomphe - then down the Champs Elysee towards the Lourve!!! Yes - that's a mighty long walk but its do-able! I did it!! :) The breakfast selection is ok - don't expect there to be hot food... but there is enough to start you off for the day ! The rooms are small but clean. The lift is tiny! You can only manage to fit max 3 people ... But overall, I enjoyed my stay the hotel and will definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: An13
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome from lovely Hotel staff who were very helpful in how to get around the city. Rooms were very comfortable, if a bit small, but lovely decor and every we needed was available. The Hotel is sitauted on the Seine and is a few hundred yards from the Eiffel Tower...not overly central but great location for us a nice walk back away from the typical tourist traps. Would pay a visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend at the Eiffel Seine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vereltje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel one night, when we went to Paris for a romantic weekend. I can really recommend the very cosy hotel to everybody! The rooms were very trendy and super clean, and the service was above average. We chose to have our breakfast in our room (no extra charge!) and were pleased that it arrived at the time we had asked. In one word: great!

Reviews.Title: “cute wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: catriona60955
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris in Feb with my husband, it was a christmas present to ourselves from ourselves. I loved paris and the hotel was great, the guy on reception bent over backwards for us, was v friendly and helpful. The rooms were lovley and clean, though a bit cramped, but we were only staying 3 nights. Breakfast was really nice too. Would recommend this hotel to my friends, it was central, comfy and affordable. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Paris and the eiffel tower at night, is amazing. Would defo come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sssstu
Reviews.Content: cannot say anything negative about this hotel. Clean, ideal location (although nearest metro closed, the next is not too far and the rer is a stones throw away) staff were extremely helpfull. when asked for idea of where to eat we were directed to a gem of a resteraunt. any advise we required was given by any of the hotel staff. room had small balcony which was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “City for lovers”
Reviews.Author: strikernewfy
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay in Paris, and the hotel was beautiful Rudi and Sabina

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: royalex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 2 night stay and have to say that the hotel is everything you could wish for and more. Spotlessly clean, friendly staff who were very helpful with advice as to where to go and how to get there. Breakfast was lovely, plenty to chose from and again very clean dining area. Rooms where just as described on the website. We are planing to go back for a weekend just as soon as we can. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to vist Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redd74
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I were very impressed with this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable and the standard of our room was comparable with any of the other so called up market hotels. The staff were very friendly and very helpfull. The hotel is ideally located for the Effiel Tower and is situated in an ideal location for use of the Paris Metro, with a metro station (Bir Hakeim) directly opposite and another 2 metro stations nearby. The hotel is located in a friendly area with lots of nice cafe's and amenities nearby and provided a pleasant community atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicNakCoventry
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris several times I can say this is the best hotel we have stayed in. The only negative was the metro station opposite was shut for renovation. We had a room directly opposite this but there was no building work at the weekends so no noise disturbance. This may be an issue if staying at this hotel during the week. The beds were very comfortable, and had decent pillows. The reception staff were very polite and helpful. They have a laptop in reception you can use free of charge to access the internet - which was useful to check flight times.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Seine - A superb hotel....”
Reviews.Author: RobWeavers
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one night stay at the Eiffel Seine, and I can do nothing more than to recommend them highly. Polite and friendly service, especially the guy on reception upon arrival. It was an added bonus that we had been upgraded to the 'Klimt' room, which was simply superb, like a modern day apartment....I just we wish I was there longer than the single night!!! As mentioned in other reviews, the location is superb. 5 Minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and seconds away from the river banks of the River Seine with plenty of Metro or RER lines within a few minutes walk from the hotel. I am a self confessed 'holiday snob' and it takes alot for a hotel to impress me, but I can honestly say that I would book there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: zeebowes
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four and I booked two rooms at the Hotel Eiffel Seine for a two night stay - 19 - 21 January. I had read many reviews about many hotels but I kept coming back to this one. I am so glad I did. Upon our arrival the man at reception could not have been more welcoming. We were there well before the 1.00 p.m. check in but our rooms were ready. As with all Paris hotels, the rooms are small, but ours was bright and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was equiped with everything you would need i.e. hairdryer, shampoo, shower gel etc. Breakfast was continental style and as a celiac, which means bread, croissants etc are out, I was delighted when I saw fresh fruit salad and yoghurt as part of the breakfast buffet. We arrived in quite late one night and there was no problem getting a night cap at the small bar before retiring. The man at reception was also very helpful to us when we were organising our web airline check in. This hotel is very central. Close to the Eiffel Tower and walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe. There are a couple of nice restaurants at the corner and a nice bakery further up the street. The Hotel is right at the Bir-Hakiem metro station. Unfortunately, it is closed for renovations. However, Dupliex, Passy and Champs de Mar are all close by. I would certainly recommend the Eiffel Seine to anyone thinking of visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful ambience and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: parissimochic
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Paris last weekend and it was my second time staying at this hotel and i still have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. firstly, the location is golden...it is literally right in front of the metro station of bir-hakeim (though right now it is closed for renovation until march 2008) and 5 mins walk from the eiffel tower!! there are great restaurants down the street such as pont de la seine very good food! the hotel itself has a very contemporary vibe to it and is very chicly parisien... the hotel is unique in its own way and thats what i loved about this hotel, its a small hotel but in every other way it is very very lovely! moving on to the rooms, they are small but the deco makes up first and space isn't really an issue because most hotel rooms in paris or europe are small anyway so that was fine! there are translucent toilet doors which can be a problem to some but again thats nothing major... the toilets were very modern and clean as well. i've stayed in two different standard rooms and they are both nice rooms. the beds deserve a mention as well as they are very very comfortable beds and with that you can have a good sleep after a long and tiring day out in paris! the staff were great and accommodating..they give a quick response whenever you email them and always politely addresses their guests.. overall, this hotel really helped to make our stay a wonderful one and makes me love paris more and more! i'll be looking forward to come back again some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Principal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in December. What a wonderful stay we had! We were on our way to Jerusalem to spend the holidays with family, so we had extra luggage full of Christmas presents. When the woman at the front desk saw all of our luggage she said, "I'll have to give you a bigger room!". Granted, the room was still small by US standards, but it was extremely comfortable. We spent every day exploring the city, so it was nice to come "home" to such a comfortable bed! Everyone at the front desk was very nice and accomodating to us. Plus-the man at the corner shop was so friendly and his sandwiches and paninis were yummy! Excellent location-five minutes to the Eiffel Tower. A little editorial-the people in Paris were soooo friendly to us. You will not be sorry if you stay here. We will definitely stay there the next time we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: travel72707
Reviews.Content: I really loved the fresh French continental breakfast! Be sure to order that with your room! As a retired Airline Captain who travels a bit, I give it a 10 out of 10. The location was very safe, located at the base of the Eiffel and next to the Seine boat rides. Also, a swimming pool was within a block with a glass wall that looked at the Eiffel. The room was clean, cozy, small, quiet, and comfortable. The transportation system was on strike and the English/French speaking hotel concierge was friendly and went out of her way to inform us of active transportation routes and print them for us. Normally, their metro stop is next to the hotel. It is central to the Louvre and all the shopping! It was a friendly country with generally exceptionally filthy public restrooms (worst in the world), but the hotel bathroom very clean and modern. The hotel was a French Deco style and so fun. When I go back to France, I will be sure to book in advance to get this hotel. Thanks for showing my family an amazing French adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Seine-A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: fareastfan
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little boutique hotel just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. Its small, friendly and clean. The Art Deco interior lends itself nicely to the very Parisenne corridors and rooms. We had a lovely room with French windows opening onto the street below. The beds are comfortable,clean and again the decor was lovely. Each of the 45 rooms - I believe- are decorated individually.
