We had a plasma TV on the wall, air con etc. The bathroom was spacious, modern and again spotlessly clean. The shower was powerful and there was endless amounts of piping hot water. The staff were helpful and approachable-especially George at reception on the night shift who endured a very Scottish Hogmanay celebration until 4 am with our family! Thankyou George! The buffet style breakfast was sufficient with fruit,yoghurt,cereals,bread,toast,eggs,frankfurters,jam etc etc. It has a small bar and lounge area-again very pleasantly decorated. It also has a small courtyard decorated with bamboo plants and seating. I would recommend this hotel for a short city break. Its conveniently located and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A real find....lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine from over the New Year period and have to say the stay was faultless. The staff were knowledgeable, helpful, polite and very friendly. One of the night managers went out of his way to help us arrange our new year celebrations - as strangers in the city, this was an huge help and resulted in us having a fantastic evening amongst Parisians enjoying the festivities, and a delicious meal at a nearby (non-tourist trap) bistro. Our room was very clean, well appointed and comfortable and had a fabulous power shower. Safes are provided free of charge in the rooms. Free internet access is provided at a laptop at the bar in the lobby and WiFi is provided free of charge to all guests with their own laptops â€“ canâ€™t argue with that! Breakfast was very good, the location to the Eiffel can not be beaten, and although Bir-Hakim Metro Station is closed at the moment, two other metro stations are a short stroll away â€“ one is directly on the route to the Eiffel Tower. In short we would not hesitate to come back and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good value, friendly, well-located traditional Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: giannispapakis
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience it was, staying at this awful hotel.. Stayed for just 4 nights, it couldn't have been worse. Firstly, to my great dissapointment, when i arrived i immediately found out that the metro station located exactly outside the hotel (Bir-Hakeim) was closed for renovation purposes. however, when i had made the booking and asked where is the nearest metro station, although they knew the station was closed, i was told it was less than 20m away..!! also, what was worse, is that when i returned back to the hotel after an exhausting day, i found out that my personal towel (the one i had brought from home) was hanged on this thing you use to brush the toilet!!! (awful!!!) i went downstairs and made a big issue, and the response i received was that the cleaning staff might had just hanged the towel on the wall, but probably it fell down!!! what is more, breakfast was really expensive (16euros), compared to what it offered.. only a small quantity of honey & marmelades, couldn't use more even if you wanted to... no bacon and/or ham available to make a sandwich.. one day they had ran out of croissants, juice, cereals, milk, e.t.c... When i told them, they just replaced the tray with the croissants, while leaving the rest as it was!! (also waited for 10-15minutes for my table to get cleaned) note: breakfast room is really small, only 6-7 tables available, so you have to wake up at 6.30 pm in order to get downstairs at 7.00pm when they start serving breakfast.. in addition, one day when i returned back to the hotel, i had found my door unlocked & open!!! conclusion: AWFUL experience.. stay AWAY from this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay very much!”
Reviews.Author: avanzonneveld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at this hotel, which is situated near the metro station and within a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is styled very nicely, the rooms are relatively large and the beds are fine! Breakfast is continental, but with a good choice of bread, cheeses, drinkes and yoghurts. The only thing that keeps us from a rating 'excellent' is that the ceiling of the bathroom was not clean. Everything else was very good. (just for comparison: we also stayed one night in a four star hotel near the Sacre Coeur, which was just as expensive, but with a low price/performance).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelerll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on November 16, 2007 for three nights and we enjoyed it very much. We highly recommend it. Although we arrived during the train strike and we had to walk from the Arc De Triomphe with our luggage to the Hotel, we were absolutely thrilled once we checked in. Upon check-in we were greeted very politely by the staff, who also spoke English. Our room was not a big room, but I must say that it was lovely and very clean. It was enough space for us to feel comfortable. Upon opening the window shutters we had the view of the patio below which was beautiful. The bathroom was small, but very clean and we had closed shower doors. The breakfast was fabulous. They offered had hard boiled eggs, sausage, toast, cold cereal, fruits, cheese, salami, crossiants, pastries, coffee, tea, juice etc. It was plentiful and we enjoyed the variety. The dining are was elegant and we felt like we were in a restaurant. The location of the hotel was especially ideal due to the train strike. We loved walking everywhere, which we felt was the best way to really see Paris. I would say appromiately the following: Eiffel Tower (10min), Musee De Lourve (35 minutes), Arc De Triomphe (20 min) . Accross from the Eiffel Tower is a working Carousel and you can purchase River boat cruises on the Seine accross as well. We recommend that you arrive early in the morning to purchase the Eiffel Towere Tour Tickets. The line can take hours, we arrived by 8:30am and already a small line was starting. Keep in mind that once the ticket is purchased it must be used that same day while waiting on line. The price to the top, if I recall correctly is about $14 Euro, but well worth it. The view from the Tower is amazing. There are snack stands,souvenir shops and restrooms located on levels 1 and 2. After arriving from sightseeing we came back to a very clean and lovely room. We are especially grateful to the Housekeeping Staff for their loyalty during the train strike because our room was maintained so well during this difficult time for them. A couple of other things we found helpful about the Hotel is free use of the laptop of the laptop located in the lobby. We were able to email family, get directions and information on many of the sightseeing places. They also offer a shuttle for a fee that will bring you back to airport for a fee. However, be sure to book this upon your arrival since it can get filled quickly. The hotel is located on De Grenelle street and it was convenient for us to find a place to eat. You can walk down this street and within 10-15 minutes you will find many restaurant choices. There is a small grocery store that you can buy water and bring back snacks. Overall, we again highly recommned this Hotel. They made our stay a memorable one and we are thankful for their friendliness towards us.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about this Hotel is it's Location.”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTraveller
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel from the reviews that I had read on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed with what we received. This was our first visit to Paris and this Hotel was a superb location for exploring all of the main attractions. As described it is very close to the Eiffel Tower which is no more than 10 minutes stroll just around the corner. It is directly opposite the Bir Hakkiem Metro Station (line 6) which at the time of our visit was as previously mentioned being refurbished (I believe it is due to re-open in the early spring of 2008 - either of the other 2 nearest metro stations are only 300-400 metres away). The Hotel is clean and well appointed. We had a Club Room which was adequate for our stay but may be considered small by other visitors (pay a bit more for a larger room if you are bothered). An early start is advised since breakfast can be congested in a somewhat small breakfast room. Food selection was adequate but not extensive (no cold meats). My only negative point was that we had the room directly over the entrance (room no. 105) which can be noisy of you are a light sleeper. Overall we would definitely recommend the Hotel, its location makes it perfect to see all of Paris. Accomodation is just right since you will be spending all of your time walking around Paris and not locked up in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great VFM friendly, well located hoetl”
Reviews.Author: eddie002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 300 yards from the Eiffel Tower, on the banks of the Seine, with one Metro literally across the road and one about 50 yards away. Although located on a relatively busy road, with refurbishment works at the Metro in progress, from the 4th floor the room was absolutely peaceful. There is free Wifi in all the rooms, which are neat, relatively small but well appointed. There is limited storage space in the standard rooms, which is fine for a weekend, but might cause problems for a longer stay, in which case a larger room would make sense. The shower was lovely and the towels changed every morning. The staff were courteous throughout our stay and always willing to give advice or help. We opted for the buffet breakfast which was a good mix of french pastries, cereal, yoghurts, fruit salad, hard boiled eggs. All of which set us up well for the day. Overall, for the price, the service was 5 star. The building itself 3 star, but overall an excellent value choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KMFS16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and it was lovely. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the top floor with a view of the Seine. Very convenient for the Eiffel Tower which is at most a 5 minute walk around the corner. The metro station opposite was closed but there were 2 other stations again within 5 minutes walk (one at the tower and one over the bridge) so no inconvenience was caused. We had been told that French hotel rooms can be on the small side but the room was of a very fair size and the bathroom was lovely and all was very clean. The only downside was that there was not a bottle opener in the room to open the wine in the minibar! Breakfast was pastries and croissants which were delicious :-). The location of the hotel was good for getting to see everything. A 20 minute tube ride would get us to Notre Dame. We even walked back one evening along the Seine which took about 1hr 15 but it was worth it as seeing everything lit up was good. Should we return to Paris again - which I hope we will, we would certainly look at using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: joandgraham
Reviews.Content: Not sure how much closer to the Eiffel Tower you could be!!! Location not so good for rest of the sites but we were happy with it. Would have been helpful to know the metro stop opposite was out of action due to modernistaion works. Hotel fine- staff great and helpful. Our room was across the patio and we thought it was lovely...execept that the bathroom door was glass so the light being turned on at night woke up whoever was still asleep. Breakfast is fine if included but expensive as an extra. Service a bit slow - we'd use the good cafe next door if not included. We'd definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to say...”
Reviews.Author: CrazyAngi
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews we had read and as it is only a short walk away from the Eiffle tower. The main attraction we wanted to see. However, on arrival the hotel wasn't as close as we thought, compared to maps we were given, and the rooms were a little on the tiny side. We stayed a totel of 4 days, 3 nights with breakfast only. So no where to put our own food. Had to use the window ledge. The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, and have a proper door - can see through it. There was mould on the ceiling and walls and hairs in the shower base on arrival - so not ours!!! Not much choice for the breakfast, with same choices every day, could have changed the menu a bit. Although, we didn't say it the hotel much as there is pently of things to do around the hotel. So good ideal place for sight seeing. Building works across the street on the metro that we couldn't actually use - another disadvantage as we booked because of the ideal metro link as well. This was not mentioned when booking or on the website. Which it should have been. Over than that. A nice little stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, modern hotel with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: JSB22
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Seine, and the restaurant next to the hotel is also a great place to eat. Lovely buffet breakfast with friendly service. Rooms were modern and clean, although a little small - still above adequate for a brief city break.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: issywhite
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Well decorated with a few quirky details. Rooms were small but very well appointed and extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were fantastic offering really useful help and advise of where to go and how to get there (metro strike!!) 30 seconds walk from the river and 3 minutes from the tower although didn't seem that we were in a tourist trap. A couple of reasonable restaurants in the area. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during the strike”
Reviews.Author: Ian1964
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, the rooms was small but clean and the help we got and advice was second to none. The reception was very polite but the drinks at the bar a little expensive, would I stay again yes I would just not when a strike is on.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrixtonBoys
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated for all the sights, with warm and friendly staff. Very helpful, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: aludd
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Small rooms, but typical for Paris. Good location just a couple of minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and lots of OK restaurants. Not a lot of high-end food or shopping in the immediate area, but the close location to both the metro and the RER made it extremely convenient to get anywhere in Paris. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast didn't offer a lot of options beyond rolls, packaged cheese, and cereal. Rooms were clean. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vjtp2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eiffel Seine is a fantastic hotel in a very central location - about 2 min's walk from Eiffel Tower and next door to two good restaurants which were fairly priced. The reception desk was manned 24 hours by staff who spoke fluent english. The bedrooms were very nicely decorated, and the bathroom was fully equiped. The breakfast room in the cellar was lovely, and the breakfast itself was a buffet style. The small bar area by the reception was a great place to have a drink before or after a night out. We would most definately stay here again, and have told all our friends and family about the it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go Wrong with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prep22
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to RER and subway station Bir-Hakeim. 5 minutes from the Eiffel. The staff were superlative and speak fluent English. The beds were comfortable and the rooms spacious enough given we were in the heart of Paris. We had our daughter with us so we needed an extra bed. Did not create too much of a space issue. Our window opened to a courtyard and it appears apartments were right across the way. Never ate breakfast there as I thought the prices were a little too much. Small elevator, and narrow stairs to the different floors. Nice little courtyard but since the rooms and apartments are right on top of you, you can't really stay there too long at night because of the sound and no lights are used it appears at night. In any event, small negatives as this Hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cashgreece
Reviews.Content: We researched many hotels by way of Tripadvisor. We found the Hotel to be: 1. Very clean. 2. Polite staff. 3. Nice breakfast spread. 4. Good location. 5. Recently renovated. 6. Room size and bathroom accomidating. The rooms are not tiny, they are sufficent considering a downtown Paris location. 7. Good value for price. The Paris transit workers were on strike during our stay. However, we were still able to walk to all tourist sights and museums. The walk was a pleasure as we got to experience Paris. Once again, the Hotel is within walking diatance of all sights as long as you are in decent physical condition and enjoy a stroll. Strongly consider buying Rick Steve's Guide to Paris strictly for the insight on sightseeing. You can make your plans for accomidations and dining, but the book offers resourceful info with respect to the City of Paris and sights. The Eiffel Siene was certainly a good value and we had no issues or complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Excellent sevice”
Reviews.Author: rich12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eiffel Seine hotel on the night of the rugby world cup. The hotel was fantastic and the service from the staff 1st rate. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay in stylish surroundings in the centre of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back to this hotel, loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: MissDaisyVancouver
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel, the staff were wonderful and the breakfast in the morning that came with our reservation was filling and tasty. I had an emergency phone call from Home and the front desk clerk gave me their portable phone and she let me take the call from the breakfast area all the way to my room and then back to her, yes we were paying for the call but having someone care so much for our well being was comforting. The Hotel is close too so many attractions, but watch for the gypsies and always check your surroundings basically be aware and you will have a wonderful time. If you want to enjoy the Eiffel Tower have dinner there but don't do the package of the river cruise and the dinner at the tower as it will cost you less to do this on your own. You can book from your home before you leave to have dinner at the tower but request a window seat when you reserve or the chance of getting one is minimal. We only realized this after it was all done, but for the cost it was still an amazing treat and the food at the tower is beyond belief. Weather was wonderful, we ate outside and enjoyed the views and great people watching. See you soon paris we will be returning again but for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean comfy hotel in touristy area”
Reviews.Author: estorilphil
Reviews.Content: My 3rd time to Paris. Would have preferred to stay in the 5e or 6e arrondisment but couldn't find suitable triple vacancy (3 in our party) that fall within my budget. This hotel actually was exactly what I expected. It was clean, comfy (our room faced away from Grenelle which was busy). The staff was very helpful and quite very fluent in English. Very close to the Eiffel Tower and metro (#6 RIGHT across the hotel). Walking distance to FranPrix (super mkt). There were restaurants nearby, but the kinds that cater to the English speaking tourists, also priced accordingly. Not having abundant Parisian local eatery nearby was my only gripe (that was why I wanted to stay in 6e initially). Free internet in the lobby, but it's accessible thru the only one notebook so you may have to wait to use it. Btw, the English keyboard "pattern" is built in, remember to turn it on. Free wifi if you've got a notebook with you. Safe area, though a bit touristy. Which is not necessarily bad I guess. No parking on premise if you've got a car with you. To put it in perspective, we were there from Oct 5 - Oct 11 in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of perfection”
Reviews.Author: G7778
Reviews.Content: I brought my mum to Paris last week and after researching Paris hotels I eventually chose Hotel Eiffel Seine and what a choice. 5 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower, a lovely clean hotel, superb staff that will literally be able to help with any queries or info about Paris. The room was a twin room and a lot bigger than I expected after hearing about tiny rooms in Paris. Our shower was huge and the bathroom was really nice - very new. We didn't have breakfast any morning but there is a supermarket 3 mins walk from the hotel (turn right as you come out). Also there are 2 lovely restaurants near by - Iolanda Italian restaurant is 3 doors up and Villa de Coloniale is under 5 mins walk (again turn left for Villa). The metro is outside the door - seriously and the RER is 2 mins walk so everywhere is only a short journey away. I really hope to return to Paris as it's an amazing city and when I do I will be staying at Hotel Eiffel Seine for certain. Bonne chance! (One thing - bring a travel kettle & iron as they are not supplied)

Reviews.Title: “Made my weekend even more special.”
Reviews.Author: Padster_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply wonderful. The staff were exceptionally friendly and offered little insider Parisian tips for example the cheapest secure parking vs the closest secure parking and other helpful tips. The room was quite small but very elegant and comfortable. The hotel was immaculate at all times and the receptionists all incredibly helpful with fantastic English. The biggest test is if you would stay there again and I undoubtedly will. Charming little hotel really close to le Tour Eiffel and the Seine river. There's a fantastic little Italian restaurant two doors down too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: runnrgrl232
Reviews.Content: I passed by the Eiffel Seine on the street and needed a room so stopped in and got a great deal for the night. It is a charming, quaint, chic and fun hotel in a great location. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. Can't wait to stay here again - would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend a stay at Hotel Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: sandyquay
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine and were very surprised by its charm, cleanliness and proximity to everything. We were within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and trains accessible right across the street. We did not use the trains but managed to get around Paris easily by river boat and tour bus stop was about 2 blocks away. Restaurants in the area were ok, there was a grocer down the street that we used for fresh fruit and water between meals. Price was 180 Euro per night and worth it. Very clean, very nice staff and would stay there again. It would have been nice if they had their own bus transport to the train stations and/or the airport. The taxi fee was about 18 Euro from Gard du Nord and Paris Mont train stations for 3-4 people with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LauraR4
Reviews.Content: We were in France for the Rugby World Cup when Ireland where playing against France and this hotel was fantastic! You couldn't stay any closer to the Eiffel Tower and the train station is also very close. The room was lovely and the staff very helpful in giving us directions to the stadium. We would definitely reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “GReat location!”
Reviews.Author: sewaqe
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, the breakfast in the breakfast room terrific, and we just kind of settled in and felt at home after the first day. Was it as charming as we had hoped, no. But the staff were all wonderful, it was clean, the location was perfect for doing any and everything you could possibly want to do in Paris. Would I stay there again. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Beautiful People Serving You”
Reviews.Author: divagirl57
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Paris, France for the first time and stayed from September 14th through September 20th. When we arrived at Eiffel Seine the hotel looked just like the pictures we saw on the web-site and the pictures people took. What I loved about this hotel is the staff is EXCELLENT! They will make sure you have any information you need to get around Paris, France. As in Paris, France the rooms are small but the longer you stay there you get used to the size. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Eiffel Tower so you can see how it looks during the day and then go back at night to see how beautiful the lights are on the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood is safe and people do not bother you at all. Two to three doors down from the hotel is a souvenir shop with good deals and the prices are GREAT to buy things to take back home. There are grocerie stores and bakeries close by. About five blocks up the street is a McDonald. There is a Tour-Bus you can caught in front of the Eiffel Tower that will take you to the main spots in Paris. You can paid for one day or two days tour and you can hop off and get back on all day. With this Tour-Bus the great thing is you can't get lost because the Tour-Bus comes right back to the Eiffel Tower down the street from your hotel. My daughter and I LOVED this hotel and would recommend it to anyone staying in Paris, France for the first time. We would stay there again in a heart-beat when we return to Paris, France one day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Paris hotel and close in to Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: Littelake
Reviews.Content: I researched Paris hotels near the Eiffel before booking because friends were staying in the area at an American hotel. I selected this hotel based upon the internet data and reviews. Being a long ways from Paris in the US you are always a little concerned about getting it right. After staying there, the first week of September, I can say that the reviews were all correct, this is a very nice hotel and the staff is excellent. We did not want an American style hotel and wanted a smaller Paris hotel and this is it. The location is opposite the metro station and very close to the Eiffel tower. Some people want American style hotels with big rooms and great views and we wanted a smaller Parisian style hotel with nice clean rooms, great staff and to get to the places of interest. This is it. The bed and the bathroom were nice and the airconditioning and heating were very good, I wouldn't hesitate staying in the Eiffel Seine again when returning to Paris, which we will. By the way, we never had anything but a simply great experience during our week in Paris. The city was great to see and walk in. It is simply a beautiful city in so many ways. All of the people that we came in contact with were simply terrific to us. We ate on the sidewalks of the local french pastry and coffee shops and bistros and loved every minute of the vacation. I believe it was the people who were just so great to us even in parts of the city where we were the only tourists. Every experience with the french people was just so great and the food was so good. I could eat my delectable ham sandwich, break bread and sip the wine while listening to the french people speaking on their way to work and play and love every minute of it. It was a great vacation and Paris and its people were at the heart of all of it. If you haven't been, GO, if you have been, go again. Very nice hotel and a great Paris experience. Everybody was just so great to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris! -- this is a must read!”
Reviews.Author: emk98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay in Paris at the Eiffel Seine. If I had to pick a best feature, it would be the staff. We don't speak much French, and it was so nice to have a front desk staff who were happy to communicate with us in English. They made restaurant reservations for us and booked a shuttle back to the airport too. We appreciated them so much. The hotel was spotless and decorated so wonderfully. Rest assured, I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Great location near the metro, which made it so easy to get around. We were steps away from the Seine and the Eiffel Tower, which made it easy to take a nighttime romantic walk. These things should not deter you at all from staying at the hotel, but are things visitors should expect: *Very (very) small room. I believe ours (202) was one of the smallest according to the hotel map on the back of the hotel door. Barely enough room to walk around the bed (but who comes to Paris to stay in their room anyway?) Very comfortable bed. *Bathroom was clean and lovely. Shower had great pressure and drains worked well. Beware that there is no shower curtain (just a glass swinging door sheltering half of the shower), so shower carefully or risk soaking the bathroom floor! *The Eiffel Seine is in a "commercial" district, which means there are cafes and restaurants nearby, but they're not nearly as authentic as those you'll find in the St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Of A hotel”
Reviews.Author: gherron777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the superior room for our long weekend. The room was a good size, very clean, nicely decorated and the bathroom was great two. View wasnt great but hey when your in Paris you go outside to see the views. The staff at the front desk where tremendously helpful. Location is great for exploring the city 5 mins walk to the Eifel Tower 20 mins to the Champs Eyleyses, or if you dont like walking the metro station is just accross the road. Having the metro so close was great when getting from and two the CDG airport. Will definitley consider this hotel again next time I come to see Ireland get beat, if I still cant afford the George V or the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: scubagator
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Hotel Eiffel Seine. What a great hotel. The front desk personnel just couldn't do enough to assist us and always did so with a smile and a kind word. Our room was gigantic by european standards and, while the road in front of the hotel is quite busy, the soundproofing in the hotel is excellent. Their lobby area and their patio area are respites of peace and quite in a busy bustling city. You couldn't ask for a better location. The Bir-Hakim metro stop is literally across the street, the Champs-d'Mars RER train stop is less than 100 yards away (this is the train that aso runs to Versailles). The eiffel tower is less than 10 minutes away and there is a little grocery just about 2 blocks away. We very much enjoyed the take-away ham, cheese, and egg crepes from the restaurant that is immediately next door if you want a change of pace from the hotel breakfast. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Paris. You will not get a nicer hotel for a better value, of that I am certain!

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BellaFella82
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel, nice style. Our room was a nice size, especially for a hotel in Europe. You can see the room size in a photo I posted. We were in room 107, one of their larger rooms. The rooms with the 3,4 and 5 at the end are the rooms that face the street, the others face the back of other buildings. Which is good if you want a quite room. One thing that the hotel boasts on is being so close to the Eiffel Tower, which is true, BUT they say it is only a 2 minute walk away. This is impossible! I am a very fast walker and it took me about 7-10 minutes to walk to the Eiffel tower. The breakfast is average, I suggest instead of getting it included in your room, to just go out for breakfast, it would be cheaper and a much bigger selection.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, well positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinCox
Reviews.Content: During our four nights stay we were able to get to all of the major attractions from this well placed hotel. Staff are very helpful, breakfast is simple but good, the public areas are tastefully decorated in Art Deco style (as was our room). The room was small, but the bathroom was a reasonable size. There are lots of places to eat at within the immediate vicinity. There are two Metro stations within a two minute walk and the Batobus (essential for first time visitors) is a five minute walk. We would definitely use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, simple but First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalachyByrne
Reviews.Content: Did a fair amount of research before booking this hotel and glad I did! It really is difficult to fault - spotlesly clean, staff very helpful, breakfast simple but efficient and tasty, prime location opposite the metro station/very close to the eiffel tower. I wouldn't hesitate staying in the eiffel Seine again when returning to Paris. The standard rooms are fairly small but who cares - you don't go to Paris to stay in a hotel room! By the way if you like Italian food I'd recommend Pa Pa Pasta, 100 yards from the hotel. First class food and very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but where is the kettle ?”
Reviews.Author: Kiarainn
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel, small but adequate rooms, our shower room was clean and modern. The location is perfect, walking distance to everything you need for a short stay in Paris. (Use the Bateaux bus for transport). We missed having a kettle in the room, just to make a cup of something, not sure if this is the norm in France, but its a pain, so the hotel only gets a 4. ! Otherwise it met our expectations, the internet in the room is a great feature and is fast becoming a must. Paris was great, I love the place. !

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amathus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our parentâ€™s 40th wedding anniversary. We found the hotel to be clean and fresh looking. We arrived at the hotel at 12noon but were able to check into one room immediately and the others were available within the hour. Check in was quick and the staff were extremely helpful with our arrangements. We have stayed in 5 star hotels and found the attentiveness of the staff and their helpful attitude to be on par with that. As stated in previous reviews, the rooms are on the small side although having never stayed in Paris before I couldnâ€™t say if this was the norm or if these were particularly small. They were however very clean, the bathroom was modern and was adequate for our weekend break. Having said this, should we have been staying there for a number of days I think we would have found it a bit claustrophic. The beds though were the most comfortable ones we have ever slept in and found it hard to get out in the morning. Breakfast was the usual continental but there was plenty of choice from cereals, toast, yoghurts, rolls and pastries, cheese, preserves and fresh orange, tea and coffee. The location was perfect for us as my dad has mobility difficulties. There are a number of cafÃ©â€™s next door for sacks and drinks. The metro is over the road, the river Seine across the road with boats for the trips down the river, and a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower and the bus stop for the open top bus tours. We did extensive research into the restaurants for our celebration meal and found ourselves at Chez FranÃ§oise, which is at the Air France building at Invalides. It was the perfect place for my parentâ€™s big anniversary and we all had a fantastic evening. Highly recommended for a special event. Overall we found the Eiffel Seine to be the perfect place to stay for our weekend and would not hesitate to return there if we were spending another short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleaant Experience”
Reviews.Author: tides1234
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel's location to public transportation (Metro & RER) and Parisâ€™ attractions to be wonderful. The neighborhood is safe and pleasant; there were nice and convenient restaurants for dining, and shops for sundries. The hotel staff and services were very helpful and available. The convenience to the Internet, via computer notebook on the bar counter, was very nice. The lobby elevator was very small but served itâ€™s propose. Our guest room (506) was clean and well maintained by both the housekeeping and maintenance staffs. The room was incredibly small and somewhat discouraging to want to spend time relaxing in it, when we desired to take a break from touring about, though. Also, you could clearly hear guests conversing normally in the other rooms that surrounded ours, as well as, when people were in the guest corridor. However, the bed and bathroom were comfortable, room lighting was good for reading, mini-bar / refrigerator was handy, and we slept very well each of our four nights there. The continental breakfast was good and met our needs and expectations. We felt our rate was okay under these typical big city circumstances, and as a comparison to New York City or London, it was good. We would consider staying at this property again. Thank you for a very nice stay. SIncerely, Bob & Diane

Reviews.Title: “Conviniant location & clean room”
Reviews.Author: Aquabeater
Reviews.Content: Near to RER-C & metro6 station. Easy to access the concord & Arc de Triomphe..Champs-Elysees.. Polite staff, clean room, nice shower bath.. I could use the free internet with my notebook computer.. But small room have an unsatisfactory feeling..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice and stilish hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikaro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice but the strongest point is the location. We didn't get a room with a view of the tour Eiffel, at least not directly, but it was reflected on the building (glass made) in front of us, so it was actully an indirect view but it was so nice anyway. Furnitures and amenities were pretty fine as well and pictures and paintigs all over the walls gave the place a touch of glamour and style. I'll always remember the stay because it was my first time in Paris, my first time in France, my first weekend with my woman and my first night with her.

Reviews.Title: “wondeful staff”
Reviews.Author: iMML
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a stonethrow away from the Metro and RER station and about 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are clean and functional. The staff is excellent and helped make our stay even more perfect. I have stayed in over 10 hotels in Paris but this would definately be one that I would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL CLOSE TO THE EIFFEL TOWER”
Reviews.Author: johnbarr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a lovely time at this small, convenient hotel. We almost burst out laughing when we saw how close it is to the Bir-Hakim metro station and the eiffel tower. Our room was a reasonable size (for Paris) and on the 6th floor with a balcony overlooking the Seine. The staff were very friendly (the night receptionist helping me to access the internet etc), the rooms and common areas were clean and the complimentary breakfast filled us up. All in all I would strongly recommend this superior 3 star hotel to anyone looking for a convnient location to see the city of Paris - John, Glasgow, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stuff,clean,and the location...!”
Reviews.Author: macc29
Reviews.Content: We searched for a nice but not expensive hotel for a long time. After having read these TripAdvisor reports, we decided to try hotel EiffelSeine, and I must say, you just can't get more for your money in Paris. Really. Underground is very near, the hotel is clean, staff is extremely friendly and nice, and everything worked. No noise from the street/metro, a good bed, room decoration is nice, and as it was said before, Eiffel tower and the river boats are near. There is also a free safety box in the room. We did not try the breakfast, so I can only say it is a bit pricey, 17 euros, unless caviar and champagne is included... A few days before the flight, we emailed the hotel to get the shuttle from airport to hotel, and it worked out very well. 17 euros/person. We took the shuttle also back to airport, it is somewhat chaeper than taxi. I also think it is safer, the shuttle is bigger than taxis...you should see the traffic on highways! I think that there are no errors in previous reports. For your money you get more than one would expect. Both my wife and I were very pleased indeed. It is not a five star hotel, but if you go to Paris to see Paris and not a hotel room, we really think you get everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: anlou1952
Reviews.Content: my partner and myself stayed here for 2 days.the hotel is very central a short walk from the eiffel tower.we found it to be very clean,and the room although a little small was very nice and comfortable. the staff were very helpful,able to suggest good restaurants and to get around make sure you take the green line open topped bus! superb...and you can hop on and off when you please.it cost 29 euros for 2 days and was very good value,as you can listen to a personal audio that talks you through all the major attractions in paris.the breakfast in the hotel was excellent,all very fresh.delicious fresh fruit and piping hot coffeebesides the usual croissants etc.top tip....ask for a room with a view.we were on the top floor.had a balcony and an excellent view of the seine. very impressed and would definately stay here again.great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tricia_Addlestone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eiffel Seine over the Bank Holiday weekend with some friends. The hotel is very nicely decorated and we were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist who took care of our luggage as we had arrived early and our rooms were not ready. There are restaurants and cafes close by and the Eiffel Tower is only a few minutes walk away. Having stayed in Paris on several occasions previously we were very pleasantly suprised by our room. We booked a club room which was a very good size compared to others we have had in Paris. Our room was on the 6th floor at the front of the building. We had a small balcony and could see the Seine - we could also see the Metro but this was no problem at all. There was air conditioning in the room and the double glazed windows took away any noise from outside, although it really wasn't very noisy at all. The rooms were extremely clean and furnished to a high standard. The bed was huge, very comfortable and the bedding was of an excellent quality cotton. We had a lovely bathroom with a double shower and the towels were thick and fluffy and plenty of them. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we thought that 16 Euros was a bit pricey, although this may be unfair as we did not see exactly what was on offer and this was just our personal choice. The hotel had a laptop in the reception area for use by its guests free of charge, which we found very useful for our on-line check in for our return flights. We booked the hotel through Venere.com who we have used on several occasions. They make no charge for booking and you pay the hotel direct. We have also found them to be cheaper than booking direct with the hotel. We really enjoyed our weekend in Paris and the Hotel was excellent. We will definitely return and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FerdinandBoston
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Family room was a double and a twin across from each other with a door in the hallway to shut them off from the rest of the hotel. (Bring doorstops if you want to keep the connecting doors open.) The front desk and cleaning staff was very courteous and helpful, with excellent English. Comfortable rooms and beds. Very clean and quiet. Nice mix of American and European clientelle. Elevated metro in front of hotel was convenient and surprisingly quiet, although police sirens were very common (as everywhere in Paris.) They could not be heard in the courtyard room. Tiny but convenient elevator, didn't work on the day we checked in and we had to bring our own bags up 5 flights, but worked well later in the day and for the rest of visit. Nice bar in lobby. Very short walk to restaurants, grocery store, ATM. 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower and river boats. 30 minutes by metro to anywhere in Paris. I felt very safe in the neighborhood and for the most part welcome by businesses. They like smaller currency notes. This is not really a tourist area, although they are quite close. 17 Euro taxi from Gare Nord. Refrigerator (minibar with snacks), safe, TV in each room. Double room with see-through bathroom door. Bathrooms good size for Europe. AC in rooms. Key operates lights and AC. Windows open wide, so watch children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jb1Winnpieg
Reviews.Content: The staff are unbelievably sweet and helpful! The room was small, and a bit 1980's, but the hotel is perfectly located, and has so much charm and warmth - it's lovely, after experiencing the coolness of many locals!

Reviews.Title: “Great and convinient”
Reviews.Author: Jetset87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights and it was perfect. The room was a very good size for paris and the staff were really helpful. Our room was facing the street which is right across from the metro station. To our surprise you cant hear the metro pass by with the wondow closed so it wasnt a problem at night and it just made the location more convenient. There are good restaurants nearby and it is a short walk (5-10 min) to the Eiffel tower. I can't think of anything that was bad about the hotel! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: cazisue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night but it was more than adequate for our short stay. The check in was quick, efficient and friendly and although we arrived at the hotel at 12.00 (check in time is 14.00), the room was ready and cleaned so we could go straight to the room. The room was small but no smaller than any other Parisian hotels we had stayed in previously. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom clean with powerful shower and big fluffy towels. Hairdryer was also a bonus! The only downside to this hotel was that although conveniently close (about 10 min walk) to Eiffel tower, our view from bedroom window of the Bir Hakkeim metro station meant we had to close the curtains at all times as people could see into our room if going up the metro steps!! We did however have a standard double room so I don't know if they have deluxe rooms which would have a better view, On the whole if you are looking for a hotel to stay in for a night or 2 I would highly recommend this hotel for it's cleanliness, decor and rather generous breakfast (toast, cereal, bread rolls, croissants, cheeses, jams, yogurts, coffee, tea, juice) which was very filling!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location, right next to 2 metro/train stops that will get you to most places you need to go. The hotel is clean and quite unique in the art nouveau style. The rooms are quite small but up to date with lcd tv's, a new clean bathroom with good shower. Security is good. You get wifi for free in the hotel. The staff are helpful if you need them. The breakfast is simple continental with good variety and enough there to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “What a great service in this cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to Paris for a weekend in July. We live in Amsterdam and took a plane to Paris. Then we took a subway, line B from Charles des Gaulles, downtown. There we transferred on line 6 to Etoille. We get off the subway on Bir-Hakeim. This stop is next to the Eiffel tower and our hotel was just across the street. From this stop you can take the subway to get almost everywhere in downtown Paris in about 10 minutes. The hotel looked great. It was a very friendly welcome because of the nice staff. Everything looked very modern but with a romantic touch. We got up in a very small elevator and arrived in our room. It was nice, comfortable and most important, very clean. I would recommend the hotel to everyone. It's a great, 'affordable' place to stay in a very nice neighborhood near the Eiffel tower. The subway station is across the street so you can get everywhere in a short time. The staff is very helpful and friendly too. We asked one of the employees for a nice restaurant. He made us a reservation in a great place. It was just awesome. Great food, nice idyllic setting. So romantic, just what we wanted. Thanks for the great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Modernly Decorated, Great Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: peenali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a 3 week trip to Europe and Paris was one of our destinations. I booked this hotel solely based on reviews I read on Trip Advisor and glad I did!! The hotel is a small boutique style hotel and the rooms are small, but what hotel in Europe doesn't have small rooms. They were very clean and everything from the lobby to the rooms/bathrooms were very modernly decorated which is usually what I like in room decor. The elevator however pretty much only fits one person plus luggage. Otherewise though, the location couldn't be more perfect, its a 3-5 minute walk to the eiffel tower and the Bir Hakeim number 6 metro line is directly across the street and this line will get you to where ever you need to go. Only about 6-8 minutes on this line to Champs Elysees .The RER line is across the street on the other side as well which is only a 25 minute ride to Versailles and can also be taken to areas near Notre Dame. You can walk to the Beatueax Mouches boat pier in about 15-20 minutes. The night manager was also very helpful in getting us our taxi at such an odd hour in the morning for our departure. There is a little French cafe/restaurant and a small pizza place and chinese place next to the hotel, though restaurants are otherwise lacking in this area. Overall, an excellent deal for the price that you pay, compared to the cost of other parisian hotels. If you're on a budget and time restraints and are looking for a great place to stay with a good location to get around easily, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “My wife made an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: NJJEBarber
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through an agent but my wife did the research on the hotel (through this site, and others) and she made an excellent choice. Across the street from the metro, a few blocks from the Eiffel Tour, a fairly busy area so there are lots of restaurants and quite a few shops nearby. We were away from home for a month and had to do laundry each week but the prices for sending it out for a family of 4 were prohibitive so we used a launderette a few blocks away (about 6 blocks). The metro across the street is scheduled to be renovated through some months over the winter this year but the next closest metro stop (Dupleix) is only 3 blocks down the street. The showers are excellent (as noted by another reviewer) but the hot water in the shower in room 102 (our kids' room) has very little pressure -- ours (room 205) was great. The front desk staff were exceptional! I only know the name of one of them -- Jean Francois -- but there were also two young women covering the daytime and early evening and they were always helpful, polite, and patient (in spite of the many, many requests they were juggling). The hotel is much more modern inside than it looks from the outside. Yes, the rooms are a bit small but that's to be expected for this price in Paris and we didn't spend a lot of time there anyway. Knowing that the hotel was very good and there was always help available made some of the other challenges of Paris much easier to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Comfortable & Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aditieid
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent myself . This Hotel is rated 3-STAR and is an elegant, comfortable, very clean and extremely conveniently located modern hotel. The PRICE is very good and includes a good continental breakfast. The LOCATION is unbeatable-just opposite the Bir Hakeim Metro, 3-minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. The SERVICE is professional and courteous. The ROOMS are small but well-furnished with good beds and nice toilets and SOUND PROOF. VERY CLEAN. Good Airconditioning. This is NOT a luxury hotel, but a very comfortable, convenient , clean and pleasant tourist hotel. I would stay here again. We found a nice convenience store (to buy water/coke etc) a nice Chinese restaurant and a really good Lebanese Restaurant within 8-10minutes walk down the same road. Also a major shopping area with many fashion shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Chouchoutte
Reviews.Content: What a charming boutique hotel! My husband and I just got back from Paris, we stayed at the Eiffel Seine hotel and we will definitely stay there again! The location is simply awesome (just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower), the staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean (yes, on the smaller side but it's Paris!) and the price is great. The train station is just accross the hotel so it was easy to get around (the Champs Elysees really aren't that far either though). Also the hotel looks just like the pictures on the web site so you won't be dissapointed when you get there. Book your stay with no fear! A+++++ Helen, Boston MA

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to pack sneakers”
Reviews.Author: gb1967
Reviews.Content: We selected the Eiffel Seine because it is so close to the Eiffel Tower, which it is. But it is on the side of the Eiffel Tower away from most other attractions. We didn't take that into consideration when booking, but I wish we had. It added extra time on the metro or walking to our days in Paris. On the up side, it is right across the street from a metro stop. The hotel itself is lovely. Very clean. The rooms are small, as you'd expect in Paris. The bathroom in my room had a sliding door, like you'd normally find on a closet. That meant the door didn't latch or lock. It also was made with panels of lightly frosted glass. That meant it didn't provide much in the way of privacy. Given that the toilet is situated facing the door, it's a less than desireable set up. My brother's room next door had a regular door with a more expected level of privacy. The staff was very helpful. One afternoon our air conditioning went out and by the time we returned from dinner that night it had been repaired. The price was also very good. I'd stay again, but with a better pair of walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location. Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Lorse
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in Paris. When I go back, I will definitley stay here again. Just around the corner from the Eiffel tower and with a tube station opposite, this is a great place to explore the city from. The hotel is very modern with marble bathrooms and LCD TV's and although the rooms are a little small (like most hotels in Paris), they are fantastic and the staff very attentive. All in all, Great Staff, Great Location, Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly staff, clean - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Curb_Safe_Charmer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally right outside Bir Hakim metro station, yet we didn't suffer from noise. Checkin was painless. The room was small as is the case with most Parisian hotels. The room was very clean and comfortable with an excellent shower. Breakfast was good and we enjoyed the speciality teas. Good mini bar with reasonable prices. We didn't try the bar in the reception area - there are two restaurants next door that were excellent and reasonable value so we ate and drank there in the evenings. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and spoke very good English. We were able to leave our bags with them on checkout day until we left for the airport. The corridors are narrow and the little white bulbs that give the "night sky" affect in the ceiling are nice but leave the corridors a bit dim, so perhaps not the best choice if you happen to be claustrophobic. About 5 minutes walk from the Tour Eiffel (expect to queue for a good hour!) A great stay and we would certainly stay there again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: toletiquesbysam
Reviews.Content: We were soo looking forward to seeing this hotel, the website made it look wonderful and I really was hoping it would be......And it was!!!! We decided to take the metro from CDG to the hotel and the directions from their website were perfect, the Bir Hakem station is closed so that worried me a bit but when you get off the RER C you just follow the signs to Bir Hakem and then exit the station and to your right is the hotel! We checked in and didn't have to give them anything but our name and they gave us the key and up the lift we went, it's small but worked great! Our room was small of course by American size but the bed was great-King size and very comfortable, flat screen tv, fridge, modern bathroom with deep tub and shower. Our booking included bed & breakfast for 125euro p/night, and the breakfast was really good. They offered croissants and other pastries/breads, 2 cereals, fresh fruit mixture, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and more, it was very good and got us off to a great start each morning. The location could not have been better, very quick walk to the Seine and Eiffel Tower and we even walked to Notre Dame one day, but we also took the Metro to numerous other sites and that was easy to use as well! There are restaurants next to the hotel as well as down a few blocks/across street as well so it was very accomodating. Wonderful crepe place right on the corner and we'd order them from the restaurant attached to where he was making them, they were a highlight to each evening we returned from sightseeing. They had a small bar in the lobby and there was a laptop there for guest to use for free internet. I would highley recommend this property, it was a highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mihlkh
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel which lived up to all our expectations. The staff (Adriana, Sarah, and Frederique), could not have been more helpful. Sarah even confirmed our hotel return transfer as we could not understand French! Room was comfortable; bed, bathroom, and decor superb! Recommend to anyone wanting a good value, comfortable, hotel in a close locality to the Metro, River Seine, and Eiffel Tower. We both can't wait to get back to stay there again. Lyn and Malcolm H., from Sydney Australia.

Reviews.Title: “lovely for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBristol
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel very helpful and friendly staff. The room was small but lovely, decor and bathroom were fab. The location of the hotel is also excellent very close to the eiffel tower and a metro station, although most attractions are with in walking distance. very happy with our stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Simple, cool and fun”
Reviews.Author: mgbentour
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance spent 3 nights at the Hotel Eifel Seine. It a small querky boutigue hotel with friendly staff. Our room was v small ( get used to it in paris ) but had all we required and a bit more. Bathroom was spotless and well appointed - with a nice shower in addition to a deep bath. Bed was very comfortable - and the air conditioning was welcome even in June. Id skip the breakfast on offer and venture out to the nearby brasseries and bars - they all offer something. If you do nothing else make sure you go on an open top bus tour. Get a two day ticket and use the bus as a quasi taxi. Hop on hop off to your hearts content. Great value. We had debated staying in in the st germain district ( where for the record there are some great little hotels ) but we think that this hotel offers you easy access to EVERY district - metro stop outside the door, two taxi ranks within 2 min walk and the seine on your doorstop.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalTourist41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eiffel Seine for a week on business and I couldn't have been more pleased. My room was on the top floor facing Bd de Grenelle and I had the double door open to the balcony most of the weekend. Ah, Paris in the spring! The room was clean, always made up and well thought out given the space available. The free WiFi was a very useful feature for not only work but researching Paris before adventuring out. Both the room and breakfast buffet were 25% cheaper than the big name hotels around the corner. And I loved the art deco feel! Highly recommended by me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lucecanada
Reviews.Content: I will return for sure! It was a nice ,agreable hotel with a friendly staff. The room was small but it is typical for a Paris hotel room. It was very convenient to get to the hotel, by Metro or the local Paris train (RER) which connects the airport (Charles-de-Gaule) to central Paris, it took about 45 minutes to get there...but you have to familiarize yourself with the Paris metro-RER circuit before, otherwise for a tired unfamiliar tourist, it is a bit difficult to find your way, handling your suitcase in the METRO corridors.. The hotel staff took care of my return to the airport by booking a "navette", or shuttle from the hotel to the airport for my departure..I do not recommend taking a taxi...expensive! I was very satisfied with my accomodation...I choose not to take my breakfeast at the hotel...to expensive for the choice of food., but there is a cafe right next door, and plenty of bakeries around where you can get a croissant or a "pain au chocolat" and a coffee for cheaper. This hotel location is very convenient...the Eiffel Tower is 3-minutes walk but you do not feel that you are in a very "touristy" place. It is calm and quiet...you can ask for a "view to the Seine", but it is not worth it...Better get out of your room and walk directly the little "promenade" along the river...(By the way, it is where I took my best pictures of the Eiffel tower illuminated by flickering lights at night...Impressive!) Down the street there are a few ethnic restaurants (Thai, Morrocan, Japanese) , and a foodmarket, where you can get cheese, "charcuteries", salads, fruits and fresh "baguette" or croissants if you feel like a pic-nic. You can also get an international phone card at the "tabac", (small cigarette store). All in all I was very happy to stay at this hotel from May 2nd to 9 May. I got an internet- discount for an extended stay (more than 3 days). It is available on the hotel web-site. I have recommended this hotel to friends...Have a nice trip! Aurevoir !Luce (from Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: srg105
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Lovely rooms, excellent decor, friendly staff, good breakfast and BRILLIANT location! Definitely a MUST when staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - good place...”
Reviews.Author: hssp
Reviews.Content: Nice place - clean, very friendly staff and helpful with suggestions on what to do, how to get there etc. Room was very nice as well! right across the metro, and short walk from the eiffel. Didnt care much for the breakfast selection for the price, though...

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Charming Small Place with Overall Value!”
Reviews.Author: BellinaRaffy
Reviews.Content: I looked around at a number of hotels and was looking to find a room under 150Euros. Well... I did find this small, quaint little hotel for 125 Euros. The hotel was in a great location, right next to the Eiffel Tower yet what was real practical was that it was right in front of the subway/metro line and this made it super easy to hop on the train to get all over Paris- which by the way is an easy way to see lots of Paris. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and luckily our room was vacant. The agent was very kind and provided us with maps, brochues and guides as part of her checkin conversation. Loved that! We know that our room would be small and were prepared for this and it was... very tiny but so well decorated and modern that we really did not mind. Plus we barely were in the room- we were out and about in Paris! We had Room 409. The bed had very comfortable pillows and bedding- all white and crisp. The bathroom was brand new, modern and fresh and as mentioned in other reviews- the towels were large bath towels... loved them. Good blowdryer too. The room had a small flat screen TV, a small closet, safe, telephone and internet capabilities. What I really liked is that they offered you a 800 number to make international calls without incurring hotel fees yet via your own credit card. The lobby was a small one with a sitting area, small bar yet with a laptop where one could use the internet for free. Very kind. Our room rate did not include Breakfast so I cannot comment on this. For 125EURO which in Paris is a good deal... I was very happy and would return. The staff was very kind, helpful and the room (small) was fine for what we needed. I would happily go back! RST

Reviews.Title: “Sensation by the Seine”
Reviews.Author: TravelCynic
Reviews.Content: From the moment you leave Bir Hakeim Metro station and spot the classy looking Eiffel Seine opposite, literally steps away, you'll be delighted. The very friendly staff were welcoming and helpful. Then it's off to your room. Like many other boutique hotels in Europe it was via a broom closet sized elevator. But if you're claustrophobic (and fit) the stairs are right next to it. Once you're out of there, it's into the hallway, lit by a series of fairy lights in the ceiling that evoke the night sky, and another bunch of stronger halogen lamps that turn on as you approach. The rooms are not that big, but very tastefully furnished. Mine had a sideways view of the Seine, plus an excellent view of the Metro crossing the river into Bir Hakeim station. Trainspotters would love it. Fortunately the window is either double glazed, or the glass is thick enough to keep the street and Metro noise out at night. Another room I saw had a view into a courtyard. No street noise problems there. But there wasn't a need to keep the window open all the time as the rooms were air conditioned. A very pleasant surprise after coming from a four star London hotel with no obvious ventilation, let alone windows that open. After showering in the morning, another bonus... full sized bath towels! Not the usual sandpaper-like postage stamps you find in most hotels. The bathroom was well lit and clutter free. I only detected one broken tile. The breakfast room was well set up. Clean and well stocked. The price for breakfast is a little steep. But you can go in there and tell them you're only having a croissant and coffee. Okay, maybe a couple of croissants. And a pain-au-chocalat or two. They're delicious. Everyone's remarked on the location. It goes without saying that it's superb, both for getting around and its proximity to Paris's major tourist attraction. Just a couple of things would make the experience complete. One would be providing coffee and tea making facilities within the room. Going next door to the restaurant for a cafe creme isn't always practical. And perhaps a few more English language TV stations on the LCD television. But then again, one doesn't go to Paree to watch TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Montyblue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Seine for 5 days in May 2007 and found the entire experience delightful. We stayed in one of their ground floor suites which was tastefully decorated and much larger than we had expected. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful and although we came to Paris with a small vocabulary of French it was not needed, at least in the Hotel as all the staff spoke perfect English. The fantastic part about this Hotel is its location, right next to the Bir-Hakem(the Paris Metro underground). With our Paris pass in hand (which I recomend to everyone who stays more than a couple of days), the Bir-Hakem is your connection to almost every major tourist attraction in the Paris Metro area and is also linked to the Versailles train. Although the Hotel does not have it's own restaurant (it does have a breakfast room), the two restaurants right next door offer great food at very reasonable prices. There are so many great restaurants and cafe's all over Paris finding places to eat is easy. Also just down the road from the Hotel is a supermarket which sells everything including alcohol and takeaway hot nibblies. The most unforgetable part of our trip would be just wandering around in the warm spring sunshine through beautiful streets and stopping in some wonderful cafe's for coffee or a cold beer, and the balmy warm spring nights lend themselves to strolling the boulevards and avenues and outdoor dining. I can certainly recommend the Hotel Eiffel Seine for a truely unforgetable Paris vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Stars18
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel- It was in a great location, the staff were lovely and helpful. The breakfast was good too. Could not have asked for a better hotel for our first trip to Paris as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 day stay in this wonderful city. The location of the hotel was perfect as we travelled via Eurostar and the Metro station opposite the hotel took the hassel out of finding our accomodation. The service we recieved from the staff was excellent, the recommended restaurant - Le Soleil was divine. Very clean room, the only downside was a cracked toilet seat and the shower head was not great. There were fantastic cafe's and restaurants within walking distance, or taking the metro to other destinations was very easy. This was my first experience at booking a holiday on the internet and this sight with the candid photographs helped me beyond words.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: suzGlasgow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, comfortable and ideally located(right next to Bir Hakeim metro and 5 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower). The staff are really helpful and the buffet breakfast is good to set you off in the morning....all in all we had a pleasant stay in the Eiffel Seine and I would reccomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located!”
Reviews.Author: danawolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine in April of 2007, after reading a number of other reviews on this hotel. Having read some reviews we knew what to expect in terms of room size and general hotel atmosphere. The rooms were a bit small, but very clean and comfortable. We even had our 9 month old son with us and it was big enough for him to play in for short periods of time. The rooms had AC, which can be rare in Europe. The hotel atmosphere was great, again overall very small but tastefully decorated. The staff was also friendly, some more than others. The staff was always willing to help us find something or give suggestions. Breakfast was not included in our price, but we ended up paying for it. The price for the breakfast was a bit high, 15 Euros, but with a baby we didn't want to run around trying to find a restaurant or cafe for breakfast. The croissants were absolutely delicious, nearly worth the price of admission. As for location, the hotel was conveniently located near the RER and the Metro, which made it super easy going to see things. The best thing was a short 5 minute walk, along the river is one choses, to the Eiffel Tower. For our first stay in Paris, we were absolutely satisfied with our stay at the Eiffel Seine Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: wpam
Reviews.Content: Close to the Tower; close to the metro station, nice and clean but very small room, if you want breakfast take it somewhere outside the hotel - it's cheaper, U won't find fine view outside any of the hotel window, but frankly speaking it was ok to spend a couple of days in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: MaximilianXie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Everyone is so polite so well mannered. The area it is located, is an fascinating place, especially at night. The hotel is right in front of a tube station, which makes the transport so much more convenient. Rooms are nicely scented, well arranged and beautifully decorated. I highly recommend you this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large for Paris, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Gustofers_travels
Reviews.Content: Good hotel that I often use for business. It is a decent price and the rooms are quite large for Paris. Staff are always helpful. The breakfast is a bit light on so I usually go elsewhere (next door is good). It is opposite a metro so is convenient. Very clean. You have to go to the basement to iron anything.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: ftnyu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the beds and bathrooms were great. We booked the triple room for only 2 people which would be exceptionally tight if there had of been 3 of us! The staff are friendly and helpful. For the girls however there are no power points near a mirror!! And no jug to make a cup of tea in the morning is a bit difficult for us caffeine addicts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bluedormouse
Reviews.Content: We'd agree with all the postive comments below. The location is excellent and staff very helpful. Our room was very quiet and clean; bed was extremely comfortable - beautiful decor overall. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Zero rating: should not be anywhere near the top 100 Paris hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Fr0mL0nd0n
Reviews.Content: Booked Easter break 3 months in advance, after a lot of research, but on arrival found out that there was "a problem with hotel's reservations system and some old bookings were lost" (including mine) so we are staying at Seine's sister hotel Lenox instead. I tried to question why it is a customer who booked 3 months in advance (i.e. me) that has to be turned away instead of one of those who booked at the last minute, but was not given an answer to that, just the already mentioned "the hotel is full". Apparently they had tried to contact me beforehand but to no avail - and I am glad they did not as there was nothing that could have been done anyway. Granted, Seine's staff promised 3 nights for the price of 2 at the Lenox but only when I clearly showed how unhappy I was and directly asked how they plan to compensate me and my daughter who was travelling with me. Luckily Lenox turned out to be a nice place and I will be leaving a separate feedback for them, but at the same time it is an absolute zero rating for Seine - would not risk booking it ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: snowdogmatt
Reviews.Content: Best overall hotel of our 3 city trip to Europe. Good balance of value and class. Good location near tower, and convenient to several restaurants and two metro stops. Staff was friendly and helpful, and everything was well kept and clean. Room was a bit on the small, side, but exactly what I'd expect in center of city at this price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: neill57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Seine Hotel for two nights. I was travelling with my two sons aged 21 and 15, and had booked a triple room. I phoned before booking to check that there were three proper single beds and was told that there were. When we got into our room we found two single beds and a sofa bed made up. My 15year old opted for this bed and was fine, but it certainly wouldn't have been suitable for someone taller than 5ft 7 in. The air conditioning wasnt switched on and the room did get warm during the night, when I asked about this in the morning they said that the air conditioning hadn't been switched on for the summer yet.The next night we left the window open and were fine. All in all we enjoyed our stay. The room was small but we were hardly in it, the beds were very comfortable , with lovely clean sheets. The staff we met were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is very nice, reasonably priced, and is in a really good location, with the metro station just across the road. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place......”
Reviews.Author: mozzeb
Reviews.Content: Booked over the internet very easily and everything went as planned. Location of the property to the biggest attractions as well as the underground station right infront of the hotel was an added benefit. Additionally, the train to Versailles can also be boarded on the otherside of the street. The hotel itself was recently rennovated and was in excellent condition. The staff performed well without the arrogance one oftens hears from the French. Breakfast was simple and complete. Rooms were in great condition and the lobby was welcoming. Bathroom showers could use a shower curtain. If they didnt charge so much for a beer at the little bar they had in the lobby it would probably be used a bit more. Overall though, two thumbs up on this property. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, cute and unique.”
Reviews.Author: Dearjilly
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Hop on the BirHakeim metro, right across the street, to take you anywhere in the city or the Champs de Mars metro for a day at Versailles. Rooms are clean. It was my forth hotel experience in Paris and it was, by far, the best. Free continental breakfast, always a plus. The only cons would be: No great views from the hotel and because of the location, its a little loud if your room faces the road. Friendly staff. Unique decor. Rooms: a good size for Europe. Jill Canadian

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Eiffel Seine”
Reviews.Author: Lemmiwinks
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a three night stay at the Eiffel Seine Hotel. First impressions were of a very nicely decorated and well maintained hotel, the room was spotlessly clean and comfortable although on the small side was more than adequate for a short stay. The hotel offers a continental breakfast which was always nice and the dining area is also very clean and well maintained. The Eiffel Seine is also very well located being literally across the road from the nearest metro station, the Eiffel Tower is also a few hundred metres away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody planning a break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: HannahTLeeds
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good little hotel. Nice clean rooms if rather tiny. Not recommended for couples who haven't been together long as the bathrooms are almost within the bedroom and have frosted glass doors - you will be acutely aware of each other's toilet habits! Very nice decor and lovely big beds with white bedlinen - not chintzy at all. Only downsides - no hot water for two days running- which was fairly terrible. Fantastic location, just next to the seine and round the corner from the Eiffel tower.
