Yes, you are opposite the metro stop, but we rather liked seeing it roar in and out (it's raised up above the street so is sort of on a level outside the windows - however they had lovely net curtains and we didn't feel overlooked at all). Being able to jump straight on the metro from outside your door is ideal. All in all very good value for money (for super expensive Paris!).

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and comfort at the Eiffel Seine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItchyfeetUK
Reviews.Content: Returned recently from a three night stay in Paris at the Eiffel Seine. We were pleasantly suprised at the cleanliness and comfort level of the hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to any of our friends. The location opposite Bir Hakeim metro and 5 minutes from RER Champs de Mar/ Eiffel Tower made it an ideal centre for touring the sights of Paris. The proximity to the embankment of the Seine was a bonus. Noel & Sarah Bearcroft - United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: justinzgirlkb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right beside the Bir Hakeim metro stop and about a five minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms, while not the biggest, were well maintained, decorated nicely, and cleaned and made up every days (the bathrooms were absolutely spotless). The staff were very friendly and personable, but tried to charge us for two breakfasts that we did not eat. So, make sure you look carefully at your bill. Overall, it was a very nice hotel. Compared to other hotels of similar quality, it seemed like a good value. Would return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: KorDo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through venere which had the lowest price of any other site I looked and had no problems with it so would rec. using it. I did allot of research before booking to get the most out of my money and not have to spend much time on travel from each of the things I wanted to see, so I thought this was the perfect hotel for my wife and I. The greatest thing about this hotel is it's location. The eiffel tower is just around the corner and you can catch a bateux mouche for a seine river cruise just across from the eiffel tower. It is also literally right across the street from the Metro (line 6), which was a site for sore eyes after carrying your luggage and baby stroller around metro stations (needless to say Paris is not a wheelchair/handicapped friendly city so if you can't handle stairs just take a shuttle or taxi from place to place). Line 6 takes you right to the Arc de triumphe and easy to get to the louvre. It is also just about 2 blocks from RER line C which takes you right to Versailles( which is beautiful). I have trusted trip advisor before and they didn't let me down on this one either. However, some have said this isn't a good place to go if you have children but I thought it was fine for me, my wife, and one year old son. They had a baby crib in the room waiting for us despite saying the room was too small for it. The room was small but fit the crib and all of our luggage just fine. I thought our room was very clean and linens and towels were changed everyday. The bathroom is in a modern style so there are some quirky things to it, like not having a place to hold the hand soap around the sink, but overall just fine. There's a nice restaurant right next to the hotel that has a small take out stand/creperie if you want a late night snack, although I would stay away from the crepes there as they're pre-maid and not as good as fresh one's (per my French wife). There's a nice supermarket with a bakery in front which we ate breakfast from everyday and is allot cheaper than the hotels breakfast which we never ate. I also highly recommend the lebanese restaurant a few blocks down the street, order take out if you can b/c its quite expensive if you dine in. Overall great hotel with a superb location. I highly rec. it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Austexmama
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Paris. Our first few days, we stayed at the Hotel Warwick Champs-Elysses, but moved to the Eiffel Seine in the middle of our trip to experience something more "boutiquey." We wish we had stayed there the entire time --it cost much, much less and was much more cozy. All in all the Eiffel Seine is a LOVELY hotel. Everything is small compared to our U.S-grand scale, but for Paris standards, the room was quite spacious. Ask for a large room on the first floor , and request to face the courtyard. (The rooms facing the front face the metro station, which is literally right outside the hotel). Beware of the elevator - it's slow and tiny -- I'm clausterphobic and wouldn't even look inside it! Sara and the rest of the staff are absolutely lovely -- we voted Sara our Favorite Person in Paris -- she made reservations galore and gave us directions, all while being extremely friendly and patient with us. Spring for the extra few Euros and get the breakfast which is included - very nice little restaurant downstairs! Other good points: it's located just a few blocks from the Eiffel tower, there's an ATM right across the street, and a nice little market down the road where you can get basics for your stay. (We opted to save money buy eating food from the market for lunches and going out for nice dinners). There is also a funny little guy who makes delicious crepes on the corner right outside the hotel -- they're open quite late. The nicest thing about this hotel is the manner in which the staff handles its guests -- they treat you like friends and familiy and don't have the slightest stereotypical Parisian attitude. We'd go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Trouble at the Eiffel Seine!”
Reviews.Author: MannyNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: Upon first impression the Eiffel Seine is quaint, quiet and clean. The breakfast were good, the staff nice and the room's well maintained and quiet. Experienced some trouble with the television and receiving CNN and the BBC, the only two English channels available. When we brought this to their attention they did what they could to rectify the problem but to no avail. Trouble arose when my mother found that she had 100 Euro's missing from her wallet. We passed this off as a minor slip of the memory and continued on with our stay. Unfortunatly, four days later another 100 Euro's went missing from my mother's purse while we were eating breakfast downstairs. Someone had entered the room with a master key and when they left they did not close the door entirely . When we brought this to the attention of the hotel manager she came off as annoyed and offended. Her suggestion after ranting about her knowledge of her employee's was to report the incident to the police, which is what we did. I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah-Mae
Reviews.Content: Came back from this hotel on the 26th February 2007. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel, room was small but it was enough for us as we only used it as a base. Decor is lovely in the hotel. bathrooms was spotless so was room, could not fault how clean it was. Cleaned everyday. Bed was soo comfy and big was great. Had a electronic safe in the room which was fab really put our mind at ease when leaving money and passports in room. Staff were excellent, very helpful, could not fault them. They have a cupboard which is locked away if you wanted to put your bags there once you have checked out. The check in was 2pm but we arrived early and were told we could go to our room. You dont get distured too, once you hand your key in the reception radios through to the cleaner that its ok to go and clean your room. Breakfast in bed is avaliable at no extra cost. Didnt really rate the breakfast, as it was not to our taste but everone is different. Location is really good right in front of the Bir Hakeim metro, but its easy walking distance from the sights. Use the Batobus at the Eiffel Tower stop great source of transport seeing the sights on water. Overall i would definately go back to this hotel, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alm3109
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, spotless, tiny room (as expected) but good size bathroom. I was travelling alone and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. Great location. I ended up going back for an extra night - just really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eiffel Seine!”
Reviews.Author: hoobastanker
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of February. We absolutely loved it! As indicated by other visitors, the location is ideal, right across from the metro station Bir-Hakeim (Metro 6) and the Eiffel Tower is literally 3/4 mins walk. A great base! We used the Open Tour bus (there is a stop at the Eiffel Tower) and Metro to see Paris, and so this location was fantastic! The room was small but clean and there was a large shower, which was great. The breakfast in the morning was excellent, croissants, fruit juice, fruit, tea / coffee, toast and yoghurts. I would heartily reccommend it, and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: qtie
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay in this hotel and found the whole experience very enjoyable... We stayed in deluxe room (which was huge- by Paris standards) with a good size ensuite bathroom. The rooms were kept very clean with fresh linen and towels.. The whole hotel was very clean and pleasant.. The lift is tiny- not for anyone who might be afraid of tight spaces!!! The breakfast is overcharged at â‚¬14 per person for the usual continental style (we did not get breakfast included and ate out instead) Excellent location - across the road from a metro stop (Bir Hakim - Line 6) which leads directly to Charles Degualle Etoile (the main hub of the Paris metro system) and two minutes walk from the Eiffel tower. Safe neighbourhood and easy to wander about in.. well worth a look if you want a great value hotel with a city centre location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: biff07
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great location, the rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful. The hotel is located across the street from Bir Hakim metro stop, easy access to Versaille and other destinations in Paris. There are many local shops and best of all it is located with in 3 mins of the Eiffel Tower. I will be suggesting the Eiffel Seine to all of my friends. Thanks Eiffel Seine for a great experience. Bill Pratt - USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: HenryIX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year, read about locks not working on rooms, and quelle suprise, they were right! We were moved to another hotel for our 1st night, which was awful, but next two nights back at Eiffel Seine, we were upgraded to superior room, which still had a slightly dodgy door lock. The Hotel is nice though, the staff friendly and helpful, (as were all the Parisiennes that we came across). Recommend this, tiny but charming hotel, and the Italian Restaurant on the corner is great too!

Reviews.Title: “What a little Gem....”
Reviews.Author: travelA1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a month in Europe and spent the last 5 nights at this hotel. We had the family room for 5 and were so happily surprised that it was actually 2 rooms with 2 bathrooms. The rooms were some of the most comfortable of all our trips although small we knew that Paris hotels were never going to be large. The bathrooms were lovely and the towels wonderful and thick. The reception staff were amazingly helpful, helped us organise our 25th Anniversay dinner for the family at a wonderful restaurant, always had great suggestions,.and nothing ever seemed to be too much trouble for them. There are some nice restaurants in the area, and laundromat not to far either for those travelling with a big family. The fact that the metro and the RER and within steps of the hotel is also a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveller2006
Reviews.Content: we only stayed here for one night but the room was fantastic. we had a deluxe room - with king bed, nice bathroom and very spacious. the staff were friendly although our room was not ready on time. hotel is great location - near bars and restaurants. it is convenient as right next to metro station (but you dont hear the trains which is good!). i would recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: toonsteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for two nights. The hotel is definitely well-located for the metro as it's directly opposite! If you're not staying long in Paris, use the metro as the city is vast and it's a great way to get you around Paris easily. As the Hotel's name suggests, it's very close to the tower and the Seine but quite a hike from the other attractions. The hotel is very quiet, new, clean and friendly. The reception is small but efficiently run - they give good advice and helped us to book a table in a popular restaurant. The bar is tiny and not well-stocked so buy drinks for the room from the nearby shops. We asked for some red wine on the last night and they couldn't find any! Overall, the room we got was value for money but not special. It was very small, with no tea/coffee facility but very clean and with flatscreen TV, modern bathroom etc. We got a coffee from the bar one cold morning and were charged about Â£5 for it - it would have been nice to be able to make our own. The hotel is ideal as a base. Get out into Paris for food and drinks and just use the hotel as a place to sleep and you'll be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: simpy49
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel. we stayed in the deluxe club room and all i can say is it was fantastic. everything about this place; the location, the decor, the staff all was amazing and helped make our holiday so enjoyable. the staff on reception were so so helpful, if it wasn't for them we would never of found our way around. if you are staying at that hotel enquire about the river seine nightime dinner cruise, worth every penny we had an amazing night. i am planning on going back to paris and will be looking forward to staying back at the eiffel seine. try it you'll love it. miss n simpson enland

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: motoiv
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a very convenient location to the Tower and many restaurants. The rooms have been recently renovated with first class fixtures and decor. Comfortable beds. Our rooms were not large however. Most attentive, friendly and knowledgable staff. Highly recommended. Note even the pullout bed was exceptionally comfortable. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “little jewel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: travellunatic
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at this hotel for three nights in Jan.The hotel itself was tastefully furnished and immaculate.The location was perfect ,three minutes walk from the eiffel tower.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.We took advantage of their shuttle bus service to and from Charles De Gaulle airport which is cheaper than taxis and can be arranged with reception before arrival.We had a wonderful time and will definatley stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “irish couple in paris”
Reviews.Author: num1dub
Reviews.Content: its a little gem, warm, friendly, modern. its only 6 mins walk to the Eiffel tower. Metro green line station across the road, with change overs from CDG airport it was very easy to get to.staff very frendly day & night, & very helpful(thanks guys).breakfast 14euro each ?, we dident try. enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaAvocado
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping did a nice job keeping it that way.The staff was very nice & helpful. The breakfast was much nicer than we expected, with a nice variety. We enjoyed the location of the hotel as it was close to sightseeing without being in a touristy area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful,& great location”
Reviews.Author: Speirbhean
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eiffel Seine hotel for 4 nights during November, the purpose of our trip was a romantic getaway and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the staff were very helpful and directed us to wherever we were going, even though the lift was broken on arrival it was fixed within a few hours as promised, which we were happy with.The hotel is in a great location within a few minutes walk of 2 main Metro lines and the Eiffel Seine. The rooms were functional, clean and were serviced every day.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday Sam”
Reviews.Author: fredfromwales
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location,very friendly staff.Clean and comfortable room,I would gladly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

HotelInfo.Name: Eiffel Seine Hotel Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 3, bd de Grenelle | 15 Arr., 75015 Paris, France
